results.description:
6:00 - 6:45 - register with security, mingle, drink & eat

6:45 - 7:00 - Haifeng Li - Transactional Big Data

7:00 - 8:00 - Rohit Jain - Apache Trafodion: Enterprise-Class Transactional SQL-on-Hadoop DBMS 

8:00 ~ 8:45  - Networking 

Hadoop has been very successful for analytics. But Doug Cutting, the Hadoop creator, predicted that, in the future, organizations will run all sorts of workloads on their Hadoop clusters, even online transaction processing (OLTP) workloads. Although Apache HBase and Apache Phoenix provide high throughput, low latency, random access on big data, developers struggle with the lack of ACID transactions. Trafodion is a world class Transactional SQL RDBMS running on HBase/Hadoop, currently in Apache incubation. In this talk we will discuss the characteristic of operational workloads, the operational use cases Trafodion addresses, and why Trafodion is the right solution for these use cases. In particular, we go in depth of what is the recipe for a world class database engine, and how Trafodion implements the ingredients that make up that recipe such as world class query optimizer, parallel data flow execution engine, distributed transaction management system, performance, scale, availability, and future directions, etc.


Speaker:
Rohit Jain is the CTO at Esgyn for Trafodion, a transactional SQL-on-HBase RDBMS. Rohit worked for Hewlett-Packard for 28 of his 39 years on applications and databases, as solutions architect, consultant, software engineer, architect, development and QA manager, Product Manager, and Chief Technologist, for Online Transaction Processing, Operational Data Stores, Data Marts, Enterprise Data Warehouses, Business Intelligence, and Advanced Analytics, on distributed massively parallel systems.
results.name: Transactions on Hadoop/HBase - Beer, Wine & Pizza

results.description:
This is an open invitation for those who might be interested in learning more about Grandmother Ceremonies in the Colombian tradition being practiced in the NY area. This information session encompasses the understanding of this tradition, protocols, preparations and risks, why is it used back in the jungle and why is coming out of this sacred space into our cities.

Taita Fredy grew up around the medicine, he comes from Mallama, Nariño, a región south west of Colombia, between the Pacific and the Amazon jungle in this area he’s experienced the medicine in different traditions, learning as an apprentice and helper for Elders from the Siona, Inga, Kamentzá, Yanacona and Awá communities, For the last 15 years he’s been working with the medicine himself and developing his own ceremony based on all he’s learned. In the present Fredy has found himself traveling around the world, sharing his ceremony, his medicine and his heart with people from different cultures and backgrounds, this as he believes, is part of his mission in this life to take this knowledge and healing to those who need it.

Fredy is a humble man who doesn’t believe in one only truth, he keeps his heart open to all believes, and bases his work in the concepts of love and freedom. There is no obligation, no dependence, and no commitment to a group or believe, just respect.

During the two-hour sessions, Fredy will share not only information but also his gift as a sound healer, interpreting melodies that he uses to guide the Singing Meditation Ceremonies.
results.name: Ancestral Journey Information Session

Christmas Blues Rock Ensemble

Join our Christmas Blues Rock Ensemble in time to perform a great Holiday show in December!
We’ll be playing Christmas classics “Merry Christmas, Baby”, “Please come home for Christmas”, “JIngle Bell Rock” and more!
We’ll have 10 practices and then perform on Sunday, December 13th at Arlene’s Grocery at 3pm. 

SHOW

The show will be at Arlene's Grocery in the East Village December 13th at 1pm(soundcheck) and doors at 2pm. Our show will be at 3pm. Arlene's is an awesome show venue with professional stage, sound and lights, everyone will be miked or amplified. If you are coming to rehearsal with a portable amp you should also bring it to the venue.

We will have a drummer and a singer TBA.

There will be tickets for this show, they can be purchase before hand (starting in November) at $5 or at the door for $10.

There is a show fee of $30 for each ensemble member that will go toward venue, sound engineer and hired musicians costs.

Arlene's Grocery is strictly 21+ and no children will be allowed at the show even if they are accompanied by the parent, I'm sorry:( :(

There are two bars on site and lots of food spots and great restaurants in the area for before or after the show.

CALENDAR

Our practice schedule starts Thursday 6-8pm on October 1st.

It is important that you attend to as many as you can if you plan on performing, a required 7 session minimum will be necessary to perform and VERY IMPORTANT that you come to the last 2 practices which will be with a drummer and a singer

results.description:
Abstract:

In this talk we try to show that neural networks are a useful tool for predicting price changes on the international currency markets. We hope this will highlight the potential of neural networks to solve a large set of the data challenges faced by financial institutions. Specifically we’ll show how we applied recurrent neural networks (RNNs) with long short-term memory (LSTM) using a regularization technique called “dropout” to financial data. We extend work done by Zaremba, Sutskever, and Vinyals in Recurrent Neural Network Regularization.

Speaker Bio:


Stephen Piron is a sometimes-vegetarian, a mediocre computer programmer and life-long friend to the self-starting geek. 

About DeepLearni.ng

DeepLearni.ng is a Toronto based fintech startup who believe that artificial intelligence can solve the toughest problems faced by financial institutions. They aim to be the ‘anti-bank’ --- a company where the best and brightest feel comfortable to be technically creative. More info can be found at DeepLearni.ng .
results.name: Using Deep Neural Networks To Predict Foreign Exchange Prices

results.description:
For just $25 you can taste 8 modestly priced Bordeaux wines, a white, 6 reds & a desert wine with assorted cheeses. These wines are all drinkable now & cost less than $15/bottle. 

Our hosts for the evening, Camille Suspene & Clemence Vizier, represent Univitas, the largest exporter of Bordeaux wines. 

                                                 Camille Suspene:  


                                                   Clemence Vizier:

Both Camille & Clemence speak fluent English & French, while Clemence also speaks Swedish.  So, if you are looking for the perfect menu to pair with both Bordeaux wines & Akvavit, it is a certainty that Clemence will oblige!  All kidding aside, these two globe-trotting Bordeaux wine marketeers have worked in a range of exotic & familiar markets, such Arvert, Bordeaux & Lyons, France, Montreal, Canada, Chicago, Cleveland, New Jersey, New York & Philadelphia! So, I am sure they will bring their very valuable & unusual experiences to bear on our appreciation of these wines and the region of Bordeaux.


Please join us for a casual wine tasting of Bordeaux wines that are accessible to both palate & wallet.

While various cheese and breads will  be served, you may wish to order appetizers or a full dinner, There are several fine restaurants nearby that deliver. Here is a partial list:

Frank’s Pizza, Monica's Italian Restaurant, Selenita Mexican Restaurant, Taqueria la Juquilita Mexican Restaurant, Hing Lee Chinese Restaurant, & Khao Tip Thai Restaurant.

Menus will be available.

All wines presented by Camille & Clemence will be available for sale.

Here’s the line-up…

Mayne Sansac Grand Vin de Bordeaux Blanc 2014 

Bordeaux, France       

www.univitis.com       

50% Sauvignon, 25% Muscadelle, 25% Sémillon, an elegant & refined Bordeaux with a floral & fruity bouquet, its first impression of clean, dry freshness becoming rich & soft in the mouth. This wine is ideal served at 10°/11°C with fish & white meats, or simply enjoy it on its own.

Terroir

Mayne Sansac vineyard is located in a clay-limestone terroir. This type of soil joins the freshness of the clay and the filtering properties of the limestone.

Vinification & Aging

Grapes are harvested when they have reached a perfect maturity. Then on one side, the Sauvignon blanc grapes are macerated with enzymes in a stainless steel tank while Semillion and Muscadelle grapes are pressed to obtain juice; Once mixed together, the fermentation lasts about 6 months in the tank at 20°C in order to preserve all the aromas: the Sauvignon grapes give the wine its concentrated spicy aroma; the well ripened Semillon grapes its richness and roundness.

Mayne Sansac Grand Vin de Bordeaux Rouge 2010 

Bordeaux, France       

www.univitis.com       

50% Merlot, 25% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Cabernet Franc… this is a distinguished Bordeaux with a well-balanced structure enhancing a complex bouquet of red fruits. First impression of supple tannins is followed by a long & velvety aftertaste - a Bordeaux red with a touch of aristocracy. Can last up to 4 or 5 years to gain maturity & best served at 15° / 16° C accompanied by all types of meat & cheese.

Terroir

Mayne Sansac vineyard is located in a clay-limestone terroir. This type of soil joins the freshness of the clay and the filtering properties of the limestone which is a perfect suit for the Merlot vine. Wines that come from this type of terroir are generally round with few tannins & lovely fruity notes.

Vinification & Aging

Univitis’ winemakers use the traditional Bordeaux vinification techniques. Indeed, the grapes are harvested at perfect maturity & vinified with selected yeasts & temperature controlled. Average fermentation 8 to 10 days. This wine is ready for drinking but can be stored up to 5 years. It has all the elegance & finesse of the best wines from the most famous vineyards in the world.

Château Bayerette 2012   

Bordeaux, France       

www.univitis.com   

60% Merlot & 40% Cabernet Sauvignon… the good balance of grape varieties produce the structured red Bordeaux that with time, age well. Best served at 16ºC accompanied by traditional gastronomic food with cheese.

Soil: Clay and calcareous ground.

Vinification: Yield mastering, Polyphenol Analysis, Traditional Bordeaux Wine making, Temperature mastering, Pneumatic pressing.

Aging: Matured in stainless steel vats before bottling. Storage in temperature controlled cellars for 6 months.

Surface: The vineyards of Chateau Bayerette has been dedicated to the tradition of vine cultivations for more than 120 years.

Production: 500 HL

Château Pierre Plantée 2011   

Bordeaux, France       

www.univitis.com   

65% Merlot & 35% Cabernet Sauvignon… Rich & luscious with a fragrance of red fruits, a velvety satin texture & hints of cherry & black current on the palate. Full in flavor, supple with very gentle tannins in the mouth & with a soft lingering finish. Great by itself, with red meats or soft cheeses.

Soil: Clay and limestone.

Vinification: Yield mastering, Polyphénol Analysis, Traditional Bordeaux Wine- making, Temperature mastering, Pneumatic pressing. The vinification takes place in the most modern cellars of the region where the grapes are not crushed but gently squeezed.

Aging: Matured in stainless steel vats before bottling. Storage in temperature controlled cellars for 6 months.

Surface: The vineyard around 10 HA of ChâteauPierre Plantée is located in the region of Castillon la Bataille.

Production: 250 HL

Château la Mondette 2010 

Bordeaux, France       

www.univitis.com     

“Commended” - Decanter World Wine Awards

82% Merlot & 18% Cabernet Sauvignon, the wine is dark ruby red in color. It has rich aromas of prune, leather & underbrush. Your palette explodes with flavors of ripe red berries. Château La Mondette is a fruity, rich, full, and with much complexity. Tannins are young but very supple in the finish just beg you for another sip, and then another! This wine would pair best with savory garlic marinated steaks, with a baked beef stew or herbed lamb chops. Or try just to sip this wine with some very sharp white cheddar cheese, and a handful of ripe red skinned grapes!

Vinification: Yield mastering, Polyphénol Analysis, Traditional Bordeaux Wine-making, Temperature mastering, Pneumatic pressing.

Aging: Half aged in stainless steel vats, half in French oak barrels.

Soil: Boulbènes on clay and sandy soils. Nathalie Valentuzzi und Xavier Aubry own this property of 4.5 Hectares since several years in a small village Salle de Castillon not far from Bordeaux.

Surface: The vineyard of Chateau Les Paris covers 10 hectares around Sainte-Foy.

Production: 100 HL

Château Clovis Grand Vin de Bordeaux 2011 

Bordeaux, France       

www.univitis.com     

78% Merlot & 22% Cabernet Sauvignon makes the Château Clovis a delicious red wine with a dark red color, nice fragrance of ripe red fruits and smooth and gentle in taste. Delicious to drink now but will show more complexity in the coming years. Best Served at Best at 17° 18°. This wine accompanies perfectly red meat, cheeses.

Vinification: The vinification takes place in the most modern cellars of the region where the grapes are not crushed but gently squeezed.

Aging: Matured in stainless steel vats before bottling. Storage in temperature controlled cellars for 6 months.

Soil: Clay and sandy clay and limestone

Surface: The 5 hectars Vineyards of Château Clovis are situated in the beautiful hills of the Dordogne Valley.

Production: 250 HL

Château Les Paris 2011 

Bordeaux, France       

www.univitis.com  

Top 100 Bordeaux Wines in the USA – Today’s Bordeaux 2014

Sainte-Foy-Bordeaux is an appellation on the eastern edge of the Bordeaux wine region in France. It produces dry wines, both red & white, of average quality. It is arguable that Sainte-Foy-Bordeaux is more properly part of the Bergerac region rather than Bordeaux – it is located outside the natural eastern boundary of Bordeaux rdgion, and just a few miles west of Bergerac.

46% Merlot, 41% Cabernet Sauvignon & 13% Cabernet Franc… Deep crimson with ruby tints. The nose is lively & generous with aromas of red fruit & liquorice. Structured & rounded on the palate with a long finish revealing lovely mature tannins, mild & silky. Just the wine to be laid down in a cellar for two or three years to reach its best. Perfect with meat in sauce, game & cheeses.

Vinification: The vinification takes place in the most modern cellars of the region where the grapes are not crushed but gently squeezed.

Aging: Half aged in stainless steel vats, half in French oak barrels.

Soil: Clay and limestone.

Surface: The vineyard of Château Les Paris covers 10 hectares around Sainte-Foy

Production: 100 HL

Domaine de la Guillonie Monbazillac 2012 

Bordeaux, France       

www.univitis.com   

97% Semillon, 2% Muscadelle, 1% Sauvignon, Monbazillac is a discreet pale gold colored wine. It has a bouquet with notes of dried fruit and acacia. Well balanced on the palate and full flavored in the mouth.

Vinification: Separated and traced vinification, cold racking of the must, careful selection over ripened grapes, temperature controlled fermentation (18°C).

Aging: In stainless steel. Storage in temperature-controlled cellars before commercialization.

Soil: Clay and Limestone

Surface: A discreet pale gold colored wine. It has a bouquet with notes of dried fruit and acacia. Well balanced on the palate and full flavored in the mouth.
results.name: Taste 8 Bordeaux Wines @ Amazing Grapes in Pompton Lakes, Only $25!

Join Be Social Change and the New York Corporate Social Responsibility Meetup on Thursday, October 15th for a panel discussion on the Future of Corporate Social Responsibility - Can Business Be Used as a Force for Good? as we explore the trends, challenges, and best practices in CSR.

====================================== 

** OFFICIAL RSVP on Eventbrite. Register: bit.ly/BSCFoCSR **

=======================================

There is a growing expectation that businesses take into account not only their bottom line but also the impact they have on society and the environment. Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) is a business practice that involves company initiatives that give back - for example, donating a portion of proceeds to charity, minimizing carbon emissions and waste, organizing employee volunteer opportunities, or initiating cause-marketing programs - each designed to use business as a force for good.

With more companies integrating CSR practices, this panel discussion will explore the challenges and opportunities of using business to positively impact society and the environment. How do businesses meet these imperatives while maintaining their economic competitiveness? How can they measure, track, and report on the impact that CSR initiatives have on both their community and their bottom-line? And how will these trends affect the future of how we do business?

====================================== 

** OFFICIAL RSVP on Eventbrite. Register: bit.ly/BSCFoCSR **

=======================================

{Drinks and snacks will be provided!}

Join the conversation on Twitter:

@BeSocialChange | @MarcosSalazar | @whatifglobal | @AmanSinghCSR | @EdelmanPR | @vera_oziransky | @BSRnews | @UPS | #givelocal | @KopaliOrganics

SCHEDULE

6:30-7:00pm - Doors open, Check-in

7:00-8:30pm - Program, Panel Discussion, Q&A

8:30 - Closing & Networking

FEATURED PANELISTS

• Aman Singh, VP of Business + Social Purpose, Edelman

• Vera Oziransky, Public Health Consultant

Aman Singh, VP of Business + Social Purpose, Edelman

Aman Singh is one of the first journalists to focus on CSR and sustainability issues in the mainstream media, including leading coverage for Forbes CSR blog. She is a seasoned communicator, an enthusiastic social media strategist and an avid facilitator for stakeholder engagement, working through her firm -- Singh Solutions  -on authentic and contextual CSR/sustainability reporting and communication strategies.

Before joining Edelman’s Business + Social Purpose team in New York as a Vice President, she served as CSRwire's Editorial Director, leading the media company's news distribution services, creating and growing its stakeholder engagement campaigns and CSR/sustainability reporting services with private and public sector organizations like JPMorgan Chase, Unilever, Johnson & Johnson, Campbell Soup, Nestle Waters North America, Best Buy, PwC, SAP, Verizon, Sodexo, General Mills, Aramark, and others and collaborating with its 8,000+ members on content and conversations that matter. She also led CSRwire's team of reporters with 250+ contributors while authoring numerous articles and live reports across the platform’s 25+ issue areas.

David Korngold, Manager of Advisory Services, BSR

David is a Manager, Advisory Services at BSR, a global nonprofit business network and consultancy dedicated to sustainability.  He works with multinational corporations to help them integrate sustainability and stakeholder perspectives into their core business strategies. Concentrating on the technology and financial services sectors, David leads initiatives with companies including AT&T, KKR, and IBM, on topics such as the environment, human rights, and inclusive economies.  Additionally, David has created and facilitated corporate trainings, written articles and research papers, and served as a panelist/speaker at international conferences hosted by organizations such as Dow Jones and the Private Equity Growth Capital Council.

In advancing corporate sustainability, David applies his prior experience as a strategy and management consultant at Bain & Company. In that role, he developed evidence-driven approaches to advise companies on issues ranging from operational organization to corporate strategy. Additionally, David has worked as an independent consultant in sustainability and nonprofit governance.

Follow BSR on Twitter: @BSCnews

Vera Oziransky, Public Health Consultant

Vera Oziransky served as the project manager at The Vitality Institute, where she led the Institute’s work on evidence-based workplace and community health promotion, focusing on a holistic approach to health, which includes both physical and mental wellbeing. Ms. Oziransky also led the Institute’s work on healthy design, promoting the co-benefits of designing for health and sustainability and co-authored the report “Beyond the Four Wall: Why Community is Critical to Workforce Health,” calling for increased cross-sector collaboration to address community-level drivers of workforce health.

Previously, Ms. Oziransky was the Senior Policy Analyst at the New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene’s Office of External Affairs. She led the development of Take Care New York, the city’s five year health agenda, and provided expertise in the development of the health department’s priority policy initiatives. Prior to this role, Ms. Oziransky directed New York City’s tobacco mentoring activities for Centers for Disease Control and Prevention’s Communities Putting Prevention to Work initiative, consulting with 12 health departments nationwide on tobacco control policy, media, and coalition building.

Follow Vera on Twitter: @vera_oziransky

Laura James, HR Manager, UPS

Laura is the East Region Community Relations Manager for UPS with the responsibility of managing the UPS Local Grants program for her respective territory and implementing UPS's strategy to advance the company's commitment to making local communities stronger

A 20-year UPS veteran, Laura began her career in New York City as a part-time employee in the Industrial Engineering Department and was later promoted into Industrial Engineering management upon receiving her degree in organizational management.

After a number of assignments within Industrial Engineering including roles in Package and Transportation operations, Laura then rotated into Human Resources and has held assignments within Employee Relations, Learning & Development and Workforce planning before assuming her current role.

Laura currently sits on the boards of St. Nicks Alliance, Playworks of Greater NY/NJ, and the Tri State Diversity Council.

Marcos Salazar, Co-Founder + Executive Director, Be Social Change

Marcos Salazar is a social entrepreneur, career + life coach, consultant, speaker, andcommunity builder. His passion is working with professionals, entrepreneurs, and creatives to help them pursue work they are passionate about, build authentic personal brands, become financially successful, and create lives that make the world a better place. He does this through 1-on-1 coaching, nonprofit and businesses consulting, and on a larger scale as Co-founder + Executive Director of Be Social Change where he’s built the largest social impact community and professional development hub in New York City. Marcos earned a B.A. in Psychology from Amherst College as well as a Masters in Organizational Management and an Executive Leadership Coaching certificate from The George Washington University. Marcos is a board member of the Young Professionals Nonprofit Network and an American Express Leadership Academy Fellow. You can learn more about him at www.MarcosSalazar.com.  

Follow Marcos on Twitter: @marcossalazar & @BeSocialChange

results.description:
In love we find out who we want to be.
In war we find out who we are.

FRANCE, 1939

In the quiet village of Carriveau, Vianne Mauriac says goodbye to her husband, Antoine, as he heads for the Front. She doesn't believe that the Nazis will invade France...but invade they do, in droves of marching soldiers, in caravans of trucks and tanks, in planes that fill the skies and drop bombs upon the innocent. When a German captain requisitions Vianne's home, she and her daughter must live with the enemy or lose everything. Without food or money or hope, as danger escalates all around them, she is forced to make one impossible choice after another to keep her family alive.

Vianne's sister, Isabelle, is a rebellious eighteen-year-old girl, searching for purpose with all the reckless passion of youth. While thousands of Parisians march into the unknown terrors of war, she meets Gäetan, a partisan who believes the French can fight the Nazis from within France, and she falls in love as only the young can...completely. But when he betrays her, Isabelle joins the Resistance and never looks back, risking her life time and again to save others.

With courage, grace and powerful insight, bestselling author Kristin Hannah captures the epic panorama of WWII and illuminates an intimate part of history seldom seen: the women's war. The Nightingale tells the stories of two sisters, separated by years and experience, by ideals, passion and circumstance, each embarking on her own dangerous path toward survival, love, and freedom in German-occupied, war-torn France--a heartbreakingly beautiful novel that celebrates the resilience of the human spirit and the durability of women. It is a novel for everyone, a novel for a lifetime.
results.name: The Nightingale by Kristen Hannah

Let's get together and share the joy and the chaos of intuitive writing! 

You may be a Tarot knower or you may be a writer - yes, journaling, songwriting, and indeed poetry count and score high points too - and you may be neither - no knowledge of Tarot cards or writing whatsoever - and yet! You are a creative and intuitive person who loves to learn and co-create with like minded souls. Learn the art of Tarot reading and share your insight - find yourself better and stronger at the daily integration of life's happenings - from trivial to grave - all of your life matters…

Better Off Bowling is kicking off a new season on Sunday afternoons this Fall and I thought I'd create an event for our group since there was a lot of interest previously! We played last season and it was a blast! Just to be clear, you have to register/pay through the leagues website in order to be a part of the league, not just RSVP here! :)

results.description:
A dark and thrilling tale of new friends made in a cold and chilling suburb of Sweden that is haunted by ritual killings of bodies drained of blood.                          


// Book  
 Let the Right One In, John Ajvide Lindqvist 
*Note: This book also goes by the name Let Me In.
It is autumn 1981 when the inconceivable comes to Blackeberg, a suburb in Sweden. The body of a teenage boy is found, emptied of blood, the murder rumored to be part of a ritual killing. Twelve-year-old Oskar is personally hoping that revenge has come at long last—revenge for the bullying he endures at school, day after day.

But the murder is not the most important thing on his mind. A new girl has moved in next door—a girl who has never seen a Rubik’s Cube before, but who can solve it at once. There is something wrong with her, though, something odd. And she only comes out at night....


// Location 
Acme, 9 Great Jones St. 
Join us in this dark, cavernous, candle-lit, chamber bar under the Acme restaurant. The reservation is in the downstairs lounge under the name Anastasia; we'll have tables by the bar. 
Menu available here. 


// Dues
This book club does not require annual membership dues. However, we kindly ask that attendees bring $2 cash to the event to cover Meetup fees and the occasional book giveaway!


// Book Giveaway
Book giveaway will be announced closer to Meetup date.


// Next Month
Join us next month for the AMERICAN FRONTIER. Vote here for next month's book.

results.description:
3rd Hudson County Flippers and Funders Networking Event


Date: Thursday, October 15th 

Time: 7:00-10:00PM

Location: Zeppelin Hall Beirgarten, 88 Liberty View Drive, Jersey City, NJ

Schedule: Open Networking from 7-10PM

Cost: $10 (cards accepted)

RSVP:  Sign up on our group page at http://www.meetup.com/Hudson-County-Flippers-and-Funders/ or email your name and any guests to [masked]. After the event, contact information of all who attend and participate will be emailed out to everyone.

Funding For Deals

If you are in need of funding for a deal, all Flippers and Funders Events are Sponsored by Alpha Funding Solutions.  Alpha funds 80-90% of Purchase Price and 100% of Renovation Costs.  Loan sizes range from 100K to 10 Million.  If you would like to learn more about Alpha’s program, reach out to me directly at [masked].

2-Day Education Event – Wholesaling and Rehabbing

If you are interested in learning about wholesaling, rehabbing, or both, you should absolutely checkout this two-day event: http://www.eventbrite.com/e/insiders-double-decker-weekend-workshop-tickets-18811990169

For more info on what the event will be covering, checkout my interview with Rob Orfino and Glen Galucci at this link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mxxrFGODI8w

If you’re looking to get started in real estate, or just sharpen your skills, this is a can’t miss event!

Professional Organizing

If you are in need of Professional Organizing Services, or Packing/Unpacking Services, reach out to us at [masked].

TV Show Casting – First Time Flippers

If you’re interested in auditioning for the TV Show First Time Flippers, email your contact information to [masked] and we will have them reach out to you. 

TV Show Casting – Calling All Experienced Couples!

Departure Films is now casting for a new television show in development. They are looking for flipping couples in the Essex County area to be the next great TV flipping team. Couples must have big personalities and have a passion for real estate. Couples must also have experience and a knowledge of real estate investing.

If this sounds like you, please email us at <a>[masked]</a>. Include a brief introduction along with a few photos of yourselves. Please also include some before and after photos of your recent project(s).

Gap Funding For Deals

If you are interested in providing gap funding for other investors’ deals, we maintain a list of gap funders to refer people to.  If you are interested in gap funding as a way to make a nice return or to learn the business, email us your contact info and how much you’re looking to invest at [masked] and we will add you to the list.

Sponsorship

If you are interested in becoming a sponsor of this event, reach out to us at [masked].

Flippers and Funders Event Schedule

NYC Event: Monday, November 2nd

http://www.meetup.com/NYC-Flippers-and-Funders-Meetup/

Jersey Shore Event: Wednesday, November 4th 

http://www.meetup.com/Jersey-Shore-Flippers-and-Funders-Meetup/

Note: Please join our newly-made chat channel


OK, so we compiled a couple of interesting questions and possible projects from the first meetup. Let's build on this.


• What can we listen to?


•  What is legal to listen to?


• How do we show the limitations of radio, both physical and legal?

• How do we build a low-cost 'node' to capture interesting information?

• Could this be an adafruit kit? Could we make learn.adafruit.com experiments for interested people?


• How do we make it easy to use and understand?

• What would a radio 'field guide' look like, like http://seeingnetworks.in/nyc/ ?

• Can we make easy-to-understand and follow antennae building guides?

We are experimenting with changing spaces all around the city, and have identified friendly ones:

School for Poetic Computation

IRL Space

NYU CUSP

NYC Resistor

Babycastles

ITP?

NYU Poly Wireless Center?

Are there other places we could work out of? Please share them!

results.description:
ArtsTech returns to Projective Space this month with a discussion on the artist as entrepreneur, sponsored by Monegraph. While the familiarity of galleries and other traditional models is sufficient for the sale and distribution of some artwork, there is much left to be desired for artists. 

Monegraph CEO Kevin McCoy will offer a first-hand demo and his insights on building Monegraph, a platform for media rights management. Our extraordinary panelists include the writer Mike Pepi, gallerist Kelani Nichole, artist Martha Hipley, alt-consultancy group K-HOLE, and moderator Raj Udeshi of Emerging Collective, all of whom are looking to dive into the following guiding questions:


-What are other models or disruptions that we're seeing today-- either an individual artist or an organization -- that are bucking the traditional approach? 

-How is success defined for an artist? If measured by revenue—do we weigh the total figure that goes to the studio or to individual artworks? 

-Why do we look to the startup model for artists? How do we characterize the definition of a startup?

**We encourage attendees to Monegraph their work--additionally, any monegraphed work has a chance to be featured in the $25,000 #thisismymonegraph campaign for future advertising campaigns.***

Schedule:

7:00pm – Doors and Monegraph open demo

7:30-8:30pm – Panel Discussion

8:30-9:30pm – Conversation continues over drinks & snacks

Speakers:

Mike Pepi writes about aesthetics, theory, and criticism. His work has appeared in frieze, e-flux, Flash Art, Art in America, DIS Magazine, The Straddler, The New Inquiry, Artwrit, The Art Newspaper, this is tomorrow,艺术界 LEAP, the Apollo Magazine Blog, Big Red & Shiny, The Brooklyn Rail, Rhizome, and The New Criterion. He is a contributing editor at The Straddler, and organizes Cloud-Based Institutional Critique, a reading group focused on digital technologies and their relationship to cultural institutions.

Kelani Nichole is an independent curator and user-centered design specialist working at the intersection of art and technology. She is co-founder and director of TRANSFER Gallery, an exhibition space exploring the friction between networked studio practice and its physical instantiation.  The gallery's focus is to develop new modes of exhibition and support for artists working with computer-based practices.

Martha Hipley is an artist working in digital and paint, occasionally under the brand everyoneisugly. Her blog “tramps-l’oeil” documents her work with male fashion photography and Tumblr fandom. In addition to being awarded a Rhizome microgrant for her project “Untitled Twitter Hack,” she is also the second best web surfer in the world.

Sean Monahan (K-HOLE) is a member of K-HOLE, a trend forecasting group based in New York. K-HOLE is a future trends report that both elevates and parodies the ridiculous but inspirational vocabulary of people trying to predict the future of consumerism.

Moderator:

Raj Udeshi is co-founder of Hidden Levers, a financial technology startup company providing financial advisors and professional traders with Web-based tools to assess macro risks and stress test portfolios. Raj Udeshi is also founder of Emerging Collective, a foundation supporting activist artists from emerging markets.

Sponsor:

Monegraph is a professional licensing platform, offering a new direction for how creators of all kinds can distribute, market and sell their digital work online. Monegraph’s platform simplifies the often complex process of media licensing by pairing a template-driven interface for contract creation with a streamlined process for payment processing and media handling. It creates a simple and pervasive mechanism for publishers, advertisers and collectors to 
discover creative work and purchase it directly from the creators while offering clear and verifiable licenses and ownership history.

Conceived by Artist & CEO Kevin McCoy at the New Museum in 2014, the platform has pioneered an innovative approach to media rights management based on blockchain technology. The use of blockchain architecture allows a clear link to be established between the author of a work and its title of ownership, its constellation of usage rights, and payment terms for handling those rights.
results.name: Disruption in the Art World: Artist as Entrepreneur

results.description:
Are  you secretive about your money? Do you worry about money? Do you have a love-hate relationship with money?  Money is energy and a tool of exchange.  Our beliefs and behaviors, conscious and unconscious about money, influence how we experience our current financial reality.


Join Special Guest Enid Martinez and explore your unique dynamics with money by becoming aware of your money archetypes and how these influence your present money behaviors and experience.

In this presentation we will briefly discuss the money archetypes, what are they and how they effect, passively or actively, your current money experience.  These archetypes are always present regardless of socio-economics.  The great news is that these archetypes, once you are aware of them, can be utilized to your advantage as these can be your allies and help you to change your current money dynamics into one of empowerment and freedom.  Take a Money Type Quiz and find out which of your money types are more active presently.

We are indeed meant to be affluent in health, love, joy as well as financially. The main question now is, how do you truly want your money experience to be like? 

 Enid effectively guides and assists others, through practical and simple ways, to become more aware about their relationship to money and themselves.  Most importantly, she supports others from a place of compassion and  non-judgment, to make changes in their lives and money behaviors.  Compassionate awareness followed by conscious action is transformative. Enid guides others to tap into their inner resources and wisdom to actively live the lives they dream of and to experience and enjoy financial freedom.

Enid received her training and certification from The Money Coaching Institute, a coach training organization located in Northern California.  She also has a MBA in Finance from Rutgers University. 

Enid Martinez Intuitive Spiritual Counselor Intuitive Animal Communicator and Healer[masked]

www.thehearthelix.com

www.petsoulconnection.com

<a>www.affluentawareness.com.</a> 

[masked].

results.description:
The East River Park track is east of the FDR at East 6th Street. It is a little over a mile from the closest subway stops (6 to Astor Place or L to First Ave).

Thursday workouts change from week to week and will be announced in advance.

Important Information about East River Park Track: The Whippets have been running here for three years and have experienced thefts of our belongings. We will take extra precautions to keep our bags safe, but please avoid bringing valuables -- and it would be safest to run with your wallet on you.

Please be aware that there are limited overhead lights, so it gets a little dark, and during winter months the bathrooms are locked and the water fountains are off. If you have a bike, make sure you have a lock because you'll have to keep your bike outside the track area.

If you feel uncomfortable leaving your personal belongings at the track, you can drop them off at Ace Bar (531 East 5th Street between A and B) -- ask for Justin or Charlo and tell them you run with the team.  They will store our belongings for us.  ***Please note that they will not let you in without your ID so please bring that with you to the track.   http://www.acebar.com/about.html

See you there -- and please contact a Whippet captain if you have any questions!
results.name: East River Park Track Workout

results.description:
Meditation:

To discover deep internal Peace…

To wake up by connecting with your vital Force…

To live with profound Joy and a sense of Well Being…

To experience the Sacred in yourself and those around you.

……

In these times of rapid change and growing fragmentation we feel it’s important to find internal calm and meaning in life. This group offers simple down-to-earth guided meditations designed to connect with deeper parts of oneself and one’s own experience of the sacred.

We use the book “Silo’s Message” to guide our meetings. Silo is a spiritual guide who is also well-known for developing Universalist Humanism.

Our purpose is to create an environment that will nurture and foster deep experiences and help us notice them and live them in our daily life.

Our meetings are small so that everyone can interact easily and comfortably. And they are always open – no commitment or experience is required. Complete beginners are welcome

This is not a religious organization and we welcome and respect people of all backgrounds and beliefs. We work entirely on a volunteer basis. There are no costs for the meeting.

Occasionally we have day long seminars at the Hudson Valley Park of Study and Reflection. This is a beautiful retreat center located 2 hours from New York City which is part of the world-wide network of parks inspired by Silo’s work. http://www.hudsonvalleypark.org/

For information about Silo and his life:

Biography: http://silosmessage.net/about_silo.asp?LANG=EN

Description of Silo’s life work: http://newhumanist.us/?p=1211

results.description:
In 1969, Texas Longhorns safety Freddie Steinmark played the national championship season on a left leg ravaged by osteosarcoma. Directed by Angelo Pizzo and based on Jim Dent's book "Courage Beyond the Game: The Freddie Steinmark Story," "My All American" is Steinmark's story.

What Freddie Steinmark (Finn Wittrock) wants most in the world is to play football. Deemed too small by the usual athletic standards, his father trains him hard, and Freddie brings a fight to the game that ultimately gets him noticed — by none other than legendary University of Texas coach Darrell Royal (Aaron Eckhart). Awarded a scholarship and a chance to play for the Longhorns, Freddie sets off to Austin with his loving high school sweetheart Linda (Sarah Bolger), determined to make the team. Alongside his old teammate Bobby Mitchell (Rett Terrell) and new pal James Street (Juston Street), Freddie is put through the paces of a grueling practice schedule, but the boys' camaraderie off the field translates into solid playing on it, and they rise up the depth charts, giving the Longhorns a real chance to turn around their losing record. But just when they're reveling in the success of the season, Freddie suffers an injury that leads to a shocking diagnosis and the biggest challenge he will ever face.

You must bring a ticket to the movie theater and wait on the line.  Just click on http://www.gofobo.com/MAA55he  to get a movie ticket.

Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

results.description:
Mushroom Murders by by Chad Anderson (Author), Jeff Coney (Author), Rober Keough (Author), & 4 more

Delaware City was a peaceful little port town until its citizens started getting slaughtered! At the scene of each crime, all that is left is a small pile of ash and one creepy little mushroom. The police bring in two expendable detectives, Sterling Silversmith and Emerald Johnson, who are in way over their heads as they try to stop any more deaths! With ancient mysteries, demons hungering for human flesh, and an unexpected love story, the Mushroom Murders takes everything creepy and mystic about mushrooms and explodes it into an original, fast-paced, and character-driven five-issue limited series! Produced by Creator's Edge Press, written by Chad Anderson (Marvel Comics Handbook writer) and penciled by talented cartoonist Robert Keough, the Mushroom Murders is a surefire hit with surprises in store with every turn of the page!

results.description:
Swango
October 15-17th, 7:30pm
Schimmel Center for the Arts 

Use code WEST25 for the discount price

 A new revival of the 2005 off-Broadway hit by Tony Award®-winning playwright, Rupert Holmes, based on a concept by Mariela Franganillo (of Recuerdo Tango performed at Schimmel in 2013) and Robert Royston. Following in the tradition of West Side Story, this contemporary, Romeo and Juliet story depicts a unique fusion of dance, romance, revelry and rivalry within and between two different worlds. In one evening we see the tale of two lovers; the girl from the sultry world of Argentine Tango, the boy from the lively arena of West Coast Swing. When the lovers conquer their differences, they create the harmonic fusion of Swing and Tango.

More info: http://schimmel.pace.edu/events/swango-the-theatrical-dance-experience
results.name: Discount tickets SWANGO, the theatrical dance experience !

results.description:
Deadline for submission of stories to be critiqued is Friday of the week preceeding the Meetup. On Saturday, I'll send out an email listing the stories to be critiqued and in what order. Print out and mark up your copies in advance.

Please make sure your manuscript is properly formatted. See our Procedures, located under the Pages tab, for guidelines and an example, as well as advice for a constructive critique. Having manuscripts already formatted makes the critiquing process easier.

Most of the meeting will be spent critiquing work of group members. There is a structure in place to make sure the critiques are as helpful as possible for everyone involved, and that the writers leave with a clear idea of what to do with their stories next.

We'll also spend some time talking about writing, sharing news and information, and getting to know one another. It's always easier to take constructive criticism from someone you know, so the social element of the group is as important as the work itself!
results.why: Writers develop their story telling skills through steady writing and constructive feedback delivered by their peers. This group is full of talented writers willing to give their time to help others develop their craft.
results.name: Sam's BSFW Short Story Meetup

results.description:
Speak and Lead is one of three Toastmasters clubs in the Rutherford area. We cater to the after-work and evening crowd. Our goal is to help You obtain success! People join Toastmasters for an array of reasons, and therefore have different goals - but the common goal is self-improvement.

Whether you're joining so as to improve your communication/ presentation skills; or to become a better leader, Speak and Lead Toastmasters is here to help! Even if you simply are looking for an activity to engage in and just want to network, you can't go wrong here.

We're a friendly, supportive group that enjoys laughing and having a good time. We do things by the book and encourage all of our members to do their best. No matter what happens, we don't give up.

Won't you join us on your journey to success? The door is open - and we'll be talking.

results.description:
Thursday nights are now a potluck dinner night for the Orgasmic Meditation community here in NYC! And anyone over 18 who wants to check it out too!

If you are someone who already OMs or if you are curious and want to meet the OM community and check it out, or just meet some awesome people and enjoy a warm and electric evening of connection, come join us!!

Bring an item of food if you desire, and we will provide some extra food too so don't worry about it if you can't or don't have time. It's a casual atmosphere that might include some connection games. It's a great way to introduce friends to the concept of OM and the community itself since there will be lots of people there with years of experience in the practice. OMing will not take place AT the event but for those trained in the art there will be a circle beforehand at the usual time. The event is free! The door will open at 7:45 sharp and we will go until about 9:15. You're welcome to come anytime in between, unlike our other events which have tighter time tables. BUT we can't guarantee there will be any food left and you might miss some fun so try to come on time! For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://youtu.be/8OWkv9zms4E

results.description:
George Lightcap will recount his travels on the AT at this meeting.  He will provide information about the Appalachian Trail and discuss his two big hikes in 2012 and 2013 that completed his sectional hike of the trail.  I'm sure there will be pictures.

Want to: Meet your new ski/boarding buddy?  Learn about trips, lift ticket discounts, instruction, racing, hiking, and the amazing lodge in central Vermont?  Play free foosball, pool, shuffle board or darts?  Come to a meeting (maybe buy a drink at the bar at a good price) and introduce yourself to the person* closest to you and next thing you know you will be in the middle of 6 degrees of snow-mazing separation.  Thursdays from September to April, the snow networking location is at the Knights of Columbus (KofC) in Ramsey, 8 PM.

Park across the street in the train station parking lot. Many meetings have special speakers or activities, so keep an eye out for costume parties, equipment lectures, and amazing stuff.

FYI: Attendance varies (20-50 people usually) and represents only a small fraction of our 300+ membership base.  There will always be lots of dedicated skiers and boarders who are not on meetup.com who are in the official Ramapo Mountain Ski Club. Members vary in age (8-80 year olds come to meetings), ability, availability (schedule wise), and martial status (aka dating wise) - but everyone is looking for the perfect snow partner ;0)

Ramapo Mountain Ski Club Web Site

*For first timers: ask for Elyse, Ken of Hospitality, or Maggie, our President, to sign-in, help answer questions and connect you to others in the club with shared interests.

Ski yah Soon!
results.name: Weekly Meeting - George Lightcap AT Hike Presentation

results.description:
http://brightonasylum.com/the-tunnel

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QLR_bJhB3QE

GENERAL Admission $25.00 (good for 2 attractions The Asylum & The Tunnel)


(CLICK HERE) Buy Tickets!

I strongly recommend purchasing your tickets A.S.A.P.


Based on what I've read on some blogs, looks like the Tunnel is gonna be sick! Our admission tickets include entry to both "The Tunnel" and "Asylum" attraction. I'd like to do both, but let's see how the night pans out and how long lines are. The idea here is to purchase timed tickets for 8:00pm 10/15/2015 (muy importante guys), so we can skip some of the wait time.


*IMPORTANT - The general consensus is that this walk through is very scary. So, if this isn't your thing, or you have a preexisting health condition, I would advise checking the website, and/or reviews on the interweb, for more details. 

Brighton Asylum contact info: http://brightonasylum.com/contact 

(201) 716 - 2827

I love Halloween, so let's kick this month off with a good scare. 

DESCRIPTION

Brighton Asylum is proud to present its newest attraction, THE TUNNEL. 

Descend deep under the brick and mortar of Brighton Asylum and explore the long forgotten tunnel system that once allowed its staff to move undetected beneath the grounds.

Once a brilliantly devised underground system, over time became a breeding ground for unsanctioned patient experiments, living quarters for staff gone mad, and attempted patient escapes and hiding.

Some say that the Tunnels became just as dangerous as Brighton Asylum itself, if not more so. Those brave enough to explore the forgotten tunnel system are never seen nor heard from again... - See more at: http://www.newjerseyhauntedhouses.com/halloween/night-mares-haunted-attraction-nj.html#sthash.yoa7sI0p.dpuf
results.how_to_find_us: To find us...Shoot me a message through Meetup!
results.name: Brighton Asylum - The Tunnel

• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (Your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests.)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Pablo G.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8:00PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Code of Conduct:

Positivity - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game.

Safety - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

2 = Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Generosity!!!! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Pablo G.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

results.description:
A BIBLICAL WORLDVIEW OF CIVIL GOVERNMENT AND CHRISTIAN LIFE

“But as for me and my house, we will serve the Lord”

(Joshua 24:15 KJV)


Please, join the Christian Party of America’s monthly Biblical Worldview Conference Call led by Pastor and Christian Party of America National Chairman, Clell Drumheller. He will present an in-depth scriptural perspective of how Christians are to live in these challenging times and engage in civil affairs. The conference call is the third Thursday of each month at 8:30 PM. EST (7:30 PM Central). Topics will range from how to be culturally “in the world, but not of it,” to what is the Christian’s biblical response to political events. Each call will begin with a 30-minute formal presentation by Mr. Drumheller, followed by a question and answer section. For recording quality of the presentations, which will be archived, we ask that everyone, please, mute their telephones until the end of the presentation. If you arrive late to the call, please, mute your phone as you log in, so that the presentation will not be interrupted as you join us. Thank you ahead of time for your compliance. After the presentation you can unmute your phone if you would like to participate in the discussion and/or ask questions. If you would like to contact Mr. Drumheller, please do so at [masked] or call the Christian Party of America toll-free number at [masked]-3927.


Biography -- Clell M. Drumheller, II: Mr. Drumheller, a former Marine Corps Sergeant, is an ordained pastor and is the Founder/Pastor of Truth in Love Ministries in Houston, Texas. He has a Master of Divinity from Southwestern Baptist Theological Seminary and a Bachelor of Arts in Christianity and English from Houston Baptist University. In 2010, Mr. Drumheller became the founding National Chairman of the Christian Party of America. Among other affiliations Mr. Drumheller is a member of the Black Robed Regiment and holds a teaching certificate through Lone Star College. He has also engaged in various professional, business, and volunteer activities. He was born in Ocala, Florida on November 20, 1951 and was saved in Houston, Texas on August 4, 1969. He and his wife Cynde reside in Houston, Texas.


The Christian Party of America’s nationwide Conference Calls provide a great opportunity to connect with other Christian Party supporters as we try to make a difference in this country. So, sign on with us for the conference call to discuss issues and contribute your thoughts about what we can be doing politically. Our conference calls are open to the public and are for all of us who are interested in the Christian Party of America. It is an easy-access way to share ideas and learn more about what is going on around the country with the Christian Party of America. Hope you can make it!


The conference call will last for about an hour but staying for the entire call is optional.  If you get a message that the circuits are busy, just keep trying the number and it eventually works. There is no extra charge to participate other than the usual charges required by your phone plan for a long distance call. You can, even, listen in on the conference call while at other events. Just hit *6 to mute your phone and you can do two things at once!
results.name: A BIBLICAL WORLDVIEW OF CIVIL GOVERNMENT AND CHRISTIAN LIFE-CONFERENCE CALL

You've spent all week busting your hump!

Now it's time to unwind, loosen up the tie, say inappropriate things, get hammered, and most importantly laugh til it hurts!

Back by popular demand the "Let Me Speak To Your Manager" show is bringing you the best up and coming comics in NYC, all of whom have been featured on Comedy Central, MTV, Letterman, Fallon, Conan, etc..!

It all goes down at Stone Creek Bar and Grill in the back room.

Come down, enjoy some of the drinks from the fully stocked bar or some food off the awesome menu!

The show is free and has a 1 item minimum.


Come out and get over the hump with some laughs!

results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include...


30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

This event is officially hosted by The Rise, NYC. They host morning workouts every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday mornings. See them on meetup here:


http://www.meetup.com/The-Rise-NYC/


NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the bottom of the Manhattan side of the Williamsburg Bridge.
results.name: Hill Running Challenge with The Rise

results.description:
Other than strict RSVP rules (if you say you're coming and you don't show, you're out of the group), this is a chill game, open to anyone who <a>signs up</a>.

Here's what separates this group from many others:

• Chill, positive attitudes. (People without forgiving personalities don't last long in this group, let alone in a given game.)

• Good quality equipment: $145 match balls; solid small goals - not pop-ups!

• Freshly laundered, adult-size, pillowy soft pinnies.

• We won't ever over-crowd a game. The size of pitch we use is best suited for 7v7. We're happy to make the pitch smaller if numbers are low. But we won't make it bigger or allow more than 7 players per team. 


• The small fee we ask of each player (at least $3 per session) supports a non-profit that we created and run: a high school soccer league for under-funded schools that don't have sufficient resources for after-school programming. 

See nyisl.com or the below video for more info. about our <a>program</a> for under-served public school students.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WzbNWu-N-ig

We use your game-fee to help pay for our high school players' new soccer boots, socks, shin guards and much more (e.g., the league website, goals, and other equipment). 

We're particularly fond of in-kind donations: soccer boots, socks, shins, shorts, etc. 

If you have any of these, please bring them to your game and we'll be more than happy to waive your game fee!
results.name: Sign-Up Soccer for Social Change

results.description:
Hello Friends

We are fortunate to have Mark Peter Davis of Interplay VC come and share his thoughts and wisdom.

Mark is a venture capitalist, incubator, a serial founder & investor

He's currently the founder/managing director of Interplay Ventures and a co-founder of Kohort, DevSpark, Founder Shield, Fulton Waters, Founder Shield, Nomad Financial, Truman James, TwentyPine, Varick North, Venwise and others.

Mark is also an Adjunct Professor of Entrepreneurship at Singularity University.

Prior, Mark was a VC at High Peaks Venture Partners and DFJ Gotham Ventures, where he invested in information companies.

As for interests, he really enjoy brainstorming new ideas, thinking about the future, tinkering with new technology, listening to rock ‘n roll, boxing, learning, documentaries and an occasional game of rock band.

While it may look like he is married to the startup scene, he is actually married to his college sweetheart Laurie and have a daughter named Avery and a son named Austin.

Folks, you don't want to miss out!! Please let your friends know and join us as we wrap up NY tech week with a bang!

Stay classy
results.name: NY Tech Week - Mark Peter Davis (Interplay VC)

results.description:
The Art of Black and White Conversion

The first part of our workshop will take place in Unique's computer lab. Each participant will be able to work at their own computer station under the direction of our presenter, Shiv Verma. The lab has 12 computer work stations and we are limiting the number of participants to 12 photographers so that every participant will have a true hands on experience.

Each participant should bring 5 or 6 of their favorite images loaded on a flash drive. They will learn how to use Light Room, Photoshop, Silver Efex Pro as well as Macphun Tonality to convert their color images to B&W images.

This part of the workshop will run for 1-1/2 to 2 hours.


In the old days there was only monochrome photography. Today we have photographers who work exclusively in color and some who work exclusively in black and white while many create both color and black and white photos. With the tools and software available to us and the ease of converting color photos to black and white there's no reason not to try creating black and white images.


This hands on workshop will not only help you determine which of your existing photos might look good in black and white but it will also help you learn to visualize in black and white. venue.name: The William and Lynda Steere Herbarium

results.description:
The William and Lynda Steere Herbarium is the centerpiece of the Garden's botanical research program. It is the fourth largest herbarium in the world, and the largest in the Western Hemisphere.

The Herbarium holds a collection of more than 7.7 million preserved plant specimens that have been collected by researchers for the past 200 years. We are in the process of imaging and documenting information on these plants so that the data can be used in research applications such as evolution, biodiversity, and climate change.
results.name: Let's meet up and volunteer in the New York Botanical Garden's Herbarium!

results.description:
Want to check out Fullstack Academy during the day and learn more about our school? 

Come drop by our campus on your lunch break for a tour and short Q&A session! 

This is a great way to get a feel for the environment at Fullstack and get some of your questions answered about the school. Campus tours will be held on the 3rd Friday of every month.

Please register to attend here on Meetup and arrive by 1:15 PM. A team member will show you around campus, and afterwards there will be time for a short and informal Q&A. 

We look forward to meeting you!

-The Fullstack Team
results.name: Fullstack Academy Campus Tour

results.description:
Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

 

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 2.00pm and finishes at 2.30pm.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

Testimonials:

"That was absolutely amazing! I don't think I have ever fully let go and quieted my mind like that before. I feel so inspired. By the end of the session I was filled with so much love - love for myself, for others, and love coming from Source. Unconditional, pure love. Thank you." C.L.

"Instead of the 'knowledge gained', I find it appropriate to give a 5 star to 'raising my vibrations' during the meditation.... the energy of the group was Amazing and ZINGING! Thanks... " - S

"Thank you Tracy for a wonderful start to the day. Amazing calmness capturing everyone's energy on the class. Look forward to attending the next on-line class. Thank you." - B.J

"Very enlightening and a positive way for those that can't make it physically to do so remotely.""Thank you, the second section moved me the most. I had a real moment of knowing who I was, am and always be. Also, I have in the past trained in yoga and meditation but not practiced for a number of years - I felt all the beauty of it flowing connecting through my source once again aaaahhh bliss." - A.S.

"Truly inspirational, loved it, thank you ." - Anonymous

"Really loved being able to just switch on and meditate." - L.M.

"So relaxing and cleansing." - T.H.

"Awesome meditation Tracy! One of the most powerful sessions I have ever had. Wow." - G.R.

"I absolutely loved the meditation. The music was one that I truly enjoyed. Thank you so much for this. Many blessings to you." - S.

FOR DETAILS OF ALL UPCOMING 'MEDITATION 101 LIVE' SESSIONS PLEASE CLICK HERE.

Follow Meditation 101 Live on Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn.

results.name: SPECIAL FREE: MEDITATION 101 LIVE

group.name: The Law of Attraction Centre™ (East Coast)

results.description:
Come enjoy the fall foliage and beautiful autumn scenery at AMC’s 2015 Fall Gathering on historic Lake George! This is a great opportunity to meet Young Members from the other 11 AMC chapters and to learn about AMC.

The 2015 Fall Gathering will be held October 16-18 and is being hosted by the Mohawk Hudson Chapter. Join AMC members from all chapters at Camp Chingachgook, nestled along the shore of gorgeous Lake George in the Adirondack Mountains. All AMC members and their friends are invited to enjoy this fun annual event! Activities will include hikes to the numerous peaks that surround Lake George, cycling, and paddling (bring your own kayak). Friday and Saturday evenings feature pre-dinner social hours, live music and campfires. To learn more: http://bit.ly/1QbVrej

To lodge in the Young Members cabin, please follow these instructions:
1. Go to http://bit.ly/1QbVrej
2. Click "Register now!"
3. Select “Unheated Cabin/Yurt”
4. You will receive a confirmation email from AMC
5. Reply to the confirmation email and specify that you would like to be in the Young Member cabin.
6. Please notify me at [masked]. I will coordinate carpooling arrangements.

If you have any questions, please contact Susannah Hatch at [masked].

Like us on Facebook for event updates and invites.
results.name: AMC 2015 Fall Gathering

We need Pre-Intermediate, Intermediate and Upper-Intermediate students. The classes are free!!

results.description:
The Art of Black and White Conversion

The first part of our workshop will take place in Unique's computer lab. Each participant will be able to work at their own computer station under the direction of our presenter, Shiv Verma. The lab has 12 computer work stations and we are limiting the number of participants to 12 photographers so that every participant will have a true hands on experience.

Each participant should bring 5 or 6 of their favorite images loaded on a flash drive. They will learn how to use Light Room, Photoshop, Silver Efex Pro as well as Macphun Tonality to convert their color images to B&W images.

This part of the workshop will run for 1-1/2 to 2 hours.


In the old days there was only monochrome photography. Today we have photographers who work exclusively in color and some who work exclusively in black and white while many create both color and black and white photos. With the tools and software available to us and the ease of converting color photos to black and white there's no reason not to try creating black and white images.


This hands on workshop will not only help you determine which of your existing photos might look good in black and white but it will also help you learn to visualize in black and white. Once you identify the image you want to convert, you will learn how to best convert it to exceptional black and white or monochromatic image. Realize that a RGB (color) image is composed of Red, Green and Blue channels. This is no different than tri-color separation filters that have Wratten designations of  Wratten 29 - RED, Wratten 47 - BLUE and Wratten 61 - GREEN. We will use Photoshop and various plug-ins to create monochrome panchromatic renditions for your color images.

Once you have your images converted you will have the opportunity to have the image professionally printed at the workshop.


Here are several images that were planned as a B&W image well before the moment of capture. Frankly, I can't conceive of them as anything other than B&W images.

The second part of this two part workshop will take place in Unique's main classroom and will be led by our resident fine arts printer Anthony Morella of Digital Editions Atelier.


There will be an explanation and live demonstration of the printing process and participants will have the opportunity to have one of their black and white images, that they just created in the lab, printed on Hahnemuhule fine art paper. The paper used in this workshop has been donated by Hahnemuhule.


Here is an outline of Tony's presentation:

• No image prints as you see it

• Tonal Range Adjusted in Editing

results.description:
Welcome to the NEWLIFE Expo in our 25th year, focusing on Health & Wellness, Spirituality & Natural Living For the Mind, Body & Spirit.

One of the the largest Holistic Health, Alternative Medicine, Anti-Aging, Metaphysical and Spiritual expo in America for over twenty-five years.

Come to our new location at the Penn Plaza Pavilion (401 7th Ave. opposite Penn Station) on October 16-18 showcasing over 100 innovative cutting-edge exhibitors and speakers from around the world

our new location at the incredible Penn Plaza Pavilion (401 7th Ave. opposite Penn Station) in NYC on Oct 16-18 where the expo is on the first two floors.  

My goal is to assist you in reaching your healthiest maximum potential in mind, body, spirit and emotions with exhibitors and speakers from around the country including Dr. Robert Young, Dr. Joel Wallach, Dr. Robert Sorge, Viktoras Kulvinskas, Judy Satori, Gail Thackray, Sean Morton, Stacie Breeze and 100 expert speakers.

CLICK TO SEE -

• PARTIAL LIST OF SPEAKERS

• SHOW SCHEDULE

• PARTIAL LIST OF VENDORS

• 

CLICK TO REGISTER


  Our 100 exhibitors from around the world bring you innovative and exciting products and services that will help you to open your mind to all possibilities.

  Of course we will still be having yoga classes with Mark Becker and N.Y’s finest teachers and a raw food and vegetarian dining area for you to delight your palate.

  Besides our Raw Food panels, enjoy our Nutrition Panel, Sexuality & Sensuality Panel, Strange Universe Panels and the Unique Light Language Panel.

  So, if your life isn¹t as healthy or vital or as exciting as you want it to be, come to the NEWLIFE Health & Wellness Expo and meet over 10,000 people just like you who want to raise their awareness. Take a weekend out of your ordinary life, and enjoy an extraordinary world of possibilities.

 Someone once told me, “Go to a bar and meet a drunk, but go to the expo and meet a god or goddess”.  Who knows? You might even fall in love. One thing I can promise you is that your life will never be the same. Aren't you worth $15 for a day or $25 for a whole weekend?

 Om Sholom

Mark Becker

results.description:
Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 4:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for anyone wearing a orange or blue Pinnies.
results.name: Friday Afternoon Pick-up 4PM

results.description:
Hi there,

We find ourselves challenged to maintain an environment that would encourage our kids to learn the German language and culture. Like many in the area, we live far from family that could provide more frequent interactions in German. Since our partners are English speaking, we'd like to create opportunities for our kids to experience German not only through interacting with us parents but also with others. Hence, we would love to build supporting networks with other parents and their babies & children that would like to interact and have fun(!) in German on a regular basis.


Since the summer is winding down we have to find a good place for the fall and those cold winter days : ) Any suggestions for good places for us to play or things to do are very welcome.

See you soon!

Maria & Renate
results.name: Meet and play in Hoboken oder Jersey City ( in German language )

results.description:
Taste Beer from Flying Dog Brewery!

Dogtoberfest
Gonzo Imperial Porter
Bloodline

Dogtoberfest- Brewed with 100% imported German ingredients, it will cut spice while pulling out sweetness. Flavor notes: Full-bodied caramel sweet with a light toasted and crisp, clean finish Pairs with: Mexican and Pepper Jack cheeses; sweet Asian sauces; spiced desserts; German foods.

Gonzo Imperial Porter - Gonzo is big, bold, and beautiful like the man it was brewed in honor of – Dr. Hunter S. Thompson. Flavor notes: Roasted chocolate, coffee, and vanilla malt flavors balanced with a unique hop bite Pairs with: Mushrooms; smoked meats, BBQ, and chili; hard cheese; chocolate and coffee desserts.

Bloodline - Bloodline begins with huge grapefruit on the nose. Then, a delicate balance of citrus sweetness and bitterness. Try it with grilled light proteins, salads with fruity vinaigrettes, and fresh salsa.

Brewed locally in Frederick Maryland Read more about Flying Dog Brewery at : www.flyingdogbrewery.com

Since there will be 3 beers offered, this event is best suited for those who are either interested in Flying Dog beer or who are close enough to stop by easily. Wine Chateau offers free tastings and free tapas. It's not 5-star cuisine, but it's still a generous offering as it's free. The tapas are typically the same at each event.

Stop by if you can. I plan to attend for the first hour or so.
results.how_to_find_us: The tasting lounge is at the front of the store.
results.name: Free Beer Tasting: Flying Dog Brewery & Free Tapas

results.description:
Tim Lee, Founder and CEO of ArcBit bitcoin wallet, will present to Byte Academy and a limited number of guests to help understand Bitcoin, blockchain and the overall cryptocurrency phenomena.  

ArcBit is a mobile app that gives you full control over your bitcoins enabling you to send and receive bitcoins from anywhere in the world to anywhere in the world.  

Having studied Bitcoin since its very beginnings, Tim will talk about the security of Bitcoin and the blockchain, its history, future, and applications in global economy.  He will also talk about his product and strategy.  As the prime engineer, Tim will provide an invaluable technical understanding of the blockchain.

RSVP in advance as there is a limited number of tickets.  Due to the overwhelming response, some attendees may have to stand.
results.name: Intro to Cryptocurrency & Blockchain By Tim Lee, CEO, ArcBit Bitcoin Wallet
