results.description:
The Art of Black and White Conversion

The first part of our workshop will take place in Unique's computer lab. Each participant will be able to work at their own computer station under the direction of our presenter, Shiv Verma. The lab has 12 computer work stations and we are limiting the number of participants to 12 photographers so that every participant will have a true hands on experience.

Each participant should bring 5 or 6 of their favorite images loaded on a flash drive. They will learn how to use Light Room, Photoshop, Silver Efex Pro as well as Macphun Tonality to convert their color images to B&W images.

This part of the workshop will run for 1-1/2 to 2 hours.

In the old days there was only monochrome photography. Today we have photographers who work exclusively in color and some who work exclusively in black and white while many create both color and black and white photos. With the tools and software available to us and the ease of converting color photos to black and white there's no reason not to try creating black and white images.

This hands on workshop will not only help you determine which of your existing photos might look good in black and white but it will also help you learn to visualize in black and white. Once you identify the image you want to convert, you will learn how to best convert it to exceptional black and white or monochromatic image. Realize that a RGB (color) image is composed of Red, Green and Blue channels. This is no different than tri-color separation filters that have Wratten designations of  Wratten 29 - RED, Wratten 47 - BLUE and Wratten 61 - GREEN. We will use Photoshop and various plug-ins to create monochrome panchromatic renditions for your color images.

Once you have your images converted you will have the opportunity to have the image professionally printed at the workshop.

Here are several images that were planned as a B&W image well before the moment of capture. Frankly, I can't conceive of them as anything other than B&W images.

The second part of this two part workshop will take place in Unique's main classroom and will be led by our resident fine arts printer Anthony Morella of Digital Editions Atelier.

There will be an explanation and live demonstration of the printing process and participants will have the opportunity to have one of their black and white images, that they just created in the lab, printed on Hahnemuhule fine art paper. The paper used in this workshop has been donated by Hahnemuhule.

Here is an outline of Tony's presentation:

B&W Print Workshop

Background of presenter

How to Make a Good Digital Print

The Basics

• No image prints as you see it

• Tonal Range Adjusted in Editing

Monitors for photographers

• Calibrate Your Monitor

• Understanding Pixels and File Formats

• Pixels are Measured in Bits

• Why Does it Matter?

• Advantage of Bit Depth

Editing and Processing ICC Profiles

• Why use ICC Profiles?

• Here's How to Make One

• Why Make Your Own Profiles?

Work Flow

• Adobe Bridge

• Adobe Camera Raw

• Adobe Camera Raw - Define Your Space

• Adobe Camera Raw - Straighten

• Adobe Camera Raw - Lens Correction

• Adobe Camera Raw - Chromatic Aberration

• Digital Cameras Produce Noise

• Adobe Camera Raw - Sharpening & Noise Reduction

Adobe Photoshop

• Adobe Photoshop - Image Size to Print Size

• A Word About Size

• Soft Proofing Your Images

• Soft Proofing Your Images - Gamut Warning

• Adjusting Contrast to Print

• Sharpening  for Output

• 3rd Party Sharpening

• Print Dialog

• Printer Settings

• Print

Printers

• Variety of Printer Technologies

• Digital Print Technologies

• Ink-Jet Printers

• Inkjet Papers: A World of Choices!

• Let's Talk Papers

• Which InkJet Paper is Best?

• How White is Your Paper?

• What's Your Paper Made From?

• How Heavy is Your Paper?

• What Does Your Paper Feel Like?

• Key Specs to Look For

• More on Archival Paper

Post Printing InkJet Tips

Some of My Resources

WHEW!!! What a workshop. Think I'll sit in on this one myself.

results.description:
Togetherness: Each of Us, All of Us.

During this retreat we will be looking at ourselves as individuals and also as part of the Universal Whole, how we move towards balance within ourselves and each other. What keeps us apart and makes us feel isolated, and what we can do to become less fractured. We'll search for those elements of our lives that we have in common.

Throughout the weekend we'll aim to integrate the parts -- chanting meditations, satsangs, discussions, fun activities and meal time -- to come together as one cohesive whole.

All this will take place at Saint Mary's Villa in Sloatsburg, New York, a spectacular setting and a short 30 minute ride from the Tappan Zee Bridge.

Cost: Full weekend in double room - $240

Full weekend in single room - $280 (limited availability)

Saturday only with lunch and dinner - $85

To register, go to americanmeditationsociety.org -- upcoming retreats -- NY Weekend Retreat -- select and add to cart. Payment processed through PayPal.

Review cancellation policy on americanmeditationsociety.org.

For additional information or questions please contact Marcia at: [masked] or phone[masked]

results.description:
Weather: Hello Guys and Gals! Please check back here for any weather updates and/or cancellations.
Transit: 2 or 5 trains to E 174th St stop and short walk. 5 train runs express until 7PM from E 149th St-Third Ave to E 180th St. BX17, BX21 and BX11 within walking distance.

Ready? Play.
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup?
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be?
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like?
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.

Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything?
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome?
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect?
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

We do this party every year, but this time we're teaming up with over 50 Meetup groups to put together "the ultimate" FALL FLING!

Join 300+ singles at Manhattan's largest and most spectacular penthouse lounge, 230 Fifth, which is surrounded by floor to ceiling windows with breathtaking panoramic views of the NYC skyline.  

What to expect: 

• 2 for 1 Drinks (6-7pm)

• Free Light Appetizers

• Ice Breakers

• DJ & Dancing

• Giveaways

• 300+ singles 

1st 15 tickets are just $15 with discount code "FALL" at checkout - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bash/dates/Oct-16-2015_at_0600PM

$20 after that online w/ RSVP, $30 at the door   

What's the venue like? 230 Fifth was voted #1 by Citysearch for Best New Bars/Lounges in New York City Voted ,#2 Best New Bar/Lounge in the United States by Citysearch, and voted #1 "To Do" in New York by Spur

Is this event private? The entire venue will be 100% private for our party. Members can invite guests to join us.

Is there a dress code or age restriction? No hats, sweats, shorts, t-shirts etc  Jeans ok. Dress stylish. General age range 20s-40s. It is not ethnic specific.

Can I come alone? Most come on their own. If you don't know anyone, the ice breakers will help you meet others. Come alone or bring a friend - either way you'll feel comfortable and have a great time.

venue.name: 49 Grove

results.description:
Join us Friday, October 16th for a Cocktails and Conversations event at the upscale West Village nightclub and lounge 49 Grove. Each month's event is an evening of socializing, along with optional discussion groups centered around a single theme. 

Socialize in the main room all evening or participate in hourly debate groups (7, 8, and 9 PM). Feel free to engage in challenging discussions or just socialize.

49 Grove is an upscale nightclub in the West Village (on Grove Street near the Christopher Street/Sheridan Square Station). We have the entire venue reserved for this event.

Only five days before the events of "Back to the Future II", this evening's theme is, naturally, "The Future Is Us". The event will feature a collection of hourly topics with some of the toughest and most interesting questions the organizers can throw your way :-).

We will have three rounds of provocative questions for discussion each hour.

This event's sponsoring group is New York Philosophy.

A Cocktails & Conversations event combines food and drink, a casual Manhattan intellectual environment, and a social atmosphere for New Yorkers to get together, mingle, and discuss interesting topics - in the style of the French Salon. 

Over the course of the evening, members gather in small groups for discussions. Between each discussion round, everyone socializes and has a chance to order food/drink. With a chance to join several groups throughout the event, attendees have a chance to meet many others while engaging in spirited debates in a highly social atmosphere.

**************************************************************

This is *not* a typical meet-and-greet open social, this is a "Cocktails & Conversations" event with three rounds of active and challenging debates. It will be crowded, it will be edgy - you can participate in discussions or socialize in the main room.

**************************************************************

Drink Specials

Tapas Menu & Full Drink Bar Available

See you at Grove!
results.name: Cocktails & Conversations Social at 49 Grove (Free, Drink Specials, Food Menu)

venue.address_1: 49 Grove St (btw Christopher St and 7th Ave)
venue.name: 49 Grove

results.description:
Join us Friday, October 16th for a Cocktails and Conversations event at the upscale West Village nightclub and lounge 49 Grove. Each month's event is an evening of socializing, along with optional discussion groups centered around a single theme. 

Socialize in the main room all evening or participate in hourly debate groups (7, 8, and 9 PM). Feel free to engage in challenging discussions or just socialize.

49 Grove is an upscale nightclub in the West Village (on Grove Street near the Christopher Street/Sheridan Square Station). We have the entire venue reserved for this event.

Only five days before the events of "Back to the Future II", this evening's theme is, naturally, "The Future Is Us". The event will feature a collection of hourly topics with some of the toughest and most interesting questions the organizers can throw your way :-).

We will have three rounds of provocative questions for discussion each hour.

This event's sponsoring group is New York Philosophy.

A Cocktails & Conversations event combines food and drink, a casual Manhattan intellectual environment, and a social atmosphere for New Yorkers to get together, mingle, and discuss interesting topics - in the style of the French Salon. 

Over the course of the evening, members gather in small groups for discussions. Between each discussion round, everyone socializes and has a chance to order food/drink. With a chance to join several groups throughout the event, attendees have a chance to meet many others while engaging in spirited debates in a highly social atmosphere.

**************************************************************

This is *not* a typical meet-and-greet open social, this is a "Cocktails & Conversations" event with three rounds of active and challenging debates. It will be crowded, it will be edgy - you can participate in discussions or socialize in the main room.

**************************************************************

Drink Specials

Tapas Menu & Full Drink Bar Available

See you at Grove!
results.name: Cocktails & Conversations Social at 49 Grove (Free, Drink Specials, Food Menu)

results.description:
Friends,

Join us this weekend for our Social Fridays @ Hudson Terrace. This venue just got better. Ladies will receive a complimentary drink @ our VIP table.( not the bar) Get there early while the drinks last!

The list for free entry will be open to our group from 6pm.

Hudson Terrace is one of the most popular venues here in New York! We always have a fun time there.

Mention Rory's List to the door person for free admission.

This event is for members in their 20's, 30's and 40's.

Dress code is business casual.

Don't forget to R.S.V.P for this event.

Feel free to invite your friends, colleagues, and classmates.

This is a multi Meetup group event.

Do contact us if you have further questions.

*Later that night we will make our way to Slate NYC for the after party! Admission is absolutely free! (Slate NYC, 54 W 21st street between 5th and 6th avenue)

Cheers

Meetup Organizer,

Rory

results.description:
Friends,

Join us this weekend for our Social Fridays @ Hudson Terrace. This venue just got better. Ladies will receive a complimentary drink @ our VIP table.( not the bar) Get there early while the drinks last!

The list for free entry will be open to our group from 6pm. Later that night we will all head to Slate NYC.

Hudson Terrace is one of the most popular venues here in New York! We always have a fun time there.

Mention Rory's List to the door person for free admission.

This event is for members in their 20's, 30's and 40's.

Dress code is business casual.

Don't forget to R.S.V.P for this event.

Feel free to invite your friends, colleagues, and classmates.

This is a multi Meetup group event.

Do contact us if you have further questions.

Cheers

Events Organizer,

Rory

results.description:
Friends,

Join us this weekend for our Social Fridays @ Hudson Terrace. This venue just got better. Ladies will receive a complimentary drink @ our VIP table.( not the bar) Get there early while the drinks last!

The list for free entry will be open to our group from 6pm. Later that night we will all head to Slate NYC.

Hudson Terrace is one of the most popular venues here in New York! We always have a fun time there.

Mention Rory's List to the door person for free admission.

This event is for members in their 20's, 30's and 40's.

Dress code is business casual.

Don't forget to R.S.V.P for this event.

Feel free to invite your friends, colleagues, and classmates.

This is a multi Meetup group event.

Do contact us if you have further questions.

*Later that night we will make our way to Slate NYC for the after party! Admission is absolutely free! (Slate NYC, 54 W 21st street between 5th and 6th avenue)

Cheers

Events Organizer,

Rory

results.description:
Join us Friday, October 16th for a Cocktails and Conversations event at the upscale West Village nightclub and lounge 49 Grove. Each month's event is an evening of socializing, along with optional discussion groups centered around a single theme. 

Socialize in the main room all evening or participate in hourly debate groups (7, 8, and 9 PM). Feel free to engage in challenging discussions or just socialize.

49 Grove is an upscale nightclub in the West Village (on Grove Street near the Christopher Street/Sheridan Square Station). We have the entire venue reserved for this event.

Only five days before the events of "Back to the Future II", this evening's theme is, naturally, "The Future Is Us". The event will feature a collection of hourly topics with some of the toughest and most interesting questions the organizers can throw your way :-).

We will have three rounds of provocative questions for discussion each hour.

This event's sponsoring group is New York Philosophy.

A Cocktails & Conversations event combines food and drink, a casual Manhattan intellectual environment, and a social atmosphere for New Yorkers to get together, mingle, and discuss interesting topics - in the style of the French Salon. 

Over the course of the evening, members gather in small groups for discussions. Between each discussion round, everyone socializes and has a chance to order food/drink. With a chance to join several groups throughout the event, attendees have a chance to meet many others while engaging in spirited debates in a highly social atmosphere.

**************************************************************

This is *not* a typical meet-and-greet open social, this is a "Cocktails & Conversations" event with three rounds of active and challenging debates. It will be crowded, it will be edgy - you can participate in discussions or socialize in the main room.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$20 in advance only

PRE-PAY HERE: http://4th230fifth.eventbrite.com

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Join us and over 300 other singles at one of the hottest venues in NYC! Manhattan's largest & most spectacular penthouse lounge & rooftop, the luxurious 230 Fifth is surrounded by floor to ceiling windows with breathtaking panoramic views of the NYC skyline. What to expect: Drink specials, Complimentary Appetizers, Fun Ice Breakers, DJ & Dancing, and Giveaways.

What's the venue like? 230 Fifth was voted #1 by Citysearch for Best New Bars/Lounges in New York City Voted ,#2 Best New Bar/Lounge in the United States by Citysearch, and voted #1 "To Do" in New York by Spur

Is this event private? The entire venue will be 100% private for our party. Members can invite guests to join us.

Is there a dress code or age restriction? No hats, sweats, shorts, t-shirts etc  Jeans ok. Dress stylish. This event is mostly for 20s-40s. It is not ethnic specific.

Can I come alone? Most come on their own. If you don't know anyone, the ice breakers will help you meet others. Come alone or bring a friend - either way you'll feel comfortable and have a great time.

Why does your RSVP say +99? This is a multi-Meetup event.This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. We will have 300+ members attending.

Great Co-Working nights to come!

INTERESTED IN A SOTECHIE COWORKING MEMBERSHIP?  

Go to SoTechie NYC CoWorking Space to learn more

If you would like to present a project you are working on or just want to announce something to the group... Let me know!!!

results.description:
For beginners and experienced meditators.

Metta, or Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM), is the practice of wishing oneself and others happiness, health, and ease. Based on traditional Buddhist teachings, it has become an increasingly popular practice, as it generates both concentration and a deep understanding of the nature of our connection to ourselves and others.

This is a drop-in event, and pre-registration is not necessary. We're offering it on a donation basis, and request each participant to contribute between $10 - $20 to support this and other initiatives led by The Interdependence Project. 

Please visit http://theidproject.org/events/2015/06/05/metta-meditation-group for details. 

Please note that our space is not wheelchair accessible and can only be reached by climbing two steep flights of stairs!
results.name: Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM) Group - Every Friday!

venue.name: 49 Grove

results.description:
Join us Friday, October 16th for a Cocktails and Conversations event at the upscale West Village nightclub and lounge 49 Grove. Each month's event is an evening of socializing, along with optional discussion groups centered around a single theme. 

Socialize in the main room all evening or participate in hourly debate groups (7, 8, and 9 PM). Feel free to engage in challenging discussions or just socialize.

49 Grove is an upscale nightclub in the West Village (on Grove Street near the Christopher Street/Sheridan Square Station). We have the entire venue reserved for this event.

Only five days before the events of "Back to the Future II", this evening's theme is, naturally, "The Future Is Us". The event will feature a collection of hourly topics with some of the toughest and most interesting questions the organizers can throw your way :-).

We will have three rounds of provocative questions for discussion each hour.

This event's sponsoring group is New York Philosophy.

A Cocktails & Conversations event combines food and drink, a casual Manhattan intellectual environment, and a social atmosphere for New Yorkers to get together, mingle, and discuss interesting topics - in the style of the French Salon. 

Over the course of the evening, members gather in small groups for discussions. Between each discussion round, everyone socializes and has a chance to order food/drink. With a chance to join several groups throughout the event, attendees have a chance to meet many others while engaging in spirited debates in a highly social atmosphere.

**************************************************************

Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

DETAILS
We'll have two groups running at the same time: Middle Beginners and Lower Intermediates.

Jorge Gallegos and María Angélica García from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. results.description:
Bodhisattvas (Buddhists and like/opened minded compassionate friends) are now everywhere yet still hard to find.  So come join us and get connected with other bodhisattvas from the New York Metro area.  Every Friday we meet other compassionate friends at the Rubin Museum Cafe in a relaxed and easy going atmosphere.

Bodhi Lounge is a social/entrepreneurial meetup for Buddhists, or anyone interested in meeting Buddhists and learning about Buddhism. That said, people of any faith or practice—or no spiritual practice—are all welcome!  Let's all get along and learn from each other. So let's meet and have a cheerful time making new friends and/or helping each other grow our friendships or businesses!

So why are we always at the Rubin Museum Cafe and not check out other locations?  Rubin Museum is a Himalayan museum, which means mostly Buddhist art.  Thus we like this museum!  Also, by being at one location all the time, people now can just show up if their schedule opens up.  There, that easy!

This is a joint social between Body Lounge and Dharma Drink.  We are always at one location; ask the museum staff for the Dharma Drink group.  If the first staff does not know, ask another.

See you soon!
results.how_to_find_us: Ask the museum staff for the Buddhist social group!

results.description:
OCTOBER 16, 2015 (FRIDAY)

6:30 PM HAPPY HOUR / 7:00 PM BOOK CLUB

NEW LOCATION: EMERALD INN, 250 W 72nd St, (Rear Room) / ONE BLOCK WEST OF BROADWAY

HOST: DAVID ORENSTEIN, Ph.D

BOOK: “Creating Change Through Humanism: Humanism Doesn't Have a Bible. But If It Did, This Would Be It!”


AUTHOR: ROY SPECKHARDT, PRESIDENT OF THE AMERICAN HUMANIST ASSOCIATION, WASHINGTON, DC.

We're going to skype him into the meeting so the audience can ask him questions about the book, his ideas and attitudes and about the AHA. Should be loads of fun.

Humanism is “the radical idea that you can be good without a god.” That’s how Roy Speckhardt, the longtime executive director of the American Humanist Association, defines it. His new book, Creating Change Through Humanism, lays out how and why people can lead moral and ethical lives without belief in a higher power. While surveys show that more and more Americans are giving up on religion, merely abandoning traditional religious faith is just one step on a path to a better way of thinking. Speckhardt explains how to take the next steps with the empathy and activism that characterize humanism today.


Humanism has inspired generations of individuals to improve themselves, their communities and their country. Creating Change Through Humanism describes how a humanist lifestance has influenced and can continue to advance acceptance, diversity and equality. Humanist ideals pervaded the U.S. from its founding, starting with the innovative idea of separating church and state to maintain a religiously-neutral government. Humanism has continued to propel our nation toward social progress by promoting basic human rights and dignity. The humanist movement, with its forward-thinking outlook and emphasis on critical thinking and self-reflection, has been at the forefront of such pressing social issues as civil rights, women’s rights, LGBTQ equality, responsible scientific freedom, and the environment and population dynamics.

Speckhardt interweaves personal stories, including his own, of individuals who have journeyed from organized religion to humanistic convictions. He encourages his readers to be open about their own lack of belief and to become active in social and political causes, so they can put their positive values into action and combat the anti-humanist prejudice propagated by the religious right.

 ----------------------------------

NEW LOCATION: EMERALD INN, 250 W 72nd St, (Rear Room) / ONE BLOCK WEST OF BROADWAY


COST: Free, but purchase drink or food to compensate Emerald Inn for their space

======================

A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. Greg the founder of Dharma Drink: "I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelugpa - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, and the curious - just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other." We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist and like minded hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more,             the merrier.

This free workshop introduces the The Art of Living Foundation's seminal programs.  Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from the Foundation's programs which teach simple yet powerful breathing and meditative techniques for reducing stress, anxiety, and fear, while increasing the potential for clarity, joy, and inner peace.

In the workshop we explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice.

results.description:
The Whitney is PAY WHAT YOU WISH on Fridays from 7pm to 10pm. We'll meet at a nearby cafe before heading over to the museum. I'll send an email to attendees a couple days before the event with details.

If people are up for it, we may head out for a drink/bite afterwards...

Archibald Motley (1891—1981) was one of the most important figures associated with the Harlem Renaissance and is best known as both a master colorist and a radical interpreter of urban culture. Archibald Motley: Jazz Age Modernist is the first full-scale survey of his paintings in two decades. The exhibition will offer an unprecedented opportunity to carefully examine Motley’s dynamic depictions of modern life in his home town, Chicago, as well as in Jazz Age Paris and Mexico. Specifically, it will highlight his unique use of both expressionism and social realism and will resituate this underexposed artist within a broader, art historical context. The exhibition will be presented in the sky-lit eighth floor galleries.

Jared Madere (b. 1986), an emerging artist based in New York, will receive his first solo exhibition in the United States at the Whitney, creating a new installation in the John R. Eckel, Jr. Foundation Gallery on the first floor, which is free to the public. Madere primarily creates installation-based works featuring disparate materials such as salt, flowers, foodstuffs, and plastic tarps that are assembled and aggregated in a manner that insists on their material connections to society, economics, industry, and human emotion. For Madere, the meanings and associations of objects are never stripped away—floral arrangements can point to longing or sadness and a burnt coat is imbued with isolation and dejection. Madere has participated in numerous exhibitions at venues including David Lewis, New York; Bortolami Gallery, New York; Michael Thibault Gallery, Los Angeles; Croy Nielsen, Berlin; and Le Magasin, Grenoble, France; and he is also the founder of Bed-Stuy Love Affair, an artist-run gallery focused on emerging art.

results.description:
Join a bunch of singles in their 50's and 60's as we casually stroll along the entire length of the High Line while the sun sets. This is Date Walking's most popular event! Check out some photos from our previous 50+ age range strolls here, here, and here. 

What's the High Line you ask? The High Line is an elevated rail line transformed into a public park that spans 24 blocks on Manhattan’s West Side.  

Afterwards we'll have a few drinks and chit chat on the Frying Pan. The Frying Pan is a salvaged historic boat turned into a giant floating restaurant and bar. Cool right?! 

We'll meet at 6:30 PM on the corner of Ganesvoort and Washington streets under the start of the High Line and we'll get to know each other while we wait for everyone to arrive. 

The walk will start at EXACTLY 7 PM.  If you are late, you will miss us. Do not be late.

How will you find us? Look for the group of people standing under the start of the High Line and then look for the tallest guy there. That will be Beau, your Date Walk organizer. 

What to expect? Date Walks are very casual and easy-to-attend / non-awkward + the host, Beau is always there to make introductions. It’s really easy to meet people. 

Closest Subway: A, C, E and L 

Pace/Distance/Duration: The pace of this walk will be super casual. The distance is around 1 mile. From start to finish takes approximately 1 hour. 

Rain Date: If it rains this walk will be postponed to a future date.

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 


Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call.

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer 

Call/Text:[masked] 
Email: [masked] 
Date Walking | Facebook­ | Twitter­
results.name: Singles Sunset Walk on the High Line | Age: 50+

-------------------------------------------------------------------


The Hikes are a Sierra Club Event...

ENJOY THE TERRIFIC FALL FOLIAGE!!!

This is the BEST TIME to be in the Mountains!!!

Lets Hike - Reboot our Mind - Enjoy Nature - Mingle - Bonfire - Party 

IN The Mountains of PA !!!

Here is are links to some of the PICs from our last Few Trips ...

http://www.meetup.com/HangOutInQueensAndNassau/photos/26280067/

http://www.meetup.com/new-york-brainiacs/events/220625428/

http://www.meetup.com/LongIslandTrailEnthusiasts/photos/21129322/

http://www.meetup.com/5BoroEXPLORATION/photos/22901702/

Quick Getaway !!!

Located in a Private community with 4 lakes, Tennis/Basketball/Volleyball Courts and other community amenities.


Please understand that Space is Limited... this meetup is listed on multiple groups!!! RSVPs on this Group are not the complete Attendee list.

Newly Built, fully furnished, roomy, Full Kitchen, FirePlace and other amenities. 

THE PLANNED ITINERARY:

ENJOY THE TERRIFIC FALL FOLIAGE!!!

HIKE... Relax... Mingle... Meditate... Bonfire Party ..

• Friday = IceBreaker Games + Night Hike: Get there as early as you can. Orientation party. Then optional Night Walk. Enjoy an evening walk in the hills of PA. See the stars/moon on a dark night. Music, talk, mingle.

• Sat Morning: Breakfast get together. We have a full kitchen. Please bring/pack your breakfast (so we are not wasting valuable daylight waiting to get served at a restaurant). You can surely go to town (10 min away) for breakfast as long as you can meet the rest of the day's schedule.

• After Breakfast: Rejuvenate, Relax & Center your mind with Optional Guided Meditation (approx. 20-25 min). 

• Sat Afternoon: Hike, enjoy the beautiful surroundings in the Mtns of PA. Terrific Foliage Views.


• Picnic Lunch:. (sandwiches etc - Could be purchased from the town before the start of the hike - or you can bring it from home).

• Sat Evening - FIREPLACE: Return from the hike, relax, Coffee/Tea/Wine/Beer break. Pack up the Cooler Go for Swim/Drink/Party at Community Beach / Lake. Then WARM UP by the indoor FIREPLACE. Later Fire up the BONFIRE!!!  Marshmallows - Music - Songs around the BONFIRE. Please bring your musical instruments & Party Games.

• Sat Dinner: Depending on popular opinion, in the past, we mostly ordered pizza, or BBQ'd. If you wish, you can surely pickup what ever you desire to eat from the town.  

• Sat Night - BONFIRE: House Party!!!  Games, Party, Dance, Music, Sing or play your musical instrument.

• Sun Morning: Breakfast get together

• Sun Afternoon: Hike / Explore nearby area

• Lunch: Optional Lunch at nearby Diner or Picnic spot.

• Return Sun evening.                    

==>>>    The above Itinerary worked well in the past few trips, so we plan to keep it similar...  all activities are optional... 

COST:

$58 per night = TOTAL $116 (for Two nights) - House Shared Rent. 

Paypal $116 to:    [masked] 

Please send funds as a gift, and the Friends / Family Box (on paypal) must be checked.  Please ensure there are no paypal fees for this payment! 

We need to receive full amount ($116) to confirm your spot, which will be filled on a first come first serve basis.  An RSVP on the meetup site does not hold the spot.

Car-Pool (gathering spot): 

Please post if you will need a ride or are driving ... we will finalize car-pools closer to the event.

This is an event organized for our friends to get together and socialize. We are not professional hikers or professional organizers. You are welcome to join us but before you attend you must familiarize yourself with the risks associated with this type of activity.

Hiking or outdoor activities have inherent risks. Your participation in our hikes or other events could be dangerous and can result in serious injury, medical emergency, even death. It is your responsibility to learn the trails and to follow the group so you do not get detached from the group. Make yourself aware of your surroundings and trail conditions at all times. results.description:
Join a bunch of singles in their 50's and 60's as we casually stroll along the entire length of the High Line while the sun sets. This is Date Walking's most popular event! Check out some photos from our previous 50+ age range strolls here, here, and here. 

What is the High Line you ask? The High Line is an elevated rail line transformed into a public park that spans 24 blocks on Manhattan’s West Side. 

Afterwards we'll have a few drinks and chit chat on the Frying Pan. The Frying Pan is a salvaged historic boat turned into a giant floating restaurant and bar. Cool right?! 

We'll meet at 6:30 PM on the corner of Ganesvoort and Washington streets under the start of the High Line and we'll get to know each other while we wait for everyone to arrive. 

The walk will start at EXACTLY 7 PM. If you are late, you will miss us. Do not be late.

How will you find us? Look for the group of people standing under the start of the High Line and then look for the tallest guy there. That will be Beau, your Date Walk organizer. 

What to expect? Date Walks are very casual and easy-to-attend / non-awkward + the host, Beau is always there to make introductions. It’s really easy to meet people. 

Closest Subway: A, C, E and L 

Pace/Distance/Duration: The pace of this walk will be super casual. The distance is around 1 mile. From start to finish takes approximately 1 hour. 

Rain Date: If it rains this walk will be postponed to a future date.

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call.

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer

results.description:
Please join us for our first monthly Women in Tech meetup! We are looking for women of all ages (8-80's+) to join us to discuss opportunities for women in the tech and startup industries. You don't have to know anything about the subject. If you are an engineering wizard we also welcome you. We are looking at ways to empower women from all walks of life to come up with creative ideas, find solutions to bring those ideas to market, and avenues in which to turn those ideas into revenue. We are looking to create a community that can help mentor each other and create opportunities for all of us.


• This is a bilingual (Spanish/English) meetup.


• Lego/craft area for small children.


Agenda:

• Introductions

• Organizer introductions- who we are, why we are doing this

• Audience introductions- who you are, what are you interested in?

• Mini hackathon/brainstorming session using littleBit electronics. Participants will be divided into teams and each team will be given a challenge that they must solve. littleBits are fun, easy to use, snap together electronic components that work great for prototyping ideas quickly.


• Networking- a few minutes at the end to chat informally, exchange contacts, etc.


Thank you to our NYC Councilwoman, Debi Rose for helping to support programs like this at SI MakerSpace.
results.how_to_find_us: Our entrance is on Thompson St, between Bay and Front
results.name: Women in Tech

results.description:
Join us the 3rd Friday of each month for networking and coding!

Socializing starts at 6:30PM — Make new friends, find a study group or study partner, or just practice your people skills. :-)

Xcoding — That's what it's all about, right? During a typical MeetUp people socialize, work on Stanford assignments, ask other members questions, ask for help with a bug, offer help to others, etc. There is no set agenda and no formal presentation. If you prefer to sit in a corner and code away, you can do that. If you want to walk around offering people a helping hand, you can do that too.

Just Getting Started? Follow these steps . . .

• Stanford CS193P Winter 2015 Class (Swift) — Developing iOS 8 Apps with Swift

• Stanford CS193P Fall 2013 Class (Objective-C) — Developing iOS 7 Apps for iPhone and iPad

• Get the homework assignments and lecture code from Stanford University

• Download Xcode from the Mac App Store

• Sign up for a free Developer Account (note: the free account doesn't allow you to install apps on your device, for that you'll need the $99/year account)
results.name: iOS Study Group, 3rd Friday

Join us as #BrownGirls hits Brick City! Brown Girls Bar Crawl - Open Doors Edition is being held in partnership with Have You Met Newark?, the Newark Times and Gentleman Culture as a part of Newark Arts Council's Open Doors Weekend! We will be making stops at some of Newark's greatest bars and galleries. You don't want to miss the chance to view fabulous art, drink great cocktails and make new friends in Downtown Newark!

There are two teams and BOTH START at 6:30 PM at Alva. From there the teams will hit 3 more bars as well as some art galleries and BOTH END at the official Friday night afterparty for Open Doors. 

Admission is $10. A ticket is required to join the event. No tickets will be sold at the crawl! Purchase here https://www.eventbrite.com/e/brown-girls-bar-crawl-open-doors-edition-tickets-7008262903

Your admission gets you a fashionable wristband with access to the free drinks or appetizers that have been arranged at a number of the establishments. Many of the bars will have special pricing and happy hours. Please be sure to bring cash to make closing out at each stop easier.

results.description:
Hey Brooklyn Swing Friends!

SWING DANCE with Dancewave this Friday at our East Coast Swing Class

6:30-7:30pm at 182 4th Avenue Brooklyn!

Want to learn to Swing Dance? Intimidated by the "Pros"? Here's your chance to learn the basics of swing that will get your feet hoppin! Build your swing dance vocabulary each week as we learn a new step every class! Suzie Q, Hammerlock, and Swivel your way to become a pro! East Coast Swing is a fun and easy-to-learn class is not only good exercise, but it's a great way to meet new people and make new friends! Classes are designed for both drop-in students and regular attendees, so even if you can't attend every class, you'll still be able to pick up the moves, have fun and make great progress in your swing technique. No dance partner is necessary, as we will rotate dance partners throughout class. Each month we'll learn a new dance routine so there will always be new material to learn! 

Join us every Friday from 6:30 – 7:30 pm at 182 4th Avenue Brooklyn

For more information about Dancewave’s Swing Class –  CLICK HERE!

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Note: This is an award ceremony & musical performance. 

When you RSVP, you will be asked you to provide your name and e-mail in order to get guaranteed access to the event (the good news: no duplicate registration needed this time).


Deutsches Haus at NYU will proudly award the third annual Volkmar and Margret Sander Prize to the distinguished President of the Max Kade Foundation, Inc., Lya Friedrich Pfeifer.


What is it?
Walter Hinderer, Professor Emeritus of Germanic Languages and Literatures at Princeton University, will hold the laudatory speech in honor of Lya Friedrich Pfeifer.

A musical performance of "Lieder" by Franz Schubert with Kristina Bachrach (soprano) and Miori Sugiyama (piano) will conclude the award ceremony.

Once the event starts, it will probably be a bit over 1 hour in duration. 

Make sure you are on time or arrive early, the doors will be open.


Scroll to bottom for additional information & facts.

Do I have to speak German?

No, the event is held in English

Who is hosting the event?

Deutsches Haus @ NYU is the host for this event.  They have staff members on site. 

How do I get there by subway?

N/R - 8th St NYU (3 Blocks)

6 - Astor Place (4 blocks)

B/D/F/M - West 4th St (5-8 Blocks)

Is there a bar / food  available?

There will be some catered food on-site.

How do I register or reserve a seat?

Just RSVP here in the group and answer the question you will be asked. We need your name & e-mail in order to complete the RSVP (but no more double registration needed).

Additional Info & Facts:

Lya Friedrich Pfeifer - President of the Max Kade Foundation, Inc. since 2003 – has used her cultural heritage, education, and career to further the cause of mutual understanding and cultural and educational exchange between the peoples of Germany and the United States. 

Through her leadership, the Foundation has become one of the most influential and involved bastions of promoting and strengthening German-U.S. ties. Prior to joining Max Kade, she was a practicing attorney in New York City. 

Lya Friedrich Pfeifer is a recipient of Germany’s Knights’ Cross of the Order of Merit (Verdienstkreuz am Bande 1. Klasse) and serves as Director and President of the German-American School Association of New York, Director and Vice President of the German American Partnership Program, New York (GAPP), Director and President of Friends of Goethe, New York, Inc., Director of the Liederkranz Foundation, Inc., and member of the Advisory Committee of Deutsches Haus at NYU, to name a few of her many contributions to the dialogue between Germany and the United States.

The Volkmar and Margret Sander Prize was established by Professor Margret Sander in memory of her late husband, Professor Volkmar Sander, former head of the German Department of NYU and founder and first director of Deutsches Haus at NYU. The prestigious annual prize, which was awarded for the first time in 2013 to Professor Fritz Stern and to Dr. Gary Smith in 2014, is endowed with a $5000 grant, and honors individuals who have made outstanding contributions to the cultural, political, and academic relationship between the German-speaking world and the United States.

I hope to see many of you at the event, please make sure you answer the question upon you RSVP, and please, as always, update your RSVP if your plans change. It is essential to the organizer and highly appreciated!

Thomas Langheinrich

[masked]

[masked]

results.description:
Improvisation classes leading to a performance group.

SPOLIN-IST is seeking players who are willing to explore Viola Spolin's Theater Games through a series of classes. Players who pursue the training will have the chance to be a part of our shows at Caffe Vivaldi scheduled to start in early 2016. Classes are open to both actors and non-actors.

Fee : 

Four classes : 

$120 ($30 per class)

Drop-in : $35 per class 

PayPal: [masked] / or CASH

Director/Sidecoach: Ege Maltepe ( www.egemaltepe.com )

Contact: [masked]

*********************************************************************

A letter from award winning actor/director/writer Alan Alda about his experience with Viola Spolin. Alda was among the young actors who worked with Spolin along with Alan Arkin in Young Actors Company.


Compass Thoughts My memory of Compass at Hyannisport is that we prepared during rehearsals by inventing characters and then improvising as those characters in a variety of situations. Having a character to fall back on gave us some sense of security later, when we faced audiences during spot improvisations. But I felt mostly that we were operating on pure guts. Guts improvising seemed less appealing a year or so later when I was introduced to Viola Spolin's improvising games. Here was a whole system that could be relied on. There was no joke making required, or even allowed, and yet the scenes that emerged were often hilarious. Rather than gags or conventional sketch comedy, what became funny was surprising human behavior. The main thing that emerges in Spolin's games is not the invention of funny stuff, but the discovery of things in you that you didn't know where there. It's true that a harder, laugh-oriented kind of performance is probably more appropriate for a cabaret show, but I think we might have benefitted from some training in Spolin's Theater Games before we set out to be consciously funny. The benefits of relating to the other player and the resulting spontaneity, I think, can be beneficial to any kind of playing. In fact, the games help in a surprising range of ways. I'm teaching Viola's games to scientists now and we're finding that after a short course in improv workshops, the scientist are able to speak about their work to audiences with far more clarity and vividness than they could before. Their increased willingness and ability to connect with the audience is remarkable. I've always been grateful for all my improvising experience — at Compass, in Spolin-style workshops, and in experimental workshops devised by people who have devoted themselves to exploring this special world of spontaneity. I hope these explorations grow as more people discover the pleasures of freely entering into the group experience. Paradoxically, one pleasure of the group experience is the emergence of one's own self. Alan Alda - December 26, 2011 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alan_Alda
results.name: SPOLIN IMPROVISATION WORKSHOP

Hey Gothamites, join us at the showroom of Steinway & Sons as the series of "salon concerts" there continues with the debut of the new chamber ensemble DU:OH, a collaboration between international artists Guillermo Laporta (flute) and Josefina Urraca (piano).

(Read artist bios ---> HERE)



The program will include Guillermo Laporta's transcriptions for flute of the following:

Claude Debussy        Violin Sonata

Ottorino Respighi     Violin Sonata in B Minor


SCHEDULE

The 7 pm listed start time is necessary to allow for check-in. The music will begin at 7:30. Please do not arrive after that, as this would be extremely disruptive to the performers and audience members.


ADMISSION 

$17 - Before Oct 14

$25 - On/After Oct 14


HOW TO PURCHASE TICKETS

1) Use this link: 

http://steinwaymeetup2.brownpapertickets.com/?discount=GSH

2) Brown Paper Tickets also takes orders over the phone at: 

1 (800)[masked]

(Please request event #[masked] with code GSH.) 

3) Due to strict venue rules, no money can be accepted on site. Please purchase your seat via one of the above methods. 

4) The names of all attendees will be on a list at the door. There will be no physical tickets for this performance.

5) Purchase deadline is 11:30 am on the day of the concert or when the venue capacity is reached.

6) Please note the price increase on October 14. Securing your seat as early as possible is recommended.

7) RSVP without payment does NOT reserve your seat or lock in the price. 

8) Sorry, refunds and exchanges are not available (unless the event is cancelled).  However, if you are unable to attend, you can send someone in your place.  At check-in, simply have him or her mention the name under which you paid.


POST-CONCERT MEETING: 

If there is interest, we will go someplace nearby for food, drinks and socializing.


See you there! 

Milton

Her effortlessly powerful vocals are backed by deep bass lines and acid jazz grooves for an intoxicating psychedelic sound that’s designed to make audiences move.

results.description:
Fermenting the Fall Harvest with Andrew Faust

$20 materials fee - everyone will take home a pint jar of kim chi.


Kim chi will be our fermentation focus; a spicy root ferment, great for vitality as the winter season approaches.

Please bring a pint glass mason jar, a good cutting knife, a cutting board and the rest will be supplied. Handouts of recipes will be provided.


IMPORTANT!!! Please register in advance so we can insure the correct amount of ingredients. This is sure to fill up fast!

Brooklyn Permaculture Meetup
Every Third Friday at The Commons
7pm-9pm
$5 Suggested donation - no one turned away!

Permaculture is a whole systems design science that is positively changing the way people think and interact with Earth. Turn problems into solutions by joining us in the discussion, design and implementation of projects in and around Brooklyn and the surrounding region. We are looking to create an active group of motivated beings that want to contribute to all the positive change that is happening in our region and the world. This Meetup will be lead by Andrew Faust and occasional visiting friends. Andrew is director at Center for Bioregional Living which since 2007 has been training permaculture designers in NYC and starting June 1st 2012 at their rural campus in Ellenville, NY. A certificate in Permaculture Design is very helpful but not necessary. Click HERE to join Brooklyn Permaculture Meetup.
results.name: Fermenting the Fall Harvest @ Brooklyn Permaculture Meetup

Manhattan's largest & most spectacular penthouse lounge & rooftop, the luxurious 230 Fifth is surrounded by floor to ceiling windows with breathtaking panoramic views of the NYC skyline. What to expect:

• DJ & Dancing all night

• Drink specials

• Complimentary appetizers

• Fun ice breakers

• Prizes & giveaways

Recommended ages: Females 21-45, Males 23-45

Tickets are only $20 each with RSVP, or $50 at door without RSVP

YOU MUST BE SINGLE, AVAILABLE AND LOOKING TO ATTEND!

results.description:
The Hikes are a Sierra Club Event...

ENJOY THE TERRIFIC FALL FOLIAGE!!!

This is the BEST TIME to be in the Mountains!!!

Lets Hike - Reboot our Mind - Enjoy Nature - Mingle - Bonfire - Party 

IN The Mountains of PA !!!

Here is are links to some of the PICs from our last Few Trips ...

http://www.meetup.com/HangOutInQueensAndNassau/photos/26280067/

http://www.meetup.com/new-york-brainiacs/events/220625428/

http://www.meetup.com/new-york-brainiacs/photos/25843664/ 

http://www.meetup.com/5BoroEXPLORATION/photos/25783623/

http://www.meetup.com/5BoroEXPLORATION/photos/25132142/ 

http://www.meetup.com/LongIslandTrailEnthusiasts/photos/21129322/

http://www.meetup.com/5BoroEXPLORATION/photos/22901702/

Quick Getaway !!!

Located in a Private community with 4 lakes, Tennis/Basketball/Volleyball Courts and other community amenities.


Please understand that Space is Limited... this meetup is listed on multiple groups!!! RSVPs on this Group are not the complete Attendee list.

Newly Built, fully furnished, roomy, Full Kitchen, FirePlace and other amenities. 

THE PLANNED ITINERARY:

ENJOY THE TERRIFIC FALL FOLIAGE!!!

HIKE... Relax... Mingle... Meditate... Bonfire Party ..

. 

• Friday: Get there as early as you can. Orientation party. Then optional Night Walk. Enjoy an evening walk in the hills of PA. See the stars/moon on a dark night. Music, talk, mingle.

• Sat Morning: Breakfast get together. We have a full kitchen. Please bring/pack your breakfast (so we are not wasting valuable daylight waiting to get served at a restaurant). You can surely go to town (10 min away) for breakfast as long as you can meet the rest of the day's schedule.

• After Breakfast: Rejuvenate, Relax & Center your mind with Optional Guided Meditation (approx. 20-25 min). 

• Sat Afternoon: Hike, enjoy the beautiful surroundings in the Mtns of PA. 

• Picnic Lunch:. (sandwiches etc - Could be purchased from the town before the start of the hike - or you can bring it from home).

• Sat Evening - FIREPLACE: Return from the hike, relax, Coffee/Tea/Wine/Beer break. Pack up the Cooler Go for Swim at Community Lake and/or WARM UP by the indoor FIREPLACE. Then later Fire up the BONFIRE!!!  Marshmallows - Music - Songs around the BONFIRE. Please bring your musical instruments & Party Games.

• Sat Dinner: Depending on popular opinion, in the past, we mostly ordered pizza, or BBQ'd. If you wish, you can surely pickup what ever you desire to eat from the town.  

• Sat Night - BONFIRE: House Party!!!  Games, Party, Dance, Music, Sing or play your musical instrument.

• Sun Morning: Breakfast get together

• Sun Afternoon: Hike / Explore nearby area

• Lunch: Optional Lunch at nearby Diner or Picnic spot.

• Return Sun evening.                    

==>>>    The above Itinerary worked well in the past few trips, so we plan to keep it similar...  all activities are optional... 

COST:

$58 per night = TOTAL $116 (for Two nights) - House Shared Rent. 

Paypal $116 to:    [masked] 

Please send funds as a gift, and the Friends / Family Box (on paypal) must be checked.  Please ensure there are no paypal fees for this payment! 

We need to receive full amount ($116) to confirm your spot, which will be filled on a first come first serve basis.  An RSVP on the meetup site does not hold the spot.

Car-Pool (gathering spot): 

Please post if you will need a ride or are driving ... we will finalize car-pools closer to the event.

This is an event organized for our friends to get together and socialize. We are not professional hikers or professional organizers. You are welcome to join us but before you attend you must familiarize yourself with the risks associated with this type of activity.

Hiking or outdoor activities have inherent risks. Your participation in our hikes or other events could be dangerous and can result in serious injury, medical emergency, even death. It is your responsibility to learn the trails and to follow the group so you do not get detached from the group. Make yourself aware of your surroundings and trail conditions at all times. You agree to participate in these events completely at your own risk and to take full responsibility for your own safety and well being, including those of your guests. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Co-Organizer, Assistant Organizers, Event Organizer, Event Hosts, Hike Leader or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. Your attendance at the event signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.
results.name: FALL FOLIAGE Hike + Bonfire + Party + Fun Activities in Mtns of PA!!!

results.description:
All levels are welcomed.

Our sessions are 2.5 hours with a long break in the middle. Attendees will draw from still lives with a break every half hour. 

During our session I will break off with each attendee individually to talk about the work they are creating and their individual drawing challenges. 

This is the fastest way to improve your drawing skills. It is a combination of practice and theory in the same class. 

Since each attendee comes to the session at a different level and with different challenges it is my goal to work with each person individually. 

• Space is limited and the setting is ideal. 

• Refreshments are served at the long break in the middle of the session. 

• Please bring a pad up to 16x20, a 2H, HB and 4B pencil and an eraser. 

• The price is $25 paid at the time of the class. 

• All levels are welcomed.

• Please RSVP through this meetup so I know you are coming. 

I look forward to seeing you there!

Simon

Simon Levenson is the drawing instructor at The National Arts Club and teaches drawing at The Museum of The City of New York.  Please read reviews by other students of his teaching here.
results.how_to_find_us: Please ask the doorman for the location.
results.name: Friday Night - Instructed Drawing Session

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$5 Draft Beers, House Wine, Well Mixed Drink

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.how_to_find_us: $5 Draft Beers, House Wine, Well Mixed Drink
results.name: Speeddating Ages 35-47 - SOLD OUT FOR WOMEN

Let's have a time of faith-building followed by some chill time- food, coffee, fellowship, movies, bowling, whatever..

 This is an ongoing class taught by Pastor William in which we study various books of the Bible; as well as biblical topics, doctrinal issues and interesting characters. We begin with a time of worship in song, followed by a time of prayer and conclude with a 45 minute teaching.
results.how_to_find_us: Education Annex, Room 201

results.description:
Let's meet up in NYC!  And create a beautiful painting together - Canvas, paint, brushes, easels, apron, lounge location are all included!  Also included is a paid working art instructor to teach you step by step on how to create a masterpiece from start to finish! 


Come together, paint together and have a great time!


A fun, lighthearted, non-judgmental painting class party event at a local bar, lounge, restaurant in New York City.   Come Bring your friends!

No walk in allowed.  Please email me directly if you have questions


Please RSVP, exclusively for meet-up members, there is a relatively small charge for attendance to cover for the cost of a large canvas, paint, bushes, supplies, a venue location and also a paid working instructor artist. 


I will send details and an invite to everyone personally who has RSVP. There is a cost to participate. We need to save appropriate space for everyone.


You will come home with a painting that you have created for yourself!


Must register online, a link for registration, a small fee is needed to cover for the cost of canvas, paint and a working paid artist instructor will be sent to people who RSVP!

Please email me directly if you have questions
No Walk-in

The King in Yellow has turned his gaze upon the Earth! Artists vomit inspiration, fanatics preach doom and destruction, and the madmen shudder and froth in their cells. Play an intrepid investigator attempting to unravel the mysteries threatening the world, traversing continents and dimensions as the hand of the Nameless One stretches farther and farther. Can you stop the King from ascending to his Earthly Throne?

This is a premium RPG event for ages 18+ ran by a staff Dungeon Master who specializes in horror and the macabre.

$20 per session for non-members.

$5 per session for Brooklyn Strategist members.

5-session card at $90.

I have pre-purchased 5 guest tickets, which are $5 each. The first 5 people who show up and give me $5 will get these tickets. If more people show up you can still buy a ticket at full price ($12 Adult, $10 Senior, $8 Student) if there are any left.

For further details: http://www.moma.org/visit/calendar/film_screenings/25022

results.description: Join the Alice Austen House museum for a cocktail party, Victorian style! Don period style props and pose for silhouette portraits in our specially-designed photo booth; enjoy a historically-inspired libation and other light refreshments; and check out the recently opened exhibit, Alice Austen Everyday: A Photo Series Inspired by Place, an installation of nearly 100 snapshots capturing the daily life Clear Comfort. Proceeds support the museum. Advance tickets recommended ($40/$35). More info: http://aliceausten.org/portraitsandpunch
results.name: Portraits & Punch at the Alice Austen House

7 pm- salsa dance lesson
8pm Live band sets
10 pm live band set

It will be $10 tickets to join. Sign up here so you are on the list, then pick up and pay your tickets at the door. You MUST BE ON THE LIST to enter for the reduced price. Write in the comments your languages so you can meet language partners!
results.how_to_find_us: Meet by the bar at 7 pm before the dance lesson starts!

venue.name: MakerBar

results.description:
BEGIN TRANSMISSION:

'We interrupt this broadcast transmission to bring you special breaking news report... live from Hoboken, MakerBar....'

Join us as we explorer the air waves with Software Defined Radio(SDR)... Also we will be running our OPEN CRAFT NIGHT as well. Bring a project, in any shape or form, hack the night away with us....

Or just come by explore the space, have a beer with us and see what creations are developing in the MakerBar community.....

For those interested in purchasing SDR hardware, most USB TV Dongles will work, however here's a link to Amazon with receivers that are known/documented to work:   http://tinyurl.com/amazon-sdr-receivers

For all you ebay shoppers, here's the link:  http://tinyurl.com/ebay-sdr-receivers

Also for those interested in a Quick Start guide for SDR-Sharp:

http://www.rtl-sdr.com/rtl-sdr-quick-start-guide/


For those curious about other compatible software see this link for more info:

results.description:
Evening Meditation and Book Signing at Tibet House

Nondual meditation teacher, psychotherapist, and author Loch Kelly returns to Tibet House to share the themes of his newest book, Shift Into Freedom: The Science and Practice of Open-Hearted Awareness. In his book Loch teaches that awakening is not something only a few spiritually evolved humans can achieve; it is part of everyone's natural potential. He offers simple direct pointers and meditation practices such as effortless mindfulness and heart mindfulness.


A book-signing for Shift into Freedom will take place at the end of the program.

Cost: $25


Click HERE to register.


About Loch Kelly, MDiv., LCSW:


Loch is the author of, Shift into Freedom: The Science and Practice of Open-Hearted Awareness. He is an educator, consultant, and recognized leader in the field of nondual meditation and psychotherapy who was asked to teach Sutra Mahamudra by Mingyur Rinpoche and nondual realization by Adyashanti. The founder of the Open-Hearted Awareness Institute, he is an emerging voice in modernizing meditation, social engagement, and collaborating with neuroscientists at Yale, UPenn and NYU to study how awareness training can enhance compassion and wellbeing. For more, visit lochkelly.org.

Please visit www.lochkelly.org for more information about his book, Audio CD, and upcoming events.
results.name: Loch Kelly - Meditation & Book Signing at Tibet House (Oct. 16, 2015, 7pm)

results.description:
Friday Night Magic is our regular Magic: the Gathering CCG event. Check the store calendar or call for details of what set we're currently drafting, but expect friendly competition and some nice prizes.


Our format is typically a BOOSTER DRAFT. $16 (including tax) gets you three boosters to play with and at least one prize pack at the end of the Swiss Draw-style tournament. Exclusive foil promo cards are also handed out to winners (and good sports).


Some previous experience with Magic is a good idea, just so you don't get destroyed your first time out, but we are always happy to help newcomers with their first draft.

AGES 13+ for this event, younger if there's a parent present for the event.

results.description:
Speed dating is the most effective way for men and women to meet. Nothin' beats meeting someone face to face in a nice and safe environment. Join us for an unforgettable night of speed dating, where you will meet up to 10 singles just like you in one FUN evening!

How does it work?

You will go on about 10 dates with someone of the opposite sex, each date will be 5 minutes long/short. We will provide you with materials to tell us who you liked. If the same person(s) you pick also pick you, you will be a "Match" and we will give you each others' contact information - then the rest is up to you! Call each other up and make plans to go out!

Recommended ages: Men 25-38, Women 23-36

Tickets are $20 if you RSVP on our Meetup group / $40 at door without RSVP if space is available.


PS: We are promoting this event on several Asian professionals groups, so don't go by the amount people you see RSVP on our Meetup alone - we assure you we will have a good amount of men and women participate at our event.
results.how_to_find_us: We have reserved Bar None exclusively for our event.
