results.description:
---------------------------------------------------------

*** UPDATE:

Only 4 Spots left.!!!

Please understand that this meetup is listed on several other meetup groups! The total RSVP count in those groups is already well over we can accommodate comfortable in the house. 

You Need to Paypal in order to confirm your spot.  An RSVP on the meetup site does not hold your spot. 

---------------------------------------------------------


The Hikes are a Sierra Club Event...

ENJOY THE TERRIFIC FALL FOLIAGE!!!

This is the BEST TIME to be in the Mountains!!!

Lets Hike - Reboot our Mind - Enjoy Nature - Mingle - Bonfire - Party 

IN The Mountains of PA !!!

Here is are links to some of the PICs from our last Few Trips ...

http://www.meetup.com/HangOutInQueensAndNassau/photos/26280067/

http://www.meetup.com/new-york-brainiacs/events/220625428/

http://www.meetup.com/new-york-brainiacs/photos/25843664/ 

http://www.meetup.com/5BoroEXPLORATION/photos/25783623/

http://www.meetup.com/5BoroEXPLORATION/photos/25132142/ 

http://www.meetup.com/LongIslandTrailEnthusiasts/photos/21129322/

http://www.meetup.com/5BoroEXPLORATION/photos/22901702/

Quick Getaway !!!

Located in a Private community with 4 lakes, Tennis/Basketball/Volleyball Courts and other community amenities.


Please understand that Space is Limited... this meetup is listed on multiple groups!!! RSVPs on this Group are not the complete Attendee list.

Newly Built, fully furnished, roomy, Full Kitchen, FirePlace and other amenities. 

THE PLANNED ITINERARY:

ENJOY THE TERRIFIC FALL FOLIAGE!!!

HIKE... Enjoy Foliage Views... Relax... Mingle... Meditate... Bonfire Party ... 

• Friday: Get there as early as you can. Orientation party. Then optional Night Walk. Enjoy an evening walk in the hills of PA. See the stars/moon on a dark night. Music, talk, mingle.

• Sat Morning: Breakfast get together. We have a full kitchen. Please bring/pack your breakfast (so we are not wasting valuable daylight waiting to get served at a restaurant). You can surely go to town (10 min away) for breakfast as long as you can meet the rest of the day's schedule.

• After Breakfast: Rejuvenate, Relax & Center your mind with Optional Guided Meditation (approx. 20-25 min). 

• Sat Afternoon: Hike, enjoy the beautiful surroundings in the Mtns of PA. 

• Picnic Lunch:. (sandwiches etc - Could be purchased from the town before the start of the hike - or you can bring it from home).

• Sat Evening - FIREPLACE: Return from the hike, relax, Coffee/Tea/Wine break. Pack up the Cooler Go for Swim/Relax/Drink at Community Lake and/or WARM UP by the indoor FIREPLACE. Then later Fire up the BONFIRE!!!  Marshmallows - Music - Songs around the BONFIRE. Please bring your musical instruments & Party Games.

• Sat Dinner: Depending on popular opinion, in the past, we mostly ordered pizza, or BBQ'd. If you wish, you can surely pickup what ever you desire to eat from the town.  

• Sat Night - BONFIRE: House Party!!!  Games, Party, Dance, Music, Sing or play your musical instrument.

• Sun Morning: Breakfast get together

• Sun Afternoon: Hike / Explore nearby area

• Lunch: Optional Lunch at nearby Diner or Picnic spot.

• Return Sun evening.                    

==>>>    The above Itinerary worked well in the past few trips, so we plan to keep it similar...  all activities are optional... 

COST:

$58 per night = TOTAL $116 (for Two nights) - House Shared Rent. 

Paypal $116 to:    [masked] 

Please send funds as a gift, and the Friends / Family Box (on paypal) must be checked.  Please ensure there are no paypal fees for this payment! 

We need to receive full amount ($116) to confirm your spot, which will be filled on a first come first serve basis.  An RSVP on the meetup site does not hold the spot.

Car-Pool (gathering spot): 

Please post if you will need a ride or are driving ... we will finalize car-pools closer to the event.

This is an event organized for our friends to get together and socialize. We are not professional hikers or professional organizers. You are welcome to join us but before you attend you must familiarize yourself with the risks associated with this type of activity.

Hiking or outdoor activities have inherent risks. Your participation in our hikes or other events could be dangerous and can result in serious injury, medical emergency, even death. It is your responsibility to learn the trails and to follow the group so you do not get detached from the group. Make yourself aware of your surroundings and trail conditions at all times. You agree to participate in these events completely at your own risk and to take full responsibility for your own safety and well being, including those of your guests. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Co-Organizer, Assistant Organizers, Event Organizer, Event Hosts, Hike Leader or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. Your attendance at the event signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.
results.name: FALL FOLIAGE Hike + Bonfire + Party + Fun Activities in Mtns of PA!!!

results.description:
Wok Wok has a huge menu, Malaysian, Thai, Chinese, & even Vietnamese. Let's go check it out family style. I will choose the dishes, but input will be considered. Estimate $26 pp including food/tax/tip & $3 fee. Drinks will be billed separately, as usual.

http://www.yelp.com/biz/wok-wok-new-york

Some possible menu choices, depending in part on the number of attendees:


Roti Canai

Street-Style Oyster Omelette

Curly Fries - Thai BBQ, curry aioli, garlic truffle and ranch dips

Indian Pasembur Salad - shrimp fritters, crispy tofu, hard-boiled eggs, jicama, cucumbers and spicy peanut sauce

Thai Green Papaya Salad w/dried shrimp, fresh chili roasted peanuts, & lime dressing


Beef Rendang

Babas Chili Chicken - slow-cooked in roasted chili and caramelized onion

Sambal Belacan - Shrimp w/stir-fry vegetables, sauteed in famous authentic spicy Malaysian shrimp paste


Sizzling A1 Shaking Beef Bo Luc Lac Sizzling Platter - Vietnamese-style tender beef, onion and bell pepper


Golden Calamari w/onion, bell pepper, scallion & smoked chili

At least one wok noodle dish TBA


House Special Tofu - scallops, mushrooms, snow peas, carrot, over crab meat egg sauce

Golden Kabocha Nuggets - fried Japanese kabocha pumpkin with salted egg

Kari Sayur Claypot - lentils, okra, tomatoes, string beans, carrots, tofu puffs and eggplant


Golden Eggplant w/dried shrimp, fresh chili, cilantro & garlic

Kang Kung Belacan or Sambal Belacan Petai - Water spinach or pungent petai beans sauteed with shrimp in spicy Malaysian shrimp paste


Pi Pa Duck - Half crispy roasted duck w/hoisin plum sauce

ABC shaved ice dessert


Who's in?

results.description:
Welcome to the Long Exposure workshop for beginners.  In this workshop we will be covering how to produce natural looking long exposure shots.  We will be using filters and no filters to produce these shots.  We will then look at the pictures on my laptop and review them and I'll provide recommendations for software.


Requirements:


*Camera capable of doing long exposure, at least 4 seconds

*Tripod (any tripod will do)

*Optional - 10 stop ND filter (optional), will set you back ~$30.00+ depending on your lenses thread size, you can purchase it here

Attendees can pay in cash (on-site) or credit on the site 

Contact me @[masked] if you have any questions
results.how_to_find_us: Brooklyn Ice Cream Factory 1 Water St New York, NY 11201
results.name: Long Exposure For Beginners & intermediate photographers workshop

results.description:
Note to regular attendees: Our new home is 748 Union St. @ 6th Ave. We will be meeting there for the next year while the Gowanus Arts Building undergoes renovations.


Model: Joy


Come draw from a live nude model!

The fee for this meetup is $15 per person. Drawing is every first, second and third Friday of the month, 7-9pm.

We focus on short, challenging poses (though we include a few 10- or 15-minute poses on request). This is designed to help artists of all levels to get back to basics and focus on the gesture behind the pose. Artists must bring their own materials: charcoal, pens, watercolors, gouache, pencils, and newsprint or sketch pads are ideal, but feel free to experiment with any media you want to bring!

See you soon and happy drawing!
results.name: Dynamic Figure Drawing in Brooklyn

Rejoice! It's almost time for the Chinatown Throwdown at the ***NEW (see note at bottom of the page) Britpack Theater! Cyrus McQueen (Last Comic Standing)

results.description:
ok  everyone , 

 Here is a fun  nighttime event  to get you in the creepy  I can't sleepy kinda mood.. theses tours are very popular  they always sell out  so if you think you want to go  buy the ticket quickly .(SLEEPY HOLLOW CEMTERY EVENT PAGE  OR ShowClix.com) $24.99 . This is a  guided evening HISTORY walk thru the cemetery  by only lantern light  * unless we have moon light  ? NOT A HAUNTED HOUSE TYPE THING  NO ONE JUMPING OUT AT YOU!J ust your own  imagination  playing tricks on you  . but it is dark and their is un even ground in  spots  so  please be mindful of your ability  to maneuver  thru out this event  . the guide will not wait up and you don't want to be lost in the cemetery at night on your own .. I  have done this event in the past and it is very fun and its a chance to see the grounds at night with out getting locked up  .. we will see their  receiving vault   which was  Barnubus Collins   crypt   in  DARK SHADOWS      .. dress for weather  and wear sturdy shoes  so come along if you Dare..

results.description:
Please join a fun and friendly group of people who are interested in playing a variety of games. Examples of games that we play include:

Word games - Word on the Street, Buzzword, Taboo, Wordie Wars, Snatch-it

Party and social games - Consensus, Apples to Apples, Dixit, Telestrations, 5 Second Rule, Awkward Family Photos,

Lighter strategy games - Ticket to Ride, Qwirkle, Carcassonne, 

Medium to heavier strategy games - Settlers of Catan, Old Dominion, Spyrium, Tzolk'in

Cooperative games - Forbidden Island, Flashpoint, Police Precinct

Card games - Parade, Station Master, Slide 5, Mill Bornes, Bohnanza,

Trivia games - Split Decision, Malarkey, Trivial Pursuit

Role playing games - Werewolf, Resistance, Avalon

Please feel free to bring your own games as well - there are always people looking to learn something new or to find a new favorite board game.

Transportation - for those who drive, there is ample parking in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center. For those who commute by bus, the Q13 and Q28 bus lines stop here. 

We encourage members to purchase food, drinks, and snacks at Panera Bread, so please refrain from bringing outside food and drinks. We want Panera to enjoy our presence!

If you're looking to play fun games with a really nice group of people, come meet up with us at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center.  Newcomers are always welcome!


If you want to join our Facebook group to get the latest news on board games, hot deals on games, buying/selling games, or simply just to connect with other gamers, please join us here:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/queensboardgames/

results.description:
-------------------------------------------------------------------------

*** UPDATE:

Only 4 Spots left.!!!

Please understand that this meetup is listed on several other meetup groups! The total RSVP count in those groups is already well over we can accommodate comfortable in the house.

You Need to Paypal in order to confirm your spot.  An RSVP on the meetup site does not hold your spot.


---------------------------------------------------------------------------

The Hikes are a Sierra Club Event...

ENJOY THE TERRIFIC FALL FOLIAGE!!!

This is the BEST TIME to be in the Mountains!!!

Lets Hike - Reboot our Mind - Enjoy Nature - Mingle - Bonfire - Party 

IN The Mountains of PA !!!

Here is are links to some of the PICs from our last Few Trips ...

http://www.meetup.com/HangOutInQueensAndNassau/photos/26280067/


http://www.meetup.com/new-york-brainiacs/events/220625428/

http://www.meetup.com/new-york-brainiacs/photos/25843664/ 

http://www.meetup.com/5BoroEXPLORATION/photos/25783623/

http://www.meetup.com/5BoroEXPLORATION/photos/25132142/ 

http://www.meetup.com/LongIslandTrailEnthusiasts/photos/21129322/

http://www.meetup.com/5BoroEXPLORATION/photos/22901702/

Quick Getaway !!!

Located in a Private community with 4 lakes, Tennis/Basketball/Volleyball Courts and other community amenities.


Please understand that Space is Limited... this meetup is listed on multiple groups (over 20)!!! Therefore, RSVPs on this Group are not the complete Attendee list.

Newly Built, fully furnished, roomy, Full Kitchen, FirePlace and other amenities. 

THE PLANNED ITINERARY:

ENJOY THE TERRIFIC FALL FOLIAGE!!!

HIKE... Relax... Mingle... Meditate... Bonfire Party ..

. 

• Friday: Get there as early as you can. Orientation party. Then optional Relaxing Night Walk. Enjoy a quiet evening walk in the hills of PA. See the stars/moon on a dark night. Music, talk, mingle.

• Sat Morning: Breakfast get together. We have a full kitchen. Please bring/pack your breakfast (so we are not wasting valuable daylight waiting to get served at a restaurant). You can surely go to town (10 min away) for breakfast as long as you can meet the rest of the day's schedule.

• After Breakfast: Rejuvenate, Relax & Center your mind with Optional Guided Meditation (approx. 20-25 min). 

• Sat Afternoon: Hike, enjoy the beautiful surroundings in the Mtns of PA. 

• Picnic Lunch:. (sandwiches etc - Could be purchased from the town before the start of the hike - or you can bring it from home).

• Sat Evening - FIREPLACE: 

Return from the hike, relax, Coffee/Tea/Wine break. Pack up the Cooler Go for Swim at Community Lake and/or WARM UP by the indoor FIREPLACE. Then later Fire up the BONFIRE!!!  Marshmallows - Music - Songs around the BONFIRE. Please bring your musical instruments & Party Games.

• Sat Dinner: Depending on popular opinion, in the past, we mostly ordered pizza, or BBQ'd. If you wish, you can surely pickup what ever you desire to eat from the town.  

• Sat Night - BONFIRE: House Party!!!  Games, Party, Dance, Music, Sing or play your musical instrument.

• Sun Morning: Breakfast get together

• Sun Afternoon: Hike / Explore nearby area

• Lunch: Optional Lunch at nearby Diner or Picnic spot.

• Return Sun evening.                    

==>>>    The above Itinerary worked well in the past few trips, so we plan to keep it similar...  all activities are optional... 

COST:

$58 per night = TOTAL $116 (for Two nights) - House Shared Rent. 

Paypal $116 to:    [masked] 

Please send funds as a gift, and the Friends / Family Box (on paypal) must be checked.  Please ensure there are no paypal fees for this payment! 

We need to receive full amount ($116) to confirm your spot, which will be filled on a first come first serve basis.  An RSVP on the meetup site does not hold the spot.

Car-Pool (gathering spot): 

Please post if you will need a ride or are driving ... we will finalize car-pools closer to the event.

This is an event organized for our friends to get together and socialize. We are not professional hikers or professional organizers. You are welcome to join us but before you attend you must familiarize yourself with the risks associated with this type of activity.

Hiking or outdoor activities have inherent risks. Your participation in our hikes or other events could be dangerous and can result in serious injury, medical emergency, even death. It is your responsibility to learn the trails and to follow the group so you do not get detached from the group. Make yourself aware of your surroundings and trail conditions at all times. You agree to participate in these events completely at your own risk and to take full responsibility for your own safety and well being, including those of your guests. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Co-Organizer, Assistant Organizers, Event Organizer, Event Hosts, Hike Leader or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. Your attendance at the event signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.

Every Friday we have a causal gathering of open minded souls, who
want to learn from Bhagavad Gita, the Vedic wisdom, and incorporate
in to their life. We will be learning various fascinating topics
like karma and reincarnation, Who am I, What is the real purpose
of life? Who god is? material life, Consciousness, etc.

Mantra meditation is the process of bhakti yoga consisting of
hearing and chanting the names of the lord on the beads, followed by
melodious music to invoke lord's mercy. This practice has a powerful
heart opening effect, which can be best understood through direct
experience. Come, relax in a warm and friendly atmosphere. Listen/observe
or just chant with us or sing your heart out! Questions, personal
realization, and discussion about the application of spiritual
practice are welcome.

Free Home made vegetarian/vegan dinner
(prasadam) served.

Admission to each meetup is free.
Donations for meetups expenses are welcome.

results.description:
http://www.nysec.org/sites/default/files/styles/medium/public/images/Cafe%2010.16%20%282%29.jpg?itok=7KPy7z4o Could you use a laugh? We sure could! Due to popular demand, we're bringing back The Café at Ethical. Join us for a hilarious evening of great standup comedy with Laughing Liberally's Scott Blakeman and Leighann Lord.

Scott Blakeman is an original member of Laughing Liberally. He has performed his political comedy around the world including the Just for Laughs Festival in Montreal, the Edinburgh Fringe Festival in Scotland and the Jewish Historical Museum in Amsterdam. 

Leighann Lord has been seen on Comedy Central, HBO and The View. She is the author of Dict Jokes: Alternate Definitions for Words You’ve Probably Never Heard of But Will Definitely Never Forget, and a co-host of the Emmy-nominated StarTalk with Neil de Grasse Tyson.

 If you like your comedy smart, thoughtful, and flat out funny, you owe it to yourself to become a regular at The Café. Bring friends. They’ll thank you. Besides, it’s election season. You need the comic relief. 

Entry to our 100-year-old building and meeting rooms is available for most wheelchair users with prior arrangements. Please call ahead  [masked] x 107) for setup of our portable system and plan to arrive one hour before start time.

results.description:
Many in our society are fascinated by this topic.


There are two views of culture: A general perception of social conditions, and of a specific qualitative evolution of civilization. And humanism means many things to different people. Different types of humanism can be authentic and genuine, or they can be false and exploitative, or outright manipulative.

Cults can be even more challenging for society, as some are based on apocalyptic doomsday beliefs or the anticipation of a nuclear holocaust precipitated by terrorist triggers. Believers in completely irrational ideas often confuse them with what they consider absolute truth.

At this meeting, Joseph Ben-David will help to disentangle and bring clarity into the gamut of secular and religious ideas. This lecture/discussion is a program of the Humanist Foundation. Socializing and light refreshments served.

Info:[masked]; [masked]
results.how_to_find_us: Please use 76th St entrance (corner CPW). The guard will direct you to our Meetup room.
results.name: "Humanism - Cult or Culture?"

results.description:
What’s it all about? Is spirituality part of your everyday life? How do you find it? Each monthly conversation will focus on a specific topic or question to guide the conversation.

Upcoming topic:    Awaken to Greater Spirituality in Your Life

The questions and challenges in our lives seem to be never ending. Do you feel there is more to you and life than meets the eye? What does it mean to be spiritual, and how do you define a spiritual experience? How do you recognize spiritual meaning in the experiences you have? Are you ready to explore the next step on your own spiritual journey?

Please join us for this open discussion format—come to explore ideas, share your experiences, ask questions, or hear from others. Our goal is to learn from and honor each other’s spiritual insights in a relaxed and comfortable environment. We look forward to meeting you for the first time or seeing you again. Feel free to bring a friend.

This Meetup repeats on the 3rd Friday of every month at the same location and time. Look for our future postings, including conversations on these topics: The Quest for Truth … Is Life a Random Walk? … Dreams are Real—What is Their Purpose? … You Have Lived Before—Past Lives and Karmic Ties…What’s Love Got to Do With It? … When Love Replaces Fear … Are There Spiritual DOs and DON’Ts? … Soul Travel and Out-of-Body Experiences … Awaken to Greater Spirituality in Your Life … An Intimate Relationship with God

Panera Bread at 15 Bloomfield Ave. Montclair, NJ 
(In Glenmont Square next to 7-ELEVEN; parking available)


For information on other events being held throughout the state,
visit www.eckankar-nj.org

As the weather turns cooler and our Fall Marathoners line up for the big day, we need to make sure we keep hydrated, and there is no better place than the Zeppelin Hall Beer Garden which is celebrating Oktoberfest. So whether beer, wine, or mixed-drinks, come out to race talk, drink, and be merry! Whether you are a staple at our morning or evening runs, haven't been out for a while, or haven't come to a meetup run yet, this is a great chance to get together. If you have joined the group and are on the fence about coming out for a run, come out, grab a beer, and ask us any questions you have on how often we run, pace, etc. We have a group of very experienced runners who offer great advice and runners of all shapes, sizes, and speeds so everyone will feel right at home.

Any questions, ask in a comment below... or ask us at the Beer Garden! Prost!

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

Can't tell the difference between the Yankees and the Red Sox(and don't care to)? Do you miss the multiple references to Sesame Street and Twilight (and don't miss missing them)? Then this group is for you!

We are a bunch of global transplants to New York, who want to form meaningful friendships with other international folks new to New York. This is not a business networking group, nor a singles meet-market nor any kind of "take a cut on your drinks" broker, just a fun, informal place for internationals new to New York--and those who love them--to connect.

If you are up for a glass of beer and a good conversation on books, travel, the life you've left behind and the one you are about to embark on or anything under the sun (or the roof of a bar), come by and make a few good friends.
results.name: The International Happy Hour: For NY's global citizens--and those who love them!

results.description:
RSVPs are now open.  Thank you all for your cooperation in keeping your RSVPs accurate and updated.  (No one appreciates coming out to a meetup expecting X number of attendees only to find Y some didn't show.)

<a></a>Let’s gather for another meetup to discuss whom you do or would support and why.  Here’s a good link to keep up with the latest on who’s running for President: http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2016/us/elections/2016-presidential-candidates.html?_r=1

<a href="http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2016/us/elections/2016-presidential-candidates.html?_r=1"></a>We now have (only) 15 candidates running for the GOP Presidential candidacy in 2016 including: Jeb Bush, Ben Carson, Chris Christie,Ted Cruz, Carly Fiorina, Mike Huckabee, John Kasich, Rand Paul, Marco Rubio, Donald Trump, Jim Gilmore, Lindsay Graham, Bobby Jindal, George Pataki, and Rick Santorum.  Rick Perry and Scott Walker have dropped out of the race.

Carly Fiorina is on "fire" with her excellent debating skills.  Can she keep the momentum going and continue to rise in the polls?  The next GOP debate will air on CNBC from the University of Colorado in Boulder on Wednesday, October 28, 2015.  The link with that information is here: http://www.cnbc.com/2015/07/16/cnbc-to-host-republican-presidential-debate-at-the-university-of-colorado-boulder-on-wednesday-october-28.html

We hope you can join us and look forward to seeing old friends and making new ones!

ABOUT:The New York Conservatives Meetup Group

WHO: We are a group of like-minded individuals who believe in upholding American conservative values fiscally, culturally, and politically. If you are a Conservative, Libertarian, Constitution Party, Neocon, Tea Party supporter or Republican, we welcome to you join our group and attend our meetings.

WHAT: We are a political and social discussions group, not an activist group, although activist members are welcome to join our group.

WHEN: We meet monthly, usually the 3rd Friday of each month, although there are occasional monthly exceptions as posted on this Meetup page.

WHERE: Our meetup is held at a restaurant in the Theater District, near Times Square in Manhattan. We chose this location for the convenience of mass transportation for all our Tri-State members, predominately those who reside in New York City and New Jersey.

WHY: Because we are sorely outnumbered by Liberals and Democrats in our Tri-State area. This meetup is intended for us get together to discuss and find common ground with each other.
results.name: The New York Conservatives Meetup Group Monthly Meetup

results.description:
Gotham Atheists weekly Drinking With Atheists Friday Night Socials!

Join us for a great night of conversation in relaxed company in New York City. We go from 8pm to around 11pm or so.

This week will be hosted by one of our newest members, R'el. This party is BYOB (Bring Your Own Booze). We have some vodka and beer leftover from last time, so you can decide to bring food instead of Booze. We will probably order a few pizzas so if you want something else please bring it yourself. We will use the comments section below to coordinate.

The list is tentatively capped at 15 people due to space limitations but we won't leave anyone hanging! Please remember to change your RSVP status to "No" if you can't make it, so that someone on the WaitList can go. Thanks!

Every Friday Night for 8 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. No agenda but good light conversations. Great chance to meet new people and make new friends.

See you Friday Night.

Lee

[masked]

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
I'll repeat the Google Wallet instructions for those unaccustomed: ***In the notes section of the payment, please leave your name and what event you are paying for! Thanks
-Download the Google Wallet app on your phone. You'll have to have a gmail account to register your username with this service if you don't already have gmail (in that case create a gmail account first... I did the same thing awhile back just to use this service)

- Create a 4 digit PIN to sign into Google Wallet. Then you'll be on the app homepage. -The left button says 'send money'. Click it and you'll have a screen where you can input a name or email address. My email address for this is [masked] .

-Once you input my username you'll see the screen where you type in the dollar amount. Once done, click the gray 'next', then the blue 'review' button in the upper right corner. -This takes to a confirmation screen. If anything looks off just click the left button on the upper lefthand side to go back a page. Otherwise, you confirm it and click send. Done! An icon will appear in your notifications area letting you know it's sent to me.

From now on, every event will not require a payment to rsvp on this page, I will check the rsvps daily to make sure everyone followed up - any issues message me on here and we will figure it out. Please work with me and send the payment when you register for the event... after this first set up it will take ten seconds each week. If you register and don't pay within 24 hours i'll reach out to you and then have to open the spot back up.. work with me here please, that would not be fun

results.description:
https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xtp1/v/t1.0-9/11401142_1720823001478478_3682666258495805787_n.jpg?oh=6d3a52147bbb4787f69b1b492b283ec2&oe=56D0E6E4

Every Friday Night!
Salsa Dancing in Times Square is Back!
LA FAMA (151 W 46th St, 11th Floor) is a Latin Party that specializes in playing and dancing to Salsa Music. The event takes place where the bright lights are. That's right, Times Square. We have a nice floor, great ventilation, fun willing dancers, and your total expense for a Friday Night is 12.00

Mention Salsa New York at the door and it will be $10


You do not know how to Dance Salsa? No problem. We offer a Free Salsa class at 9:30pm every Friday. So come alone or bring your friends,. Either way, you are guaranteed to learn and have a blast.
You know what else is back? The music. LA FAMA is bringing the music back to the forefront. That's Right, DJ Mustachio will be in th building playing foot stomping flavorful Salsa songs to get those hips moving and grooving.
results.name: Salsa Dancing: La Fama Mention Salsa New York for the discount !

results.description:
You've spent all week busting your hump! Now it's time to unwind, loosen up the tie, say inappropriate things, get hammered, and most importantly laugh til it hurts!

Back by popular demand the "Let Me Speak To Your Manager" show is bringing you the best up and coming comics in NYC, all of whom have been featured on Comedy Central, MTV, Letterman, Fallon, Conan, etc..!

It all goes down at Stone Creek Bar and Grill in the back room. Come down, enjoy some of the drinks from the fully stocked bar or some food off the awesome menu!

The show is free and has a 1 item minimum. Come out and get over the hump with some laughs!
results.name: Let Me Speak To Your Manager- Free Comedy Show

results.description:
Because of various issues with the previous Google Hangout, I'm hosting another round of Q&A. So...


Want to learn more about photography? Or have do you have questions? This is your chance to have them answered by me… so hop on and get your questions answered.


IMPORTANT: Space is limited for on camera discussions. However you can also attend via chat. Use AIM or YAHOO chat to submit questions while you watch the HANGOUT. Simply add me at semilion on yahoo and aol.

HOW TO GET ON GOOGLE HANGOUTS:  Knowing how to do this is vital.  There are a billion free How to use Google Hangouts videos, posted by Google.  Check out the below URL's to learn more about Google Hangouts:


https://support.google.com/hangouts/answer/2944865?hl=en


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7K06lHu4gDk


Beginners guide to Google+:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FtryZl8ANvo

The hangout will last until 11:30 pm, however may continue longer if we have a large turnout.
results.name: Google Hangout - Q&A Round 2

results.description:
This event is happening on my BIRTHDAY! Please come dance with me :-) Details below:

Tribal Roots ☆~☽✪☾~☆
"Start At The Roots"
16th October 2016 - New Moon Weekend
Brooklyn, New York

Our tribe starts with YOU. We together are the Roots. The People. The Energy. You are the spirit inside all of it. The music, the art, the activities, they are the bonuses of our tribe's gatherings, but it all stems from YOU. So join us as we, Start at the Roots. As we take a trip into the Roots of our Tribe, we will be joined by Sound Shamans that will awaken the Spirit that lies deep within us. Joining us will be one of our tribes home grown shamans, KABAYUN of Sangoma Records, who will be playing a full power live set that will tease your senses. Along with him, we will have some of our tribes most talented shamans. We will have LUIS CAMPOS and EPSYLON perform a high energy tag set that will leave you screaming "We want more!" IZZY also of Sangoma Records will deliver his groovy style to us all and BETWEEN DEVICES will start the night just right with his bouncy beats. Our space will be transformed by WIZART VISIONS, who will create a psychedelic paradise that will result in deep mystical experiences. Justine will be providing massages, enjoy some hookah at the Magic Hookah Lounge and connect with other members of the tribe. KIRKWORX will be UV body painting and Olga Klimova will be live painting. Come prepared not just for a party, but for an EXPERIENCE.

♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥

♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥

☆~☽✪☾~☆ THE INTENTION ☆~☽✪☾~☆

Our intention is to establish strong roots within the tribe. Our tribe starts with you the people, the energy. We create the magic together. What makes this special is the community effort that makes it happen. We all take part in making the magic of the night. Each one us unknowingly takes part in the creation of this tribal gathering. YOU being the roots of the tribe, what's important is that you bring your smile, laughter, energy and spirit. This tribal aspect of the community coming together and taking part in the night, creates connection between new and old friends, builds trust in the community, teaches us how to work together and proves to us that we can create anything together. This tribal aspect will introduce an alternative to mass society, it will introduce a modern tribal way of life.

♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥

LOCATION: The Paper Box
17 Meadow Street
Brooklyn, New York DATE: October 16th, 2015

TIME: 10pm - 5am

AGE: 21+

PRESALE TICKETS - $30
https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=9XJLMAWH8PXQA

TICKETS AT THE DANCE TEMPLE - $35

♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥

☆~☽✪☾~☆ WHERE DOES YOUR MONEY GO? ☆~☽✪☾~☆

A well informed tribe allows us to build trust from within. We want everyone who supports the gatherings to know where their money goes when attending. All proceeds get split 3 ways. 33.3% of proceeds go to a fundraiser to better the world that will be announced before every event. 33.3% will go to building our tribes next event. The final 33.3% will go to building next summers outdoor festival. We together are creating an experience that will grow our spirit, helping to bring the worlds best musicians, psychedelic artists and deco crews. This event we will be donating to GreenPeace USA. The Arctic is one of the most unique places on Earth. It spans eight countries, is home to more than 13 million people and provides a habitat for some of the most incredible wildlife on Earth. And now, it’s the battleground for what could be the most important fight in environmental history. This is about CLIMATE CHANGE. This is about WILDLIFE. This is about PEOPLE. This is about OUR FUTURE. We will be donating a third of our proceeds to this cause. http://www.greenpeace.org/usa/ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥

Be sure to check out our gathering next summer Gaia Festival 2016 "A Gathering of the Tribes" August 26-28th 2016 - New Moon Weekend - Upstate New York
https://www.facebook.com/events/1533901950200836

Given there are no reservations I take RSVPs for drinks far less seriously so don't worry if your plans change.

Anime & Karaoke. Get your singing on! Free shots for singing! Sing 3 Karaoke songs and get a free shot (Tequila, Rum, Vodka & Whisky). Shots for singing.

This event is free, but its courtesy to purchase food or drinks at the restaurant.

OPTIONAL: $30 open bar for 3 hours (per person) includes:

Unlimited 16oz:  Black Island ice tea, Chocolate mint, Sex on the beach, Watermelon paradise, Action Peach fuzz, Peach ale Martini, Orange Waves, Coconut splash, Raspberry ale, Rum & Coke, Vodka & orange juice, Cranberry & Vodka. Selter & Vodka, Selter & Gin, Ginger Ale & Vodka, Ginger Ale & Tequila, Coke & Whiskey, diet Pepsi & Tequila, pineapple juice & Vodka, pineapple & Rum. 

Unlimited shots (Rum, Tequila, Vodka, Scotch).


Bring 5 people and get each open bar for $25 per person.

results.description:
***This is the same location- just out the back doors under the lights! Beautiful turf field provides for some beautiful soccer.  Full field - back up to 22 players!!

Join Friday nights intermediate/advanced players for some seriously fun, face-paced soccer under the lights at Hofstra University.   These games will be played on beautiful turf fields and are indoor/outdoor, depending on the season.  

Summer= Outside

Fall/Winter= Indoor

These games start promptly at 10:30 pm, please be on time or your spot may be given away to the walk-ons that do show up. 

The fee for this game is $15.00 which covers the cost of the field which you must pay even if you no show.  The field is expensive and the Club goes out of pocket for you if you do not show up! 

RSVP Rules apply!  Update cut off is 4:00 pm Friday.
results.how_to_find_us: Bubble Directions: Hofstra soccer bubble! Use Hofstra Blvd from Hempstead Tpke....from security booth, turn right after 2nd stop sign towards the athletic fields.  Drive all the way down until u c d dome on your right!!
results.name: Friday Night OUTDOOR Game (@ Hofstra)

results.description:
Friends,

Join us this coming week for our Friday night party @ Slate NYC. Our members always have a fun time there.

We will meet at the top section of the venue from 10:15pm.

Get to meet many members from the group, as well as members from my other groups.

We will be situated at the right side of the top bar.

Admission is free for this event. Just mention Rory's List to the door person.

There will be mingling , drinking , dancing, and more that evening.

You are always welcome to invite your family, friends classmates and colleagues.

This is a multi Meetup group event.

Dress code is business casual.

We look forward in having a fun weekend with you!

Contact us if you have further questions.

Cheers,

Meetup Organizer,

Rory

DESI FRIDAYS
"New York's Only Weekly Friday Night DesiParty"

:: L E X I C O N ::
226 East 54th St. NYC

Music By New York's Finest:
DJ HARSH - DJ AMIT

Percussive Dhol Beats By :
RAVI BINDRA

Doors Open at 10PM

COMPLIMENTARY ADMISSION TILL 11:30PM 
&
SPONSORED VODKA OPEN BAR 10-11PM

Desi Fridays is one high society DesiParty. Wow factor everywhere. Beautiful people, beautiful venue, beautiful ambiance, and did we mention beautiful people? High energy, amazing music and a packed house are just some of the traits of what you would expect at this weekly desiparty.

This event is the talk of the town amongst young socialites. It's so exclusive it only takes place on Friday Nights, and don't even try to dress down, because it is almost impossible to get in, but more importantly you would feel so out of place. So don your best, and you may just be lucky enough to party out on Friday Nights at Lexicon!!

Dress Code: Trendy & Chic

Absolutely No T-shirts or No sneakers.

21+ | ID Required

For Table Reservations : 908 - 425 - 1603

Everyone Must RSVP @ DesiFridays.Com

Nearest Subway To Lexicon:
53rd St - Lex Ave (E,M,6)
59th St - Lex Ave (N,Q,R,4,5)

results.description:
The NYS Sheep & Wool Festival, located in the village of Rhinebeck, NY is one of the largest and best wool festivals on the East coast.  There are over 300 fiber artists and crafts galore, amazing sheep herding demonstrations and sheepdog trials (plus a petting zoo), all the fiber and wool you can dream of and of course, great fair food. If you want to sign up for workshops or classes, please check out the festival website.

Here are the trip details:

Date: Saturday, October 17th

Cost: $60 per person (includes admission to the festival, giveaways, and raffle prizes).  Bus is air conditioned and has a restroom.

In order to keep the same pricing as last year, your payment is needed by September 1st to secure your seat on the bus.  Payment is required to RSVP and no reservations without payment will be accepted.

NOTE: RSVPs after September 1st will not include the admission ticket.  You'll have to purchase the admission ticket individually at the festival gate ($12) or online ($9 plus a fee).

Meetup Locations: 


Brooklyn - 7th Avenue Donut Shop (7th Ave & 9th St) at 6am.


Manhattan - TBD (If you are interested in a Manhattan pickup, please let me know.  There may be an extra fee to cover the additional charge by the bus company).


Arrive at Rhinebeck by  9 AM.

Meet for departure from the festival at 4:30 PM.  Miss the bus and you'll have to take the train home.


After you RSVP, please remember to fill out the Google Form.   This will make organization for the day go much smoother.   

If you have any questions, please email me through meetup or [masked]   

Thank you and I look forward to seeing everyone for an amazing, fun, and wool filled day :)

Best,

Julie
results.name: Rhinebeck or Bust 2015!

results.description:
Making skydivers since 1984, Freefall Adventures has introduced more than 250,000 people to world of recreational skydiving. Skydive Cross Keys/Freefall Adventures Skydiving School is the best equipped skydiving school in the Northeast, with an experienced skydiving staff second to none.

Have you ever want to try skydiving, and none of your friends want to go with you. Here is your chance to go with a group of awesome young singles, meet new friends and have the experience of the life time; best of all, early birds will save $40.

Three reasons why you should skydive with Freefall Adventures.

* Established facility with nearly 30 years of experience (avoid new skydive schools)
* Large airplane that accommodates 22 skydivers so less waiting time (not 4 at some other places).
* Separate cameraman so DVD is not distorted (not like 2-in-1 instructor & cameraman at other new schools)

For more Why Choose Freefall Adventures?

There are certain things you said you’d never do: wear white after Labor Day, enter a jalapeno eating contest and sing karaoke in public. And while you steer clear of certain risky endeavors, you still like to live on the edge. Get ready to bring out your inner daredevil because we’re about to give you a little push.

Located just 2 hours drive from New York City, each tandem skydive includes a training session on the ground (up to one hour) to give you the skills needed to participate in your dive. When it’s time to jump, you’ll be attached to a certified skydiving instructor in a full body harness so you’re kept safe and sound. From the 60 seconds of free fall to your ten minutes under the parachute, your instructor will be there to back you up. It’s the perfect way to feel the rush of skydiving while having the freedom to enjoy the experience and the amazing views of the surrounding area.

With more than 20 years of experience, Cross Keys is your key to a thrilling and safe dive. Plus, they offer proof for all those Doubting Thomas’ with an optional HD Video package add-on that includes a professionally edited DVD of the entire experience. After your 60 seconds of freefall, those other risky things won’t seem half as bad.

Departure Date: October 17th Saturday. Please arrive 15 minutes earlier.

Depart 6:30 AM: (Sheraton LaGuardia East Hotel)[masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 (Map)

Depart 7:00 AM: Northwest corner of West 43rd St. & 9th Ave, New York, NY 10036 (Map)

Return: Expect to depart from Skydiving place after lunch at 2:30 PM and expect to be back in NYC around 5:00 PM & Flushing at 5:30 PM

Cost: Early Birds $209 ($79 Deposit; bring remaining $130 cash) for first 8 spots or 21 days in advance (Retail Value $259 = $219 + $40 Transport); Afterward Regular $229 ($99 Deposit; also bring remaining $130 cash). DVD & Still Photos for additional $105 ($25 off regular $130).

Buy Ticket Here: http://oct2015skydive.eventbrite.com/ You can also Chase Quickpay me at [masked] to avoid transaction fee. (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) If Quickpaying, please indicate boarding location. Your spot is NOT confirmed until your payment is received.

Includes: Round trip Benz Sprinter transportation from NYC, one tandem skydive, & skydiving equipment rental

Maximum: 15

Refund Policy:
* Full refund minus $30 processing fee if cancelled 14 days in advance;
* 50% refund if cancelled 7 days in advance;
* Afterward, no refund for cancellation or no show.

Requirement: Must be at least 18 years old and weigh fewer than 250 pounds! (Must bring a government issued ID)

Pictures from Previous Events:
2011: http://www.meetup.com/NYCAYS/photos/4021162/
2012: http://www.meetup.com/NYCAYS/photos/10647382/
2013: http://www.meetup.com/NYCAYS/photos/16708122/
2014: http://www.meetup.com/NYCAYS/photos/24997512/

Videos:

Tandem Skydiving Cross Keys Freefall Adventure NJ

http://youtu.be/pI6npu6llxg

http://youtu.be/pI6npu6llxg

My First Skydive at a Small school (Small plane & no separate camera man) That's why Skydive Cross Key is the best school I have been to.

http://youtu.be/UErY8MQtF1Y

http://youtu.be/UErY8MQtF1Y

For more info, check out the official site


</a> Check out <a href="http://www.yelp.com/biz/freefall-adventures-williamstown">the Excellent Review Ratings on Yelp

By RSVP'ing "Yes", you and your guest(s) are accepting the terms to the Waiver & Release of Liability set forth by NYC Active Young Singles.

all is in the air, and you know what that means. Yarn by the tent-load!


I will be your copilot for this adventure. We have a few options, and I'm happy to take the temperature of the group. Please note preferences in the comments, including whether you'd prefer to do Saturday or Sunday. 

Options: 

* Metro North to Poughkeepsie + shuttle bus. Travel time: Approximately 3.5 hours. Cost: About $30-$35 depending on the shuttle bus. In the past we have met early, around 7 a.m., at Grand Central to catch the train together. I can steer on Saturday. 

* Drive. Approximate time: 2.5 hours Approximate cost: $20 pp + bribes for driver (front seat to whoever brings the best snacks). I can fit at least 3 people in my car. We have ample hatch space + a rooftop box. Want to buy a spinning wheel? No problem! Caveat: Car may be problematic for those allergic to dogs or small children (the 3-year-old might have to tag along, but she's a pretty good sport).  Note: Payment reserves a car seat if you ride with me. No refunds, but feel free to find someone else to take your spot.

Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Waiting List:

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
NJ Lighthouse Challenge is an annual event where all the lighthouses are open, and there are treats and such as you go along. Will we get to them all? Sign-up and weather will determine the exact plan - will we leave Friday or Saturday night and stay over? Do half Saturday and half Sunday? Return home in between? Stay in a motel? To be decided... If you think you are interested, please sign up and let me know your preference.

Update as of Oct. 13:

It's finally here! The NJ Lighthouse challenge!
At the first stop, you buy a $2 entry sheet to participate in the challenge. Each lighthouse and life-saving station in NJ has a souvenir to give out and will validate the entry sheet - at the end, completed entry sheets are eligible for a drawing. Here's the website for more info: http://lhchallengenj.org/

Here's the plan:

Saturday, Oct. 17, 8am - 6pm:

Leave the church at 8am (other cars may leave from other locations and meet us) and head to the first lighthouse along the Delaware River. We will make our stops as short as possible (20 min?) in an attempt to reach as many lighthouses as possible. I think just the driving added up to more than 8 hours, so I don't expect to reach all of them the first day. We will reach as many as possible by 4PM and then head home, most likely by 6pm. Bring food, or expect to eat take-out in the car while riding.

Sunday, Oct. 18, 10am - 4pm???:

Pick up where we left off, or start at Sandy Hook and work our way down to finish all of the route - departure time and route direction will be determined by the end of Day 1, based on how many lighthouses are left to see and whether there's someplace we want to spend a little more time. I expect 10am-4pm (so those who wish to, may attend 8am church), but that may change, so check the night before.

Follow us one day, both days, or do it on your own! You might even choose to spend the night wherever we end up after the first day.

***Limited space is available for non-drivers, so do let me know right away if you want me to try to find a carpool for you.***

RSVP for one or both days by Thursday, Oct. 15

results.description:
The fall weather is calling for a nice day hike. The Mt. Tammany is one of my favorite hiking destinations in New Jersey.


The hike will be approximately 10 miles long, depending on the actual route we pick. There are some steeper climbs on the trails - expect 1,500-2,000 ft elevation gain along the trail. This is a really nice, though strenuous hike, which can be done even by physically fit beginners.


The number of participants is limited only by the number of cars we have to carpool. Please sign up on the waiting list and once we have a car spot for you I'll move you to the "yes" column.

We'll be leaving NYC at around 8 a.m. on Saturday. Cars meet at Dunnfield Creek parking lot, 70 miles west of NYC on I-80. The parking lot is just before the last exit on I-80 in NJ. The time to meet at the parking lot is around 9:15 a.m.


The cost will be moderate - gas & toll money to the drivers ($15-$20 per person) and dinner after the hike. Please bring enough cash with you to pay both the gas money and the dinner!

Regarding gear, be aware that it may be a cold, sunny day, but we can also get some rain. Bring at minimum 2 liters of water. Also bring a lunch snack, sunblock, sunglasses, layers of clothes and rain gear. The trail can be hiked in any good shoes, though boots are preferred.

I will bring a map, a compass, and a first aid kit. Post a comment or e-mail me if you have any questions.

Chaiyut

results.description:
This meetup is Full, if you're interested in going for the same trip on Sunday, send me a meetup message. 


This Saturday we are going to the North-South Lake Campground in Catskills. It is time to hike and run on some real mountains!


I can pick you up in NYC and we'll carpool all together in our RawMobile. As you can see, the number of spots is very limited, so first come first serve. The details about pick up and drop off are below. To reserve a spot just RSVP to this meetup.


Our recent day trips to the Catskills were awesome, so we're doing it again. Some folks were running, some were hiking, but all had fun and made new friends. Check out our photos and comments from the past trips.


There are lots of ways to enjoy a day at North-South Lake Campground, but the main point of interest to us is probably the famous Escarpment Trail. If you have never heard of this trail, take a look here: http://escarpmenttrail.com/ This is one of the most beautiful places for hiking and trail running in New York state.

Here is a video from the 2013 Escarpment  Trail race:

https://vimeo.com/71310538

Please note that we are not traversing the entire trail (if you really want to do all 19 miles, let me know and we'll figure out how to set it up). Also, if you're interested on doing this trip on Sunday, let me know. 

I  will get you there and back and will take care of the day pass to the campground, and also we'll have lots of fruit and bottled water for everyone. We'll also have few picnic/beach  blankets. 

We will start hiking/running at North-South lake campground. I suggest doing about 5 miles of the trail (to the crashed airplane, or maybe a bit further), and then turning around. I will be staying at the back of the group, and faster hikers/runners can go ahead of us if they want to.


The beauty of this plan is that it's impossible to get lost. The trail is VERY EASY TO FOLLOW (it is well-marked with blue markers) so you can go at your own pace and turn around when you feel like it. Just be sure to get back on time before we leave (5pm sharp).


You are welcome to hike with anyone else in the group, but all abilities are welcome and everyone can enjoy this trail at their own pace.  The trail is rugged and at times very steep. Please prepare accordingly. There is no any water on the trail, so be sure to have enough with you. On weekends there are lots of people hiking there, so we certainly won't be alone there.

Other activities that you might choose to enjoy during our trip to the campground:


- hiking around the lake,


- visiting scenic spot of Mountain House,


- renting a boat (availability might be limited),


- suntanning and enjoying the beach.

More information about the campground is here: http://www.dec.ny.gov/outdoor/24487.html


Map of the campground is here: http://www.dec.ny.gov/docs/permits_ej_operations_pdf/northsouthlake2015.pdf

There are nice showers and bathrooms right by the beach (which is also our parking area and starting/finishing point of the hike/run). There are also picnic areas with tables and benches all around the beach.



What to bring (optional):

Towel, clean clothes, flip-flops, gels, your favorite snack, map, insects repellent, rain jacket.


You will be able to leave your extra stuff in the car if needed.


Pick up/Drop off:

The main point of the pick up is bus station by GW Bridge (at 8 am sharp!). To get there you can take A train (to 175th street). 


The drive takes just over 2 hours, we'll leave NYC at 8am, get to the lake shortly after 10am, run, eat, enjoy the beach, and head out back to the city by 5pm. We'll be back in NYC shortly after 7pm.

If you don't need a ride, then just come over to the campground and meet us there, no need to RSVP here.


Bad weather cancels the trip! Please check this meetup for the updates a day before.

Cell reception: T-mobile doesn't work there. AT&T mostly does work. Not sure about the others.


Time to go to the mountains!

Legal Disclaimer

results.description:
Join the FreeWalkers for an historic walk of 13 or 20 miles(allow 2 extra hours) - or create your own mileage challenge along the way - as we follow an historic battle and military retreat into the Watchung mountains.

We walk  about 13 miles  starting in Metuchen following the route of Lord Sterling and his American revolutionary war soldiers who engaged Cornwallis' troops in Metuchen on June 26, 1777. A running battle ensued in what is now Edison and Scotch Plains before retreating to the safety of the Watchung Mountains. The battle is commonly referred to as the Battle of Short Hills although it has nothing to do with the area now known as Short Hills-which had its own share of memorable battles.

The Freewalkers, in cooperation with Union County Parks, are sponsoring this Battle of the Short Hills walk. The hike, is part of the County’s Four Centuries In A Weekend celebration, ends at the Deserted Village in the Watchung Reservation, where there will be a host of activities and historic tours that Saturday, and Sunday with most historic sites along the way open and staffed with local.

For those who would like to walk fewer miles they can join the group along the way and leave whenever they want. Once at the Deserted Village, there is an option of riding vans supplied by Mountainside, Westfield, and the County, to the Westfield train station to make their way home. And for those who want to walk longer, there is another 7-mile route through the Reservation and along the cross-county and the East Coast Greenway to the Cranford train station.

Join this unique walking adventure and relive the times when our nation was created and important battles were fought for our independence. Bring the family and your friends too. The event is FREE and open to everyone!

FreeWalkers Event Info - Learn More (http://bit.ly/battlewalk) - in development

Union County - Learn More (http://ucnj.org/hike4C)

Register to walk to save time at start of event: (https://battleofshorthills-2015.eventbrite.com)

</a>

<a href="http://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-battle-of-short-hills-walk-registration-13487983923?ref=ebtnebregn">https://www.eventbrite.com/custombutton?eid=18565290283
results.name: The Battle of Short Hills Walk 2015

results.description:
>>> PURCHASE TICKETS HERE <<<

****Please don't be misled by the number of "yesses" at the right. Our 45 seat chartered bus is over 2/3 full.****

PLEASE BYPASS the RSVP button at right and register directly above. If you are a dues-paying Member of Out Professionals, this assures you no-cost or low-cost admission to this event. (Nonmembers are always welcome, but nonmember rates apply if you are just part of our Meetup group.) For a full year of Member savings and other career benefits, join Out Professionals here. 

JOIN OUT PROFESSIONALS’ HUDSON VALLEY FOLIAGE TOUR TO STORM KING — THE KING OF SCULPTURE PARKS!

On Saturday, October 17, you are invited to join Members and friends of Out Professionals aboard a Hampton Jitney for a full-day exploration of Storm King Art Center, Hudson Valley’s famed museum and sculpture park.

Storm King occupies a dramatic, 500-acre landscape of farm fields, formal allées, natural woodlands, lawns, native grasses, wetlands, ponds and streams. See it all now, bathed in autumn colors. You may glimpse deer, groundhogs, red fox, coyote, wild turkey, red-tail hawks, Canada geese, and turtles in the ponds.

Half an hour after arrival, you enjoy a private guided tour. Bikes are available for rental. Traversing the park are a pair of hop-on/hop-off trams for visitors with limited mobility, who may be given priority.

You are welcome to picnic in one of the park’s designated areas. Or choose from locally sourced offerings at the hilltop Storm King Cafe. We depart for Midtown at 4:30 p.m.

Today’s artistic highlights:

“Lynda Benglis: Water Sources,” sculptures sited outdoors and in Storm King’s museum building
“Outlooks: Luke Stettner,” new indoor work complements a large-scale, site-specific outdoor installation.
“Waiting for UFO,” by Nam June Paik, a Korean-American artist many consider the founder of video art.
The permanent Storm King collection, anchored by 14 works by David Smith, with masterworks by Alexander Calder, Maya Lin, Henry Moore, Louise Nevelson, Isamu Noguchi and Richard Serra. 


Shown: Mother Peace by Mark diSuvero[masked]


WHERE

Rain or shine, board our chartered Hampton Jitney in front of Bryant Park Sixth Avenue, between 40th and 41st Streets). Arrive no later than 8:15 a.m.; we depart on the dot of 8:30 a.m. Boarding by advance purchase only; sorry, no walk-ons. Best to book now.

WHAT’S UP

Roundtrip from Midtown, a private, full-day autumn excursion to Storm King Art Center, a 500-acre park showcasing more than 100 sculptures created by some of the most acclaimed artists of the last 70 years.

ADMISSION

Nonmember, $65, roundtrip transport, Storm King admission and guided tour included. Dues-paying OP Member, $55.

IT PAYS TO BE AN OP MEMBER!

A 12-month individual Out Professionals Membership (new or renewal) PLUS free admission for one to this full-day Storm King foliage tour is yours for just $100. And remember, that buys you a year’s worth of low-cost or no-cost networking and socializing. Order here.
results.name: Let's Meetup and Visit Storm King Art Center!

results.description:
The trailhead is located right after exit 2 at the entrance for Palisades Interstate Park. If you passed exit 3 on the left, you've gone too far.

The yoga part of this hike will include a full 1 hour class. I'm a yoga teacher working in several locations including the Kean university, where I currently attend. Donations of $5 recommended but not required. Feel free to bring a mat and leave it in your car. We will do most of our yoga session at the end of the hike on the big lawn near the parking lot.

Come join us for a fun yoga hike with some scrambling exploration. We will do yoga by the waterfall and then again by the lookout near the parking lot. It should be a super fun hike.

This hike explores the northern end of the New Jersey Section of the Palisades Interstate Park. It is, perhaps, the most rewarding loop hike in the park, as it incorporates a number of scenic features and, for nearly the entire distance, you are far away from the noise of the Parkway. But it is also the most difficult hike in the park, as it involves not only steep climbs and descents on uneven rock steps, but also nearly a mile of walking near the shore of the river on jumbled rocks. Wear appropriate footwear and bring enough water for yourself.

Approximately 3 to 4 miles.                                Duration: approximately 4 hours..

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

Looking to immerse yourself in architecture, design, and New York City history? Want to share your love for New York City with others? Open House New York invites you to join their team of more than 1,000 volunteers who help make OHNY Weekend one of New York's most exciting events. Go behind the scenes of the city's most important buildings and see New York like you've never seen it!


Each year, OHNY Weekend opens up hundreds of buildings and sites throughout the five boroughs for two days of tours and talks with architects, urban designers, historians, city officials, and others. One of the country's largest architecture and design festivals, OHNY Weekend is a celebration of New York's built environment and an unparalleled opportunity to experience the city.

As an OHNY Weekend volunteer, you will assist at one of the several hundred participating sites and tours to welcome visitors from across New York and around the world; assist with check-in and manage lines; and help make this the best OHNY Weekend ever! Volunteer for one shift (average length of four hours) and receive a Volunteer Passport - which gives you and a friend front-of-the-line access to all sites that do not require advance reservations during OHNY Weekend - as well as a limited-edition 2015 OHNY Weekend t-shirt. https://ohny.formstack.com/forms/2015_ohnywknd_volunteer

Sign up today! For more information visit <a>www.ohny.org </a>or email [masked]

results.description:
Muscoot Farm is an early 20th-century interpretative farm museum near Somers, N.Y. in northern Westchester County. It's a working farm.The farm is owned and operated by the Westchester County Department of Parks, Recreation and Conservation. There are six miles of wooded trails featuring lots of ups and downs and nice scenery. Our pace will be moderate, not exceeding 2 mph while going uphill. This is a perfect hike for beginners, old timers or anyone interested in escaping the city for a day or just discovering a new hiking place close to home. Our hike will include a self-guided tour of the farm. 

You may purchase refreshments but bring lunch and at least one quart of water. Restrooms are on the premises. Inclement weather will cause the hike to be postponed.

Leader: Steve Galla  Text me at[masked] or leave a message on the Meetup page.

Driving Directions: Locate Katonah, NY off I-684. Meet at the Katonah MetroNorth train station in Katonah at 9:45 a.m. At about 10 a.m. we'll greet the arriving train and shuttle together to Muscoot Farm about 5 minutes away.

Public transportation signups as of 10/12/2015 are closed:  We can accommodate those signed up as of 10/12/2015 but no additional  signups will be accepted. Driving Members are welcome to show up at the Meetup site in Katonah. No need to sign in here as this list will be closed.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
We're going start winding down this hiking season by doing one of the most spectacular hikes in the Northeast and one of my personal favorites -- the Labyrinth and Lemon Squeeze in the Shawgunk Mountains. The hike is going to be made extra special because of the time of the year we're doing this, in the middle of fall foliage season, when the dazzling hues of the red, yellow, and brown leaves on the trees around us almost make us forget how exciting this trek is.


We'll start our hike off in the Mohonk Preserve where we're going to stroll the gentle Undercliff trail, a magnificent spectacle with amazing rock formations to our left and sweeping views of the Hudson Valley to our right. If I ended the hike here, you'd head home feeling satisfied, but this is only the appetizer for the visual and physical feast to come. We will continue on to hike the rock formations known as the Labyrinth and Lemon Squeeze. What the heck are they? They are insane views, a crazy knuckle and knee scraping rock labyrinth, and a claustrophobia-defying climb up a deep crevice capped off by 360 degree views from a sky top tower. Yeah, I know, sounds awesome. And it doesn't end there, I'm going to throw in a couple of more amazing rock scrambles -- four for the price of two, the best deal in town.


A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your organizer is in the running for hardest working person on meetup. While everyone else is running in the other direction, I'll be the first one to jump in front of that bear when he tries to eat you.

The Important Stuff ...

• This is going to be an ADVANCED loop hike of about 11 miles round trip. You don't need to be a world-class athlete to participate, but you need to be in decent physical shape as this is one of the more challenging treks in area with a bit of elevation gain and a few rock scrambles. We will be out all day so leave your afternoon/evening open.


• This is a social hike, the pace will be moderate -- we'll be stopping to take in the views and smell the flowers. If you yearn to channel your inner Mountain Goat and feel the need to race everyone to the top of the mountain, this is not the hiking trip for you.

• Dress in layers of non-cotton clothing, wear hiking boots or trail shoes (I wouldn't recommend sneakers but that is at your discretion), a hat, bring 2-3 liters of fluid, a packed lunch and/or snacks, and sunscreen.

• There is a preserve day use fee of $12.00 per person, cash only.

• Rain cancels the hike.

• No guests allowed, sorry.

• RSVP only if you seriously plan to attend as space is limited.

How To Get There ...

Take the New Paltz exit 18 off of the NYS Thruway. Go 7 miles west (through New Paltz) on Route 299 to the end: make right on Route 44-55 and then 1/2 mile to the Visitor Center on right.

Please post if you are driving and can pick up passengers (how many and from where), If you need a ride, please be proactive and contact a driver directly. Passengers, as a courtesy you should chip in for gas, tolls, and coffee for the driver.

results.description:
As many of you know, philanthropy is one of the cornerstones of beer club, so for the second time this year, we are putting together a team for NY Cares Day! If you’ve ever participated in this event in the past, you know it’s a very fun, fulfilling and tiring day of volunteering around NYC.  Check out our pictures from the Spring NY Cares Day in April and you'll see what a fun time we had.

For the Fall, the volunteering takes place in a school.

My target is to get a team of at least 15 people together so we can have the majority of a work site.


Registration is required through the NY Cares Day website. Right now, I’ve asked for a volunteer site in either Manhattan or Brooklyn but we’ll have to wait and see how many volunteers we get to help determine the location. We will have the location confirmed by early October.

Volunteering is a fun way to get together and support our wonderful city, so I hope to see a lot of you out there!

Special Notes:

• You must register on the NY Cares website to participate! You won’t be eligible to volunteer just by signing up here

• There is a non-refundable $25 registration fee that you pay when you register

•Early October is the last day to join the team! (exact date TBD)

• Bring a snack to tide you over until the end of the day!

Instructions for registering:

-To register, go to the main NY Cares Day website

http://www.kintera.org/faf/home/default.asp?ievent=1143262&lis=1&kntae1143262=DCF128DC10954D7D98D706D72DEE986D&login=t


-Click on the “join a team” button in the middle of the page.

-Then select "NYC Gay Craft Beer Lovers" from the drop down list


-Then you’ll be asked to create a user name and password, and you’ll be taken to the screen where you’ll have to pay the $25 registration fee.  If you registered for the spring NY Cares Day, you can use the same login information.

This is also a fund raising event to help provide support for NY Cares tutoring program, so once you join, feel free to hit up friends and family for donations!

Registration just opened and I will provide more information as it becomes available.   The earlier you sign up, the better I'll be able to determine the number of volunteers we will have and that will help us get a great location.

Remember, you must sign up on the NY Cares site in order to be eligible to participate.  

Hope to see you there!
results.name: Let's meetup and volunteer for NY Cares Day!
