results.description:
RSVP'S ARE CLOSED ON MEETUP.COM. IF YOU WISH TO ATTEND PLEASE GO DIRECTLY TO WWW.NEWYORKSOCIALNETWORK.COM


Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked]. You also must click on the event link in this description to be registered.


This is an awesome fall adventure!  The weekend will include:

-Pumpkin Picking

-Visit a local winery

-Ticket to The Headless Horseman Hayride America's #1 Haunted Hayride

-Camping at a private riverside campsite complete with tent and all equipment (except sleeping bag).

-Delicious breakfast at campsite

-Awesome fall foliage hike with moderate rock scramble

-Visit the Walkway Over The Hudson Park

Here is how it works:

-The group will take the 12:43pm Metro North Train from Grand Central to Poughkeepsie where your guide will pick you up. You may also drive to train station.

-From the train station we will head to a local pumpkin farm to pick up jack-o-lanterns, apples and more.

-We will visit a local winery

-We will go to a local restaurant for a bite and then to the hayride at 7pm. (dinner not included)

-When we are finished with the hayride we will enjoy a great bonfire at our private riverside campsite.

-Sunday morning we will cook breakfast at camp then go to the hike, rock scramble, winery and walkway over the Hudson.

-You will be back on the 5:54 train

What is included :  $175

transportation from train station to all attractions for the weekend, admission to Headless Horseman Hayride, tent and all camping equipment, breakfast Saturday, hiking and park fees all taxes and tips.

What is not included: train fare, dinner Saturday, lunch Sunday.

$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$

You MUST click on this link to be registered: Fall Camping Overnight link

$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$


Can I come alone?  Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.

What to expect:  We will have 15 people coming on Saturday and 15 on Sunday as part of 2 separate day trips.  There will be 5-6 people staying at the campsite overnight

What if it rains?  We go rain or shine unless unsafe conditions.  There is shelter at the campsite.

If you have question contact dave at [masked]

If there does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?

  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and

www.newyorksocialnetwork.com

.  There will be other people attending.  If you want to know exact numbers or have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

results.description:
George Washington, Alexander Hamilton, Nathan Hale: They all played their part in the history of the Revolution in New York City.

Along our walk from City Hall Park down to the tip of the island, so crowded today with modern skyscrapers, we'll rediscover the Revolutionary War past of lower Manhattan: the Patriots who set out for the disastrous Battle of Brooklyn; the Loyalists who stood steadfast by their King; the spies who took on desperate missions; the thousands of prisoners of war who languished in appalling conditions; the catastrophic fire, whether arson or not, that almost consumed the whole of New York City. See where princes prayed and generals wept in this, the most important British-occupied city of the American War for Independence.

PLEASE READ THE DIRECTIONS CAREFULLY ABOUT WHERE TO MEET

Where to meet:  On the steps of the Tweed Courthouse, at 52 Chambers Street, between Broadway and Centre Street. Take the 4,5 train to "Brooklyn Bridge", or the R to "City Hall".

When to meet: 12:45pm for a 1pm start. I will be holding a sign that says "Revolution in New York".

Fee: $20 cash, $15 for seniors 65 + with proof of age; exact change appreciated! Please bring bills, not coins. Sorry, please do not bring dogs or minor children age 17 or below on the tours.

The tour will be approximately 2/2.5 hours long. While Friendly Native tours walk rain or shine 99.9% of the time, on rare occasions they will be postponed in cases of what can be deemed dangerous weather, and an email sent out to that effect to all who have registered for the event.  For sunny days, be sure to bring a hat and a bottle of water. Check the weather reports on the day of the tour; if there is a chance of rain, please bring your own umbrella!

The nearest restrooms to this location are inside St. Paul's Chapel, all the way in the back towards the graveyard on Church Street. There's also a Starbuck's at the base of the Woolworth Building. Please be sure to "take care of things" before the start of the tour!
results.how_to_find_us: I'll be holding a sign reading REVOLUTION IN NEW YORK
results.name: The Revolutionary War in New York!

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Meet to share and discuss SF and fantasy writing, books, films, TV shows, the writing process, the publishing industry, etc. with other SF and fantasy writers (both published and unpublished).  We usually have a long and lively discussion, followed by critiques of stories or chapters (if any) that members brought along.  We don't always have stories to critique, but we usually enjoy having hours worth of discussion, so let us know near the beginning of the Meetup if you brought something to have critiqued so we don't use up all our time talking -- time flies when you're having fun!

Further details or topics for this Meetup may be announced later.

As usual, you can bring a chapter or short story for the group to critique, but it's by no means necessary.  If you do bring your MS, try to bring enough paper copies for everyone attending to have one, and if you want us to write comments or corrections on it, then please double-space it.  We usually ask the author to read it aloud (unless you're shy), which is very helpful, because you'd be surprised how often you don't catch your own mistakes until you read your manuscript aloud for the first time! 

For the manuscript (MS) critiques, length is not set in stone, but suggested length is 1500 words, maximum length 3000 words. In pages (Times 12 point font), 1500 words is just under five pages double spaced, or about three pages single-spaced (but you should always double-space to allow room for people to write comments or corrections!)  Don't worry if your MS is longer than 1500 words, you can still bring it, but please keep it under 3,000 words.

For more guidelines on critiques, see http://www.meetup.com/The-Woodbridge-Science-Fiction-Fantasy-Writers-Meetup/about/
results.name: Share and discuss writing with other SF and fantasy writers

results.description:
Guy D'Angelo, an organic farmer with 20 years experience growing on a 1/4 acre garden in Center Moriches Long Island, will be discussing fall crops and cover cropping. Find out what plants you can grow in the fall in this zone and how to prepare your planting beds. Also learn about the advantages of putting a crop on your planting beds that will protect and enhance the soil over the winter. We will provide a demonstration of how to start your crop, how to cultivate and harvest it. Learn how you can extend the growing season even further with hoop houses over your growing beds. 


Imani Garden is located in the Crown Heights section of Brooklyn. It has 13 raised beds, a 350 gallon water storage tank and a year around polycarbonate greenhouse. 


To get there by mass transit, take the A/C or 3/4 trains to Utica Avenue. Walk Utica to Pacific Street and then walk west to Schenectady Avenue. Imani is located at the corner of Schenectady and Pacific Street.

For more information on Imani Garden, go to <a>www.green-phoenix.org.</a>
results.name: Learn about fall crops and cover crops at Imani Garden

results.description:
The Animals’ Battalion, dedicated to advocating for justice for all animals, will be participating in National Feral Cat Day.

National feral Cat Day was founded by Alley Cat Allies in 2001 to raise awareness about feral cats, promote Trap Neuter Return, spaying and neutering cats and to recognize the millions of compassionate people who care for them.

At our outreach event, we will be focusing on educating the public on their responsibility to spay and neuter their pets, understanding more about feral cats so they can live in peace and because Astoria has been the location for cat violence and disappearances we will also be posting the Astoria 7’s fliers on the attack on cats that have been occurring and how they can help put an end to them.

Please join us for an event dedicated to helping a much beloved and equally misunderstood animal, the scrappy, beautiful feral cat.

WHAT: The Animals’ Battalion:  National Feral Cat Day Educational Outreach Event

WHERE: 31st St. & Ditmars Blvd. southwest corner, Astoria, Queens, NY 11105

WHEN: Saturday, October 17th, 2015

TIME: 1 ~ 3pm

More and more people celebrate National Feral Cat Day® each year. Since 2011, more than 1,000 National Feral Cat Day events have taken place—spreading the word and helping feral cats all over the country—and even outside of the U.S. with international events! We can’t wait for you to reach even more people with National Feral Cat Day® this year!

www.astoria7.org

#FeralCatDay
results.name: The Animals’ Battalion - National Feral Cat Day Educational Outreach

results.description:
Learn to Salsa New York Style with Yrma Arias at El Taller! This style of Salsa, "On 2", has gained popularity over the last decade in NYC. The classes will focus on the look and feel of the dance - with an emphasis on timing, footwork and partner work. Classes will provide instruction and repetition of the steps ‘Shines’, introduce the importance of the leader/follower connection, and provide practical techniques for the Latin Motion. Particular attention is paid to rhythm and musicality. This is an enjoyable class designed for people of all ages. The most important lesson is to have fun! What to bring: A great attitude and comfortable clothes and shoes that allow you to move!

When you arrive at 215 E. 99th Street, press the El T button on the intercom and we'll buzz you right in!

results.description:
We will be discussing the Law of Thought from Spiritual Laws that Govern Humanity and the Universe.


You can download the book for free here:

https://www.rosicrucian.org/rosicrucian-books-spiritual-laws

It is important for us as students of spirituality and mysticism to become aware and acquainted with the tremendous resources that are available to us to make our lives more harmonious.


Once we learn to tap these inner resources, living will be an invigorating affair continuing and picking up where we left off in previous life experiences and thereby advancing and expanding the consciousness.

We need to keep foremost in our consciousness certain principles, conditions and laws to gain access to spiritual tools and to arrive at permanent solutions to life's challenges.

Through lectures, participation in meditation, and visualization exercises, we will be given the opportunity to experience the value of discussing these principles in a group setting.

(www.facebook.com/Spiritual.Laws)
results.name: Discuss The Law of Thought

results.description:
** Saturday Afternoon Open Play/Clinic Combos**

We now offer, Beginner, Intermediate and occasionally Advanced, Saturday afternoon Combined Open Play/Clinics for the UNBELIEVABLE PRICE of $14.00 for a 3 hr. Session!

An Open Play/Clinic! What’s that?........It is our unique creation! Three hours of Open Play and Clinic combined! Here’s how it works. 3 teams of 8 players each alternate playing games on one of our 2 main courts at Brandeis H.S. (84th st. bet Columbus & Amsterdam) Now get this, while the third team is out, instead of sitting around, that team gets a clinic (8 players to one coach) on our back court at Brandeis with a top instructor. When the two teams finish their game on the main court, one comes off for instruction. Meanwhile, the players that just received instruction take what they just learned and use it in the next game. This rotation continues for 3 hrs! It is a great way to meet new players and improve your skills at the same time.  It is an absolutely unbelievable deal!

***Please note- RSVP'g on Meetup will not reserve your spot. Please go to our website to sign up.*** A credit card payment is required to reserve your space.

http://nyurban.com/open-play-registration-vb/?filter_id=1&gametypeid=1

results.description:
This is a longer hike, but we’ll keep it at reasonable pace, with one or two breaks. I'm guessing anyone who can survive a long walk, equipped with water and proper shoes should be able to do it.


Please do your best to be there at Seeley’s Pond Parking Lot no later than 1:30 – Depending on the time we hit the trail, average speed, breaks, etc. the Ending Time might change (it’s a rough estimate).


This is a free event. Parking does not cost anything. Only expectation is that you come prepared and positive so everyone will have a great time.

PS: there will be a separate event for an after-hike Chill & Grill - feel welcome to join as well.


Adding all of the disclaimer mumbo jumbo here (Tears): 

BRING WATER! Suggested 2 Liters minimum (we reserve the right to bench you if you don't have this key life saving liquid on hand). 

PROPER FOOTWEAR: Hiking shoes recommended, but sneakers are generally okay in the reservation. 

SNACKS: Peter is planning on 8 miles. If you start feeling fatigued, you're going to be soooo happy that you packed wisely. PLUS we have the grill & chill after...

WEATHER: It's getting cold, check the forecast and wear enough layers. 

R.S.V.P.s: Please be courteous. It's extremely frustrating to get started late waiting on people who never show. Life happens, just let us know!

Tears' cell:[masked] (text preferred)

Note that this is a member-run meetup: no one is responsible for you but you. Your event host is not responsible for you or any injuries that could occur on trails with roots, rocks, gullies, etc. Don't expect anyone to have first aid knowledge, supplies, or water for you. Just a bunch of like-minded people enjoying the trails together! For more details see section 6.2 of http://www.meetup.com/terms/

results.description:
Mandatory Reading Assignment : The Spiritual Problem of Modern Man  (only 21 pages)

This essay is located in Volume 10, from the Bollingen Series (translated by RFC Hull). Volume 10 is entitled, "Civilization in Translation".

It can also be found in an anthology of Jung's essay entitled, "Modern Man in Search of a Soul."

Author : Carl G. Jung

I was seduced by a lecture from Edward Edinger.

Lets read the essay  (only 21 pages) and discuss it.

Here is a PDF file (I hope it works) :  http://docslide.us/documents/c-g-jung-the-spiritual-problem-of-modern-man-1928pdf.html

And feel free to listen to the Edinger Talk too :  http://www.kovakevenna.co.uk/individuation-edward-edinger/

results.description:
PLEASE READ THE INFORMATION BELOW CAREFULLY, ESPECIALLY THE BOLD TYPE.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". There is no need to post why you can't make the event. Thank you.

If you have any questions for me, please contact me through my private Meetup inbox. The organizer for this Meetup event is John, who is listed on the top of the "going list" with a photograph. Thank you again.

We won't be walking inside of Green-Wood Cemetery. We are meeting on the public sidewalk at the southeast corner of 25th Street and 5th Avenue, Brooklyn, NY (this is just outside of the entrance to the cemetery) and then we'll be walking away from the cemetery. We will be walking about one mile to the studios in Industry City.

Description: Industry City Open Studios (which is at the waterfront in Sunset Park, Brooklyn) has about 100 participating artists, builders, makers, and designers. These artists, builders, makers, and designers are opening their doors to the public and showing their work. They don't charge admission to their studios. We'll stop in some of these studios and get a rare, intimate view of the working environment of artists, builders, makers, and designers. We can also talk to the artists and manufacturers about what they do. The artwork will feature painting, photography, ceramics, and mixed-media. In addition, some of Brooklyn's most cutting-edge manufacturers (including chocolatiers, furniture makers and paper products) will be showing their manufacturing process.  

Below is titled "My Trees" by Gil Bar-Fur.

Below is titled "The Stallion" by Gary Oshust.

Below are titled "Morocco/Sea" by Amitrano Design.

Cost: The cost of this event is $2 per person, which is paid at the start of the walk. This is for the organizer's Meetup preparation costs and fees.

Meeting Time: The meeting time is (after lunch) at 1:45 PM.

Meeting Place: The meeting place is on the public sidewalk at the southeast corner (at the bench) of 25th Street and 5th Avenue, Brooklyn, New York. This is just outside of the short roadway that leads to the main gatehouse entrance to Green-Wood Cemetery. 

Below is outside the entrance to Green-Wood Cemetery.

Before the walk, restrooms are available inside of Green-Wood Cemetery (Walk down the short roadway to the main gate entrance to Green-Wood Cemetery, go through the main cemetery gatehouse, make a right turn, and walk down the stone pathway to the low modern-style building with the wood doors.)

Transportation: Take the "R" subway train to 25th Street and 4th Avenue. (Remember that the "R" subway train is a local train, so give yourself some extra time.)Then walk east one long block and meet on the public sidewalk at the southeast corner of 25th Street and 5th Avenue, Brooklyn, New York (before going on Green-Wood Cemetery's property).

Finishing Time/Place: This art walk will finish at about 5:00 PM at the  subway station for the "R" train on 36th Street and 4th Avenue. 

This walk can be up to 4 or 5 miles, which includes walking to (about one mile)and from (less than one half of a mile) Industry City and walking around the complex in Industry City,  which is 30- acres and has 16 original buildings.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". There is no need to post why you can't make the event. Thank you.

Only heavy rain will cancel this walk. Therefore, if it is heavy rain, I will post a cancellation notice on Saturday morning. If I don't post a cancellation notice, I plan to be at the meeting place. If it is raining, I will just bring an umbrella. (We will be spending half the time inside these artist studios anyway. Plus, this event is held only once a year, so there is no rain date to reschedule it.) If I do cancel this walk, I will also post it in the Discussion Board.

Below is titled "What's that Sheen" by Cara Enteles.

Below is titled "Chihuahua" by Deborah Czeresko.

Below is by Erin Rachel Hudak.

Below is titled "Selenity Luna" by Allison Merz.
results.name: Industry City Open Studio Walk - Sunset Park, Brooklyn (Oct. 17)

results.description:
This is a moderate to challenging 6 mile hike in Hartshorne State Park in Highlands, NJ. It should last 2 hours and will NOT be leisurely. Come appropriate, with hiking shoes/ decent sneakers, layered clothing, hat, hydration, and a positive attitude for a great time. Please be ready to keep pace. I leave no one behind, and there is absolutely no criticism on my hikes. We all start and end together. :) 

We'll be meeting at the Rocky Point trailhead, located at 200 Portland Ave, Highlands, for an 4p step off. I'll be arriving to the parking lot in a black Ford Escape with army stickers on the back window approx. 15 mins ahead to do a little bit of stretching (recommended).

We have a really nice time getting our heart pumping and always great conversations throughout. Please, however, leave your four-legged friends home for this one. In the event of unfavorable weather, look for an update the morning of. A little snow is ok, but nobody enjoys monsoons. Looking forward to seeing you all there! Please post any questions in the thread. NOTE: If you arrive at 2:01p, you should be able to catch up to us. ;)

After the hike, for those who are interested, we'll be heading to Applebee's, 1183 New Jersey 35, Middletown, NJ 07748, for food and beverages.  

DISCLAIMER: If you join us for this event, please understand that you are responsible for your own (and your guest's) preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. Your attendance to this event signifies that you have read and accepted the terms of this liability waiver.
results.how_to_find_us: The park entrance is up the road from 200 Portland. Just continue up the road another 1/4 mile. If you need additional help, call Rob @ 908-420-3421

10v10, 75min+ game. Arrive early to warm up, and be ready to start at 2:00pm.


ALL players need to bring a white and black t-shirt and  ball.


It's a large field and some players may need the option to sub. If you're a dedicated goalkeeper let us know - Intermediate level up.


****************************************************************

DETAILS:

• Played in a friendly environment. Pass the ball have fun.

• No rough tackles or play. Players are expected to bring a positive attitude, no screaming at/or berating team mates.

•  BRING A BALL. If you hit a ball into the river, you'll need to replace it!  If there aren't any dedicated goalkeepers playing, we rotate in goal every 5 mins.

• No metal cleats. Only turf or molded cleats.

• If you arrive late, pls wait until a break in the game. Inserting players in the middle of the game disrupts the flow, and it's not fair to those that arrive on time.


Payment goes toward field permit, equipment and fees.

See you at the pitch!


Note: The is a 2/3 regulation size field with full size goals. Not suitable for beginner level or inexperienced players.

By joining this group and attending events you agree to the Waiver Of Liability.

results.description:
Image: From the left, Congress of Racial Equality (CORE) workers Doris Rutledge, Gene Pinkston, Judith Benninger (Brown), and Ira Simmons, Gadsden County, Florida, August 1964.

LOCATION TBD. From The National Women's Liberation website: 

This workshop is for women to learn about the roots of the Women's Liberation Movement in the Civil Rights and Black Power Movements—and how this history can be used today.


What were the positive lessons that gave women the tools to attack male supremacy?How did Black women lead in the Women’s Liberation Movement and why is this not known?What did Black organizers tell white women that caused them to organize for Women’s Liberation?

Please e-mail <a></a>[masked] to reserve your spot and so that we can email you the readings in advance. Space is limited so be sure to email and reserve your spot today. (If you do not e-mail in advance, you will not get the readings and we cannot guarantee you a spot). 

A $10 donation will be requested at the workshop.

 More on the workshop

With the growing movement against racist police murders and the rise of Black Lives Matter, we think it's a good moment to correct the myths about the history of Women’s Liberation and Black Liberation, and study the lessons from this vital relationship for our organizing now.

Instructor: Jenny Brown has been organizing for Women’s Liberation for 25 years, with Gainesville (Florida) Women’s Liberation, Redstockings, and National Women’s Liberation.  She is co-author of the Redstockings book Women’s Liberation and National Health Care: Confronting the Myth of America, and an author of Labor Notes book How to Jump-Start Your Union: Lessons from the Chicago Teachers.

This workshop is originally part of the 10-week class, Building Women's Liberation Now: Gems from the 60s and 70s for Activist Use Today, we offered last year in cooperation with Redstockings (www.redstockings.org).  Please let us know if you would be interested in taking the 10-week class--we will offer it again if there is enough interest.
results.how_to_find_us: Location TBA.
results.name: Workshop: Roots of Women's Liberation in the Civil Rights Movement

10v10 teams, 75min+ game. Arrive early and be ready to go on time at 2:15pm - Intermediate level up.

Lower East Side, nr East River Park. 8-10 min walk from Delancey Street F train, head east along Houston, the field is south of Houston. Map here.

Details:

1) Teams divide into equal ability - players are welcome to signup with friends.

2) No metal cleats. Turf shoes / molded cleats only. Wear proper Soccer attire.

3) Played in a fun and chill environment. Rough play, tackles, or sliding are not tolerated.

4) If no dedicated goalkeepers, all players need to rotate in goal. Full size goals.

5) If you arrive late wait until a break in the game. Inserting players in the middle of the game disrupts the flow- it's not fair to those that arrive on time.


All players must RSVP and make payment before game time, this goes toward  field permits, equipment, meetup & CC fees.

CANCELLATIONS/REFUNDS:

Our first meeting will be full of introductions. Who we are, what we're looking to get out of the workshop and what kind of additions to each meeting we think would be helpful—aside from the discussion and critiquing of each other's work. 

Without having read each other's work beforehand writers will be asked to read aloud three minutes or so from a story they've brought with them. After each three-minute reading we’ll critique what we've heard by saying what we like, why we liked it as well as what we thought needed work. You know, workshopping :)

results.description:
More info to follow soon...


Lainway Corn Maze has partnered with Universal Pictures to feature a CRIMSON PEAK themed corn maze to coincide with their upcoming release of Horror Master Guillermo del Toro's new film. The 5 acre corn maze has been designed to mirror one of the official CRIMSON PEAK poster images!

www.facebook.com/lainwaycornmaze

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crimson_Peak

CRIMSON PEAK film synopsis:


In the aftermath of a family tragedy, an aspiring author is torn between love for her childhood friend and the temptation of a mysterious outsider. Trying to escape the ghosts of her past, she is swept away to a house that breathes, bleeds...and remembers.

The film officially opens the night before our event. However, for those that RSVP to come with us to the Corn Maze, you'll be Personally Invited to attend a special free pre-release screaming of it on Tuesday, October 13th, with Guaranteed Seats!

There will be other CRIMSON PEAK themed giveaways at our event too. There's also a Minion designed kid's maze, petting zoo, movie trivia, u-pick pumpkins, food, drinks, and picnic areas available.

Because I'm friends with Brett, the owner of the farm, he's letting us camp out for the night on their property instead of driving back to Madhattan! There are port-o-potties to drop your loads in, but no running water, as this isn't a campground, it's Brett's farm. However, we CAN have a barrel fire, just like in Rocky! Also, there is a kool local bar that is literally across the street from the farm that we can walk to. Sounds a bit dangerous to me...


www.WesttownBrewworks.com

Don't forget to come see if ghosts are real Friday's and Saturday's for our flashlight nights, and see if you can make it thru our corn maze in the dark! AND NEW THIS YEAR… Lainway Corn Maze is proud to present ZOMBIE PAINTBALL. Climb up onto the Zombie Combat Vehicle and help us rid the farm of the zombie population before they take over!!

https://youtu.be/mrTEciMrEcU

** This video is from a DIFFERENT Zombie Paintball place, but it's similar to what to expect here at Lainway. They don't have a video yet because this is the first year they'll be doing it. Who knows, maybe we can be in their first promo video...


https://youtu.be/4zBlG8Lv01k

results.description:
Basic Ground Rules for Participation


• no need to respond at all if you can't/don't want to play

• if you do respond IN, please come unless something really urgent comes up (hangovers or better offers from your cooler friends not accepted for absences!)


• If you suck at Ultimate... you are more than welcome. This is open to ALL skill levels, ages etc. If you're really good, please pretend you suck every once in a while for the benefit of the rest of us! We're just here to run around and have fun. We all want to score and win but if you want to win at all costs, this is not the game for you.

• The trick with this group is making sure we have enough to play, so those who do show up don't waste a trip, so please make the effort this year to be honest with yourself and us about if you can/want to come down so we can make the right call for GAME ON or GAME OFF. If you are a "maybe" please indicate that via the comment section with a brief explanation (ie 80% chance I'll be there...). If you RSVP and are then unable to attend, please update your RSVP as soon as possible.

What is Ultimate Frisbee? In a nutshell <borrowed from Wiki> :

Ultimate is a limited-contact team field sport played with a disc (frisbee). Points are scored by passing the disc to a teammate in the opposing end zone. Other basic rules are that players must not take steps while holding the disc (maintain a pivot), and interceptions and incomplete passes are turnovers.

Closest analogy I could come up with = a mix of basketball and football, but played with a frisbee. You do not need to be an expert frisbee player/thrower etc. - it's all about having fun.
results.name: Saturday Ultimate Frisbee (Anderson Park)

When your arrive ask for Daniel, who'll introduce you to other members of the group. From there, you can order some food/drink or you can simply get started on playing your favorite board / card/ trivia games.


As for the room layout, there will be a number of different "Board Game" stations which are tables with different board games already set up - all you will have to do is pick a station and wait for some more players, or simply join a game already in progress!

There will also be some open tables for people who would like to bring their own games - feel free to bring your favorite.

results.description:
Organizer`s phone number[masked] Katherine

We are living in the city with the most interesting museums of the world so let`s explore them!

This weekend we are going to a guided tour in Metropolitan Museum that will cost you only 1 dollar! How cool is that? You have to remember you need to come earlier around 330pm or 345 to buy 1 dollar pass and drop your coat to the coat check, use the restroom. Please take care of your comfort beforehand. The tour starts at 4pm sharp and lasts for an hour. Please don’t be late! Make sure you have comfortable shoes and able to walk and stand for an hour or so. When we finish we can go for a drink and introduce ourselves, discuss the tour, get new ideas and meet the new friends.  It is very inspiring for many creative people and very relaxing from daily routine.  Everybody is welcome!

The tour is called “Museum Highlights” meaning that the professional tour guide will show us up to 10 different objects in the museum in different rooms which represent different civilizations and cultures.  For example, one painting is from Medieval Period, furniture from France, wooden Tatum from Oceania, Tiffany stainless glass from Modern American art, Byzantine mosaic, Tapestry from Rome, the dish from Islamic Art, painting of Pollock from The Modern art and so forth. This way you will see many items at once and choose wisely what kind of art you are interested the most at the moment.  Tours are never the same! That means that you can take the same “Museum Highlights” tour over and over again. The professional tour guide will tell us the origins, the history, the interesting facts of the items, and we will be able to ask all kinds of questions.

After the tour you don’t have to stay with the group but continue exploration on your own.  The Museum is open until 9pm.

The meeting point: the spot under the clock on your left hand side when you walk into museum.  All the groups are gathering there. Just wait for a 4 pm tour.
results.name: The Treasures of Metropolitan Museum. Guided Tour. $1 Tour!

The tour starts at 4pm sharp and lasts for an hour. Please don’t be late! Make sure you have comfortable shoes and able to walk and stand for an hour or so. When we finish we can go for a drink and introduce ourselves, discuss the tour, get new ideas and meet the new friends.  It is very inspiring for many creative people and very relaxing from daily routine.  Everybody is welcome!

The tour is called “Museum Highlights” meaning that the professional tour guide will show us up to 10 different objects in the museum in different rooms which represent different civilizations and cultures.  For example, one painting is from Medieval Period, furniture from France, wooden Tatum from Oceania, Tiffany stainless glass from Modern American art, Byzantine mosaic, Tapestry from Rome, the dish from Islamic Art, painting of Pollock from The Modern art and so forth. This way you will see many items at once and choose wisely what kind of art you are interested the most at the moment.  Tours are never the same! That means that you can take the same “Museum Highlights” tour over and over again. The professional tour guide will tell us the origins, the history, the interesting facts of the items, and we will be able to ask all kinds of questions.

After the tour you don’t have to stay with the group but continue exploration on your own.  The Museum is open until 9pm.

The meeting point: the spot under the clock on your left hand side when you walk into museum.  All the groups are gathering there. Just wait for a 4 pm tour.
results.name: This Saturday! The Treasures of Metropolitan Museum. Guided Tour. $1 tour!

results.description:
MEET REBEKAH!
Intro talk about shamanism and the power of cacao.
Friday Oct 16th at 7pm
Local Thyme
40th & Madison

A cacao ceremony gives us sacred time and space for ourselves in a hectic and stressful world. It is the perfect to switch off from the outside chaos and journey into the silence within, so that we can become clearer on who we are, where we are going, and the opportunities available to us.

Whether you’re looking for help shifting an emotional blockage, letting go of the past, finding your way, or you simply need to lift your spirits, this ceremony can provide the focus you need to re-align and get back on track.

Once our intentions have been set we will drink the Cacao medicine and then settle in deep silence while Rebekah will expertly guide you to meet the Cacao goddess, where you will spend time with her, as she dissolves stale energy blockages, and reveals the answers and guidance you seek.

This is a special and powerfully shamanic plant medicine journey that takes you to the heart of Cacao so that you can connect more deeply and profoundly with who you are in a loving, blissful and gentle process.

It is a unique experience and the effects last a good two or three days.

Where: YoGanesh Yoga
208 W 29th St,
New York, NY 10001

When: Saturday October 17

Time: 4-8:00 pm

Cost: $40 prepaid/ $45 at the door

*Limited to 24 participants

Please RSVP via paypal: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=HN8C2Q5UGHCSL


Testimonials:

"I wanted to say thank you for an amazing introduction to cacao. I floated out of the place and spent the rest of the day feeling completely blissed out. Today I'm a lot more grounded thankfully but still feeling chilled and happy which is always a bonus The afternoon was just what I needed and the guidance, whilst nothing I didn't know, was very timely (as it always is) :)" -Lou O'Connell

"Many thanks for an amazing ceremony tonight. Very deep flow;)" -Julia Engulfing

"Thank you for this beautiful and remarkable experience. It was wonderful to me and you're such a wonderful soul, emanating such enlightening energy." -Dee

"I have enjoyed the Cacao ceremony immensely. Rebekah is an authentic and lively facilitator and I felt held and loved an her presence. Her instructions and guidance were unbiased and transparent and the true
passion shone through her in the way she spoke, moved and related to participants." -Agnieszka Agni Grenckowska

"I have just spent a wonderful afternoon with Rebekah at a Cacao ceremony and what a wonderful experience it has been. Rebekah is open and personal, her guidance and advise is logical yet empathetic, with no airy fairy talk. I left feeling empowered, centred and more connected with my inner self and world around me, her support during the journey is priceless. Always a magnificent experience and divine timing." -Valentina

Rebekah Shaman Bio:

For over seventeen years I have worked very closely with the three feminine plant medicines, Ayahuasca, Cannabis and Cacao. From[masked], I apprenticed with a traditional Amazonian Peruvian Ayahuasquero Shaman. From[masked], I was founder and director of Hemp Global Solutions Ltd, growing hemp research crops and educating on the importance of this crop for medicine, nutrition, fuel and shelter, and since 2013 work ceremonially using cacao.

I facilitate traditional Ayahuasca ceremonies in the Peruvian Amazon, run regular shamanic cacao ceremonies, retreats, events and workshops throughout UK and Europe, and I also run a shamanic practice in London, offering shamanic journeys, coaching and empowerment readings.

I have a BA (Hons) in Study of Religions, and MSc in Development Economics, both from SOAS university, and a Post-graduate Psychology Diploma in the Human Givens Approach. I am also the author of the self-published book ‘The Shaman’s Last Apprentice.’


Sarah Eve is a culinary shaman, making magic in the kitchen and healing from the heart. She is a certified Usui Reiki master and practicing shaman with a deep love of the healing arts. Sarah Eve began her shamanic studies with Izhak Beery and followed with the late Ipupiara, a Makunaiman of the Ure-e-wau-wau Amazonian tribe. She has completed workshops with Tom Cowan and the 13 Indigenous Grandmothers. The path of healing also led her to work closely with the Santo Daime community, John of God, and crystal energy work in Brazil. Other international trips including Mexico and Central America, Europe, Israel, and Southeast Asia, she encountered sacred spiritual practices and healers in which she is blessed to share and teach. She completed her 200 & 500 hour yoga training with Sri Dharma Mittra. Integrating her experience also as a vegan chef, she uses food as another medicinal tool in achieving whole body health. She assists in creating a safe space in which you can heal you. www.sarahevecardell.com

All events presented are copyright. Copyright © 2015 Sarah Eve Cardell. All rights reserved. Cardell. All rights reserved.

results.description:
A recreational tap class for adults in a bar! 21+

4:00 pm Lesson I (perfect for beginners)

5:00 pm Lesson II (more advanced, tap shoes required)

$10 for one session, $17 for both!

$1 off all drinks at the bar. 
Please arrive 5-10 min before session to sign-in and get a drink.

If you have never tapped before or if it's been a while since you have, please come to Session I. This session introduces you to tap basics such as shuffles and flaps and then puts these skills into a fun, easy combination. (This can also be used as a warm-up for Session II). If you don't have tap shoes, please wear or bring closed-toe shoes such as sneakers.

If you own tap shoes and have at least a basic knowledge of tap fundamentals, you are welcome to attend Session II. This session moves faster than Session I and uses more advanced steps such as drawbacks and pullbacks in a fun, more advanced combination.

If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to ask!

results.description:
Hi everyone!

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up. Also, please bring a white t-shirt, a red t-shirt, lots of water and be ready to have fun!

We also created a map of the field location since it can be tricky to find: Field Location Map.


If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!


Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

No ball hogging

The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:Field F in Central Park  can be accessed from west 97th street or east 97th street on either side Central Park. We also created a map of the field location since it can be tricky to find: Field Location Map

Directions: By train: From the West side take the B or C to 96th street stop. From the east side take the 6 train to 96th street stop St.

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals: If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee: Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring: A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. Please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds: If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for a future game. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will receive an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has openned up:). Please RSVP as soon as you get that e-mail since everyone on the waiting list will get the same e-mail. The first person who RSVP's takes the spot! Also check our Calendar for other games

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Welcome!

If you love to play basketball, but height is not your advantage, come out and play with people who aren't excessively tall! In the tradition of Spud Webb, anyone under 5'8", male or female, is welcome to join us on the court. We'll get some teams together and play some competitive, but relaxed bball-- and without any giant hands in our faces! :-p

We rent out the gym from 5:00-8:00pm. Please arrive at least 5-10 minutes early as the sooner everyone arrives, the sooner we can begin playing. Note that all games stop at 7:45pm as we have to be out of the gym by 8:00pm. (If you get there late, please only ring the bell once. It is very loud! And it takes us a few minutes to get downstairs.) The gym is on the 10th fl. & has adjoining bathrooms, lockers, and water fountains.

We'll hit up McSwiggans (393 2nd Avenue @ 23rd St) later! Don't forget:

* You must be no more than 5'8" to play!

* You must RSVP on the site in order to attend!

* You will be asked to sign a waiver for 2014 as we're not a litigious group. If you have any problems with the prepay, just shoot one of the organizers an email.

Here are the basic rules we follow for games: 1. Play by ones and twos to 11 - win by one point.

2. Make it - take it.

3. Backcourt if the ball hits the rim or backboard. Air balls are fair game to put right back up.

4. Jump balls/disputed calls will be determined by a three pointer since the laws of basketball physics are very clear that "the ball never lies."

5. Walls, half-court line, and ceiling are out of bounds. 6. Subs will enter the game no later than 6 points in (once one of the teams reaches 6 points). The sub will start the following game. Teams will regulate themselves but let's make sure everyone plays.

See you on the court! B-)

***NOTE***

In an effort for us to reduce overcrowding and to maintain a more accurate estimate of how many people to expect, please sign up online if you intend to play. There is a waiting list if all spots have been taken. We ask that you please just do not show up unannounced as you will kindly be asked to turned away. Also feel free to bring your own basketball for shoot-around. And don't forget to clip your nails prior to game day. We tried playing with Edward Scissorhands once - it didn't turn out so well.

results.description:
PICK-UP CO-ED SOCCER GAMES @ CHELSEA PARK  

                                     Check our Facebook page:

          facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer


                                NO CLEATS OR STUDS ALLOWED

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cR_TuiCA8RM

GAME DESCRIPTION:

Our games are for all levels and people that prefer to play a non-competitive game of soccer, break a sweat while exercising running up and down the field with the ball and all this happening in a very laid-back and non-judgmental environment. Please, arrive 10 minutes before the game so we can get the teams set up.

Game Format:

We'll play three simultaneous games of 8 on 8, with small goals. There will be 6 teams on the field and we will play THREE games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team. Please check our meetup message board on Friday night or before 12.00 pm on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.

No power shots allowed. No power shots means; you can shoot the ball but not as hard as you can. This doesn't mean that you can not take the shot at all. Kicking the ball or taking the shot on the goal, is of course allowed.

***If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.***

If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game and maybe a two game ban.

Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Location:

CHELSEA PARK.

Between 27th and 28th street and 10th Avenue.

Take A, C or E to 23rd St and 8th Ave and walk to 10th Ave and 27th St or any subway line to 34th St and Penn Station and walk for about 8 minutes to 28th St and 10th Ave.

What to bring with you:

A pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes, shin guards (recommended) and lots of water. There is a water fountain next to the park if you need extra water.

Fee:

You will be asked to pay $9.25 when you RSVP. This $9.25 is used to pay for, facilities permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, goals, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled. The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll go to Molly Wee for a pint or two:

                             Molly Wee Restaurant

                                       402 8th Ave, 

                                 New York, NY 10001

                                    (212)[masked]

                            PLEASE CHECK THEIR MENU!

                                      themollywee.com

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

results.description:
*Check out CNY's first Kickstarter Campaign!


----

A Conversation About Happiness

Alternating Hosts: George & Michael Y

</a> CitiCorp Atrium Lower Level
153 E 53rd street (Between Lexington and 3rd ave)

From 5:00pm-7:30pm (it's okay to arrive late or leave early.). Look for our red Meetup Sign.

Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! The theory behind these events comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group. It's important that our events be fun! So with that in mind, let's get serious about ramping up our enjoyment of life!

At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps (see photo) leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

<a href="http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.335.9655&rep=rep1&type=pdf">Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages

HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

No ball hogging

The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:Field F in Central Park  can be accessed from west 97th street or east 97th street on either side Central Park. We also created a map of the field location since it can be tricky to find: Field Location Map

Directions: By train: From the West side take the B or C to 96th street stop. From the east side take the 6 train to 96th street stop St.

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals: If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Paul

I thought it would be fun thing for the month of October to explore some of the darker arts and sides of various genres. We will be exploring and drawing from the darker side of Fantasy. From darkly savage warriors and orcs, to those mystical creatures who dwell in the dark forests, to witches, warlocks, and even the vast cryptic empire of the undead! We will explore and draw anything relating the darker side of the Fantasy genre.

The meetup will be split into three parts: First sketches and warm-up exercises/conceptual discussion, then an hour and a half drawing your chosen idea and design, lastly we'll discuss each others drawings, ideas, and the theme as a group.

So don't forget to bring your supplies and sketchbook as this meetup is going to be drawing focused! 

Also if you'd like to share anything such as art or reference books with the group relating to the theme I urge you to bring them!

You can find me at the tables on the second floor of the Cranberry Cafe.

I hope to see you there and having fun participating in this new style of meetup and exercising or developing your drawing and conceptual skills with other imaginative artists throughout NYC. Any skill level and any style is welcomed!

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$5 Draft Beers, House Wine, Well Mixed Drink


PAYMENT POLICY:
$27 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
"I'd recommend this for all beginners and people looking to gain confidence in their skills. Simon has a great attitude, clear and informative way of communicating, and the class goes at a pace that was engaging and never dull." Lagina P.

Beginner's Drawing at The Metropolitan Museum of Art

* This Meetup is structured as a drawing class. It is limited to 7 students. 

This class is for you if you are relatively new to drawing and want direction on how to proceed. This class is for beginners and for people who consider themselves beginners.

Each student receives personal instruction and technical advice based on their drawings during the session. 

The Class:

1) We begin with a short lecture in The American Wing.  We discuss the different pencils and paper as well as system of drawing simple forms to represent the 3 Dimensional world. 

2) Together we head into the galleries to work on our first drawing exercise. I will sit with each student to discuss their work and make sure the lesson is understood and effective.

3) We meet briefly to discuss our work, ask any questions and get our next exercise. 

4) We set out to draw again. And again I visit with each student to talk about their work. 

5) Finally we meet to discuss what we have learned and answer any final questions. 

Material Requirements: Students should bring a drawing pad, a 2H pencil, a HB pencil, a 4B pencil, an eraser and a pencil sharpener. 


If you have any questions please feel free to email me. 

Simon

_______________________________________________

Please note: this event is not affiliated with The Metropolitan Museum of Art.

Museum admission is not included in the event cost. Museum tickets are suggested only and you may pay as much as little as you wish.
results.how_to_find_us: The American Wing - Gallery 700 - We meet at the fountain.
results.name: Beginner: Drawing at The Metropolitan Museum of Art

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27- PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
Teams are 7v7, 60min+ game. New turf at the majestic Grand St Field.


Arrive early and be ready to start on time. All players should bring a white and black t-shirt.

***********************************************************

Details:

1) Teams divide into equal ability - players are welcome to signup with friends.

2) No metal cleats. Turf shoes or molded cleats. Proper Soccer attire only.

3) Played in a fun and chill environment. Rough play, tackles, or sliding are not tolerated. Pass the ball have fun.

4) If no dedicated goalkeepers, players rotate in goal.


5) If you arrive late wait until a break in the game. Inserting players in the middle of the game disrupts the flow- it's not fair to those that arrive on time.

All players must RSVP, payment goes toward light rentals, field permits, equipment and fees.

CANCELLATIONS/REFUNDS:

You'll need to update your RSVP 24 hours before the match, to receive a credit for the next game. This is so other members have a chance to take your place.

See you at the pitch!

By joining this group and attending events you agree to the Waiver Of Liability.

results.description:
STARTING: on the steps of Brooklyn Borough President building, we will walk down Atlantic Avenue to Brooklyn Bridge Park and catch the sunset then head over the Brooklyn Bridge at night for spectacular views of the city. Check out the photos from the last time we did this walk. We had an amazing time! 

WHEN: The meeting time is 6 pm. We will hang out and get to know each other for 30 minutes before we head out on this amazing walk. 

WHAT TO EXPECT: Date Walks are very casual and easy-to-attend/non-awkward and the host Beau is always there to make introductions. It’s really easy to meet people.  

SUBWAY: As you can see from this link, there are tons of subway station stops encompassing this meetup location. The N/R Court Street stop, the 2/3 Borough Hall stop, the 4/5 Borough Hall stop, and the A/C/F Jay Street stop. 

DISTANCE: From point A to B is a little over 3 miles.

PACE: The pace of this walk will be a casual stroll. 

RAIN DATE: If it rains this walk will be postponed to a future date. 

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call. 

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer

Email: [masked] 
Date Walking | Facebook­ | Twitter­

results.description:
HETEP is an Egyptian word for being calm and content within the self.
Healing Touch Program gathers a community of people who want to communicate love, respect, and compassion through the language of healing touch. They care to keep improving their ‘touch intelligence’ so as to be aware of another’s needs and boundaries. 

A HETEP GATHERING starts with an invocation to the Elements and the various aspects of the Mother Goddess. The space created is sacred and safe for all of us to share our experiences - our thoughts and feelings, our presence, and the rhythms of our breathing as we participate in the expansion of our touch perception.

This event is expanding now to include everyone interested in evolving their 'touch intelligence'. It has been a monthly women's gathering and a wonderful opportunity to share and celebrate our intention, strength, and life experience!

You're invited to join this ongoing class at any time. It is 'by donation', because your healing presence is the most important material you can contribute! So please come and donate your body to the science of healing - we will return it renewed and energized. 

Every gathering starts with an introduction of ourselves in a circle. You will be introduced to this simple healing touch method. We will practice on each other on the floor lined with yoga mats and blankets. You may want to wear comfortable clothes and bring a yoga mat. This program is designed for every body shape and sensory ability - or sensitivity! 

HETEP facilitator, Karuna Ma has been introduced to healing touch very early in life. Since 1998, qualified as a Reiki Master Healer and Seichim Master Teacher. Seichim energy is sometimes called 'Egyptian Kundalini' as it is great at assisting a breakthrough experience for both physical and psychic well-being. Since her training in 2001, Karuna has been working as a massage therapist, energy and sound healer.
results.name: HETEP Healing Touch Program

This event is free and open to public: the Amateur Astronomers Association of New York will holds its 2015 Autumn Urban Starfest. They will have over twenty telescopes that you can gaze through and check the planets, stars, nebulae and other night objects. 

Amazing views of the heavens brought to you by the AAA and the Urban Park Rangers lead by Sgt. Sunny Carrao. 

Free and open to the public! All ages welcome.
Free raffles! 
Free gift bags and glow sticks! 
Free registration!

Guests of honor for Urban Starfest 2015 include: David Eicher, Editor-In-Chief Astronomy Magazine, Al Nagler, Founder TeleVue Optics, David Gaynes, Documentarian and Director of “Saving Hubble”.
More updates to follow.


For more details:  www.AAA.org

results.description:
Let's go see Bridge of Spies at the Alamo DraftHouse on Saturday Oct 17th - for the 7:15 pm showing. This film has been getting great buzz and i want to see it -- and thought others might want to also. We'll go to Alamo so we can have dinner and drinks while we watch the movie, too! 

Please buy your tickets in advance so we can all sit together. I bought at Row 4 seat 12.  Here's the website: https://drafthouse.com/nyc-area/show/bridge-of-spies

PLEASE ARRIVE AROUND 6:45 SO WE CAN GET OUR DRINKS, OUR SEATS, AND ORDER FOOD BEFORE THE MOVIE STARTS...


If you're not into seeing this film there are other films around the same time as well -- check on their website to learn more -- https://drafthouse.com/nyc-area/theater/yonkers

"A crackling Cold War espionage thriller that thrums with suspense and fleet precision."Chris Nashawaty, Entertainment Weekly

A dramatic thriller set against the backdrop of a series of historic events, BRIDGE OF SPIES tells the story of James Donovan, a Brooklyn lawyer who finds himself thrust into the center of the Cold War when the CIA sends him on the near-impossible task to negotiate the release of a captured American U-2 pilot.

Here's a review: If you have been waiting for Spielberg to make yet another fantastic film, look no further. "Bridge of Spies" delivers an extremely powerful (albeit straightforward) story following James Donovan (Tom Hanks), an attorney sent to dispatch a plane to Russia to take photographs. After it is shot down in mid air, the survivor of the plane is then in negotiations to be traded for a supposed Russian Spy they have in custody. With a few more complexions, this film is the perfect amount of smart, witty, and serious. Written by the Coen Brother, Steven Spielberg was able to get quite a bit of comedy out of these actors, while they simultaneously deliver sharp dialogue. Terrific performances, brilliant direction, a story definitely Spielberg worthy, and beautiful cinematography work. If you are a fan of this genre, it is not one to miss. I loved every second of "Bridge of Spies" and I cannot recommend it more. Although, it is definitely not for everyone. It is a bit lengthy, but the pace was perfect in my opinion. After thinking long and hard about what could have been a flaw or issue with this picture, I simply could not think of anything. "Bridge of Spies" is what filmmaking is all about.

Hope to see  you there!

Free and open to the public! All ages welcome.

Guest are welcome to attend and receive Reiki, no prior Reiki experience is required, just be present and open to receive a peaceful and a powerful healing.
